Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: DaveHarnett
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, good location (quiet side street 15 minute walk from the city centre), modern standards, and pretty spacious by Roman standards. Don't pay extra for the breakfast, it's nothing to write home about (especially compared to the great food available all around) but other than that, pretty much perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, Friendly Staff & Big Showers!”
Reviews.Author: lovefoursAbilene
Reviews.Content: We followed TA reviews and were not disappointed in this hotel. The very best of locations in a quaint part of Rome. Larger showers than most, very clean and even a closet! Free WiFi in the lobby. I am picky so trust me on this hotel. Great gelato down at White on the square too! Don't forget to visit the museum of priest bones one street over.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: deborahdorm
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Modigliani, near Piazza Barberini, is a wonderful place to stay while touring Rome. It has very clean, simple, well-equipped rooms in a great location on a quiet side street, a very good breakfast, beautiful public areas with wifi, a lovely terrace garden, and best of all, the friendliest, most helpful staff. We would definitely stay there again. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel in 25 minutes or less. It is near the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, and a short walk from the Villa Borghese park and museums. There is an elevator, and the staff is available all the time, which is not true of all hotels there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely location, lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: Karen T
Reviews.Content: Very sweet, nice hotel in a perfect location with excellent staff, especially Andrea at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected but less than I wanted”
Reviews.Author: E G
Reviews.Content: A travel agent booked me to this hotel and i was glad for the convenience of the location near public transportation. Its true the staff are friendly and the place is spotless, really clean. Only thing was one of the night staff people gave me a message from my guide who was calling to confirm the next days tour but neglected to actually tell me the time confirmation of when we were meeting-turns out there was a miscommunication on our meeting time. Had he told me the message specifically I would have followed up with the guide. (but to be fair, i guess i could have just called the guide back myself) It is on a very quiet street in a nice part of Rome. The breakfast is good, basic, but the pasteries were so bad - and it is so easy to get better ones. After being at other hotels in Italy I realize a super yummy breakfast makes a big difference. Also the bed was incredibly hard, not comfortable. This is a safe choice but I think one could do better. Not sure if i'd stay again, i'd likely look for something more accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: weroruva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. It is very close to everything you need to see in Rome. The staff are very kind and help you with anything you need to visit and go to in Rome! It is amazing, YOU WONT REGRET YOUR STAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Second trip - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: CathYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel - last time 6 years ago we had the flat over the road as we had our son with us - that was great. This time just 2 of us. Our room was very clean and quiet overlooking the courtyard, not lavishly furnished but with a large bathroom. Breakfast was fine - usual continental offerings with variety of options. Hotel staff were very friendly. The location is a real plus point- being within walking distance of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT FIND”
Reviews.Author: DorridgeDennis
Reviews.Content: We found this small hotel via the Alastair Sawday guide and it did not disappoint.it's a stylish,clean,well located and friendly place - a real gem.Our room and bathroom was on the compact size - but the hotel are quite open about this and it did spoil our visit in anyway.We asked for a room with a balcony over the sweet litle courtyard and because we were blessed with really warm sunny weather it was a real bonus. You must eat at the Osteria Bernini - just a few minutes walk from the hotel.the fettucini with truffles was fantastic.We ate there twice and couln't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre P
Reviews.Content: Rome is quite an expensive city when it comes to finding a good place to stay. It all happens in the center of the city, and the center is not very well served by transportation: the bus services is dense yet difficult to master, and the metro is basically running on the outskirts of the city, but not in the city. So the best option is to rely on natural transportation: your legs. Then you have to find an hotel which is in the center, yet quiet enough, and with good value for money: clean, good bed, good breakfast. The Modigliani is an adequate place to stay, it is confortable, the staff is helpful, you have got what you need as a basis to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: maria12345_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Modigliani for 2 nights recently, the staff were wonderful, couldn't do enough to help and assist with our every needs, the hotel room was excellent, the breakfast was excellent, we will return again and will recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot”
Reviews.Author: Davehoffs
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a weekend in February. Really very nice hotel. Clean, excellent breakfast. Very friendly staff and a perfect sport for sightseeing being near the Spanish steps and walkable to the Trevi fountain and beyond. We stayed in one of the superior rooms on the top floor facing St Peters. If you can spend the extra, I would really recommend it. The rooms are great with a balcony and the view is quite breathtaking. It was snowing in Rome for the first time in decades, so we were very lucky. Only downsides. Lifts were not working when we were there and we did not think the hotel did enough about it. It was merely a pain for us, but if you were older, it would have been impossible. Also the hot water ran out in the mornings. Not good. Otherwise it would be a 5. but get that room. The others are smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Modigliani Hotel - great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: amitbal
Reviews.Content: Excellent , clean , centrally located hotel. Reception staff was very nice , attentive and helpful at all times (and also spoke good english !) Breakfast was ok - as is the custom in Eurpoe , if you have a chance to pay less and not have breakfast , go to the next door cafe and have breakfast over there :-) Overall - great hotel , 5 mins walk from fontana di trevi , 10 mins walk from the spanish steps, great rooms and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff too”
Reviews.Author: Pitzikat
Reviews.Content: The staff were ALL wonderfully friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Breakfast was ample and included home-baked cakes and tarts, fresh juice and lots of other choices. Yes, there is a standard coffee machine, but I think that if you ask the lovely lady in charge she will make a real cup of coffee using the espresso machine behind the counter (I don't drink coffee, but I did see her prepare a cup for someone once). I had to give only an average rating for sleep quality because of the noise (see room tip below), but if not for that, I would rate it as excellent. Good quality linens, comfortable bed, quiet location. I used the free wifi in the lobby area a lot, the connection was good and was fast. There are many restaurants within 3-4 minutes on foot - the best is Il Giardino! Just a block farther down is a Despar supermarket for picnic lunches (or suppers in your room if you are too tired to go out - that can happen when you're in Rome) or a bottle of wine. It was a good location for seeing much of Rome, using either the Barberini metro stop or one of the several buses nearby. The taxi to Termini in evening rush hour was €11 - but only about €8 from Termini to the hotel late in the evening on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Fun spot, wonderful option in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: 56experience
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a fabulous location near the Spanish Steps with a young and energetic staff. The room was small but the bed was very comfortable, spotlessly clean, lovely linens and prompt maid service. We stayed a full week and were disappointed that our room didn't have a balcony as many did. It would have been a thoughtful accomodation ,especially given that I specifically requested a comfortable room via e mail months before upon making the reservation. As in any hotel, there were a few weird policies. We were refused wine glasses when requested. It was explained to us that the policy is that we needed to buy wine from the hotel in order to be provided wine glasses. I attributed this to the young and seemingly inexperienced staff, and lack of owners oversight on the premises. The bar was not open the entire week. How would we even know that they sold wine in full bottles at the front desk? Breakfast was fine, always homemade baked goods even though cappuccino was provided by a instant coffee dispenser, lacking the true Italian barista touch and requiring silly laminated passes to be handed in every morning. This hotel is a great option to large ,overpriced, aging hotels. You will really feel like you are a part of ancient Rome with a gorgeous piazza right down the street. Despite the few complaints, I would stay there again and recommend it highly to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - very friendly”
Reviews.Author: julia m
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a group of 10 people (5 couples) from a friend's recommendation. Everyone was really pleased with the choice. The location was fantastic - we could walk everywhere. The rooms were small but faultless. The staff were helpful and friendly, although were not happy to recommend or comment on any but a few select restaurants. They also did not like it when we wanted to use a taxi which had conveniently stopped outside the hotel, but had not been called by them. For it's location, the hotel offered fantastic value for money. The breakfast was quite good. The side street was quiet. There was a nice space near the lobby for congregating before going out - even having a pre-dinner drink. We didn't use the courtyard because it was too cold, but it looked pretty. The hotel was happy to store our bags after checking out for several hours before we departed for the airport. The only real niggle was that the lift was broken. We were told it had just broken and would be fixed the next day, but it remained out of order for all of the 3 days we were there. It was quite a climb up to the rooms - some being 4 or 5 floors up. Maybe this was unusual, but it was lucky we were fit enough to manage.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: michal s
Reviews.Content: As veteran travellers who have also been involved in the tourism business all over the world, we've always preferred the small hotel, the intimacy of fewer rooms, away from the big, "industrial" hotel. Hotel Modigliani in Rome not only answered, but exceeded our expectations. Situated in a central yet quiet small street in old Rome, you can practically walk almost everywhere. The rooms, we had the wonderful roof suite, view the neighbouring houses and provided the charming atmosphere of those old, beautiful buildings. Breakfast was delicious and the lounge a quiet and calm place to linger in between touring or after an Italian dinner... The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Andrea, who made us fell practically at home.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Modigliani with my wife, and two children. We chose to occupy their apartment-like part of the hotel. It's across the street and has a small living room with two twin beds, a large private bathroom and a master bedroom. This was recommended instead of staying in two separate hotel rooms. They were open 24hrs so we could leave our giant heavy key with them instead of carrying it around all day. The receptionists were informative about the area, gave wonderful directions, made reservations and recommendations. They have free WIFI in their lobby area and they were a couple blocks away from the Trevi Fountain, Campo Di Fueri and the Spanish Steps. Piazza Barbarini was the closest square and it had all the resources we needed like a farmacia. Highly highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “so italian”
Reviews.Author: suzysw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as most Rome hotels, quite small but very nice and great value for the rate. we were only there one night before we went on our cruise but I would recommend it. Great location, great shopping and restaurants nearby and very clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a week here in November - and have just made our reservations to return! The hotel is well appointed and comfortable, and every one of the staff is friendly and accommodating. Our room was not large, but very well organized, with a charming balcony and comfortable furnishings. It has a terrific location, just a few blocks from the top of the Spanish Steps and convenient to the metro and buses for those who aren't great walkers. I can't say enough good things about this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: way2go
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here in August 2011. It was perfect as they had a room on the top floor that accomodated all of us. The breakfast was good and they had WiFi in the relaxing room downstairs. It's hard to find places for families of 5 to stay in Europe in one room. This was a great place to stay. We walked just about everywhere from here.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL MODIGLIANI”
Reviews.Author: Anette H
Reviews.Content: This must be the best two-star hotel i've ever been to. I would easily give it three. why not four? Because of the overall standard, and the breakfast. But w.t.h. its a two-star. The room and bathroom were clean. The staff were super helpful and nice. The location vs prise ratio were well above expectations. I'd absolutly stay there again. If you haven been to Rome, and dont want to pay too much, but still want cleaniness and location this is the place for you. You are in walking distance of everything. id have to say its cozy

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: waynepain
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of friends and family in October 2010. We stayed there for 2 days and we should have been there longer if we had known about the many things to do there. The hotel is centrally situated close to everything. There is a subway and train access. Be careful of the roads around there as there are vehicle restrictions on non permitted vehicles. We got a traffic ticket 6 months after our return the states for driving down a road in a vehicle (we rented a passenger van) that had no permit for being there. The hotel is nice and there are restaurants and bars nearby. One of the neighboring buildings has a live band that plays and you can hear it when you venture out of the hotel at night. The staff was very nice and the food was good at the hotel although only breakfast. The place is quaint and cozy yet only a few minutes from the Colosseum. There is free internet, but it is only accessible in the lobby. The only drawback to the room was the shower and it is only a drawback because of how small it was. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff and comfortable rooms; a very nice little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie300
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas (2011) and loved it! It was our first trip to Rome and we found ourselves within easy walking distance to everything (food, metro station & places of interest). Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynn B
Reviews.Content: The major stand-out for this hotel are the fabulous staff and convenient location. The staff are all extremely helpful and kind with directions, bookings and general hints. Many of the staff took the time to learn our names and room number. We stayed a week and were made to feel very welcome from check-in. It would have been nice, seeing as we were staying a reasonable amount of time, to have a room with a balcony to enjoy the view, however not to be. :( On a couple of occasions it was very noisy late at night with other residents returning from outings as the doors to rooms are very close together on each floor. Breakfast was adequate, but repetitious. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great first visit”
Reviews.Author: Ferrariking
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Room 602 on the top floor. The room is quite large and well appointed - with the usual "firm" Italian bed. The bathroom was new, large (they lost the bidet to make room for a nice sized shower) and spotlessly clean. The real treat - if the weather is even half decent - is the balcony. There is a beautiful view of area that includes St. Peters and Piazza Venezia, along with a view of how regular people live in the center of Rome. There is one other room on that floor, and we did hear the couple next door arrive late one night, but otherwise it was quiet during our visit. It is somewhat of a nuisance to have to go downstairs to get wifi if you are not otherwise connected, but take a good bottle of wine and a book and sit out on the balcony and read. I agree with other comments about the staff - just right imo. The location was great for us - we are used to the hill towns in Tuscany and Umbria, so the walk up from Piazza Barberini was just what we needed after a good meal. Again - it may be the particular room that made it so enjoyable, but we had a great 3 days at the Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be nicer”
Reviews.Author: Amerr2727
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Modigliani were so, so kind. We arrived early off a red eye from the US, and not only were we able to access of room early, but they also allowed us to get a coffee and snack from the breakfast room that day as well. They helped with dinner reservations, internet access, and so much more. 5 stars to the Modigliani!

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star in my personal ranking system”
Reviews.Author: HughDanielWilson
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Modigliani is great from many perspectives; location is excellent, it is clean and well maintained, and - most of all - the staff provide wonderful help for just about any problem. Communication in English was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing city, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deniz C
Reviews.Content: In Hotel Modigliani we have spent 3 nights in November 2011, and we felt like we were at home. Our room was enough for 3 of us; it was clean and nice. The location is perfect to walk to the Spanish Steps just for 2 minutes. It is near to everywhere. Thanks for the hospitality of the hotel staff. Hope to see them again very soon... Deniz Cilingirturk / Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: astarrbean
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located -- walking distance from almost all of the major sites, and right on a metro line for the further ones. It is well priced, but the rooms are very small, rather noisy, and with the smallest showers every created, so you do get what you pay for. Nice staff and breakfast. Definitely a nice little place to stay in Rome, but nothing extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Karen D
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of 5 nights at Hotel Modigliani on two separate occasions in September and October. Our "room" was an apartment across the street from the hotel. The additional space was appreciated, as it enabled us to spread out with all of our luggage. Our two rooms plus bathroom were clean, comfortable, and quiet. The public areas of the hotel were spotless and well-appointed. Breakfast was substantial and good, and served in either a clean, bright room or in a lovely, small garden. We also appreciated the computer and internet service for guests in the lounge. The hotel has a good "feel". We felt very comfortable and welcomed there. The staff were friendly, courteous, and helpful. In addition to making reservations and providing directions, they looked up addresses of some stores that we were unable to locate on our own. The hotel is in an excellent location from which we walked to most of the major attractions. We highly recommend Hotel Modigliani and would definitely stay there again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with friendly staff in a nice quiet part of the city.”
Reviews.Author: PANDA5661
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 101 which has a small balcony and overlooks the garden at the rear of the hotel. The room is small but simply decorated and very clean and fresh looking. We had 4 good night’s sleep in a comfortable bed and we never heard any noise from either inside or outside of the hotel in the night time. The only downside being that the room is dark over the wardrobe area and an extra light would make all the difference. At busy times the hot water for the shower is a bit erratic and can run from hot to cold and back again very quickly, presumable as other quest turn the supply on and off. The choice at breakfast is not as good as my wife and I would have liked and a hot option would have been nice especially as there are two members of staff available. Do ask for a cappuccino from the machine behind the bar as the self service on is not very good. Overall a good hotel and but for the above negatives I would rate it as a five star.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: smiffy1952
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on the 6th floor. Room was comfortable & well furnished. Staff were very pleasant & helpful at all times. Breakfast was plentiful as buffet style and everything was fresh. Centrally located for most attractions & overall I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Zohar U
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Modigliani hotel and we are definitely going to use it again. The hotel was clean, tidy, the staff was great, and we enjoyed every minute we been there. My only hope is that in the future they will improve the WIFI network to cover the room areas as well.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTulip
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani is on a quiet little side street with quick access to major tourist attractions. The staff is extremely helpful and made my first trip to Rome far easier than I expected. The room was comfortable and thanks to it's 4th floor (yes, there is an elevator) location, I could open the window shutters and enjoy a beautiful view of the skyline. Breakfast every morning was delicious. I look forward to my next opportunity to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: suzanne1436
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Modigliani came recommended to us through Karen Brown's B&Bs in Rome. Located on one of the narrow streets, 42 Via Della Purificazione, nestled between other B&Bs - very unassuming from the outside, but don't be fooled. Inside the hotel is a first class establishment. Friendly staff, freshly painted, clean with a large, comfortable great room to relax, play cards or games, and read. There is an elevator. Our room was on the second floor. It was small but very adequate ... a king sized bed, small refrigerator, dresser with a TV, a wardrobe and a comfortable chair. The bathroom was clean, actually, sparkling clean. The highlight of staying at this hotel is two fold - one, it is near the Spanish Steps and two, the complementary breakfast was to die for. Home baked pastries, fruits, yogurt, eggs, cereals etc. We highly recoommend this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: Caryaovata
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Modigliani in their "little honeymoon," room. Close to the Metro, easy walking distance to all the tourist spots. Loved the small interior courtyard, where we would share a bottle of wine in the evening. Staff very friendly and helpful. Free wifi only in the lobby, but the lobby is a great spot to hang out as the room was small. Good breakfast. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 day break to the eternal city - other than all the usual stuff about how fantastic & lovely it all is. Our top 4 favourite personal things were (it could be a long list): 1. The hotel's apricot croissants - my partner who is an expert on these matters rated them the best ever. 2. Giovanni's win bar - a great place to both drink and eat. The food is lovely, the wine fantastic and Giovanni the perfect host who will help recommend unusual wines for you. Located in Piazza delle Coppelle. 3. Santa Cristina restaurant - the zuccini pasta starter is as good as everyone says - my favourite dish of the holiday. 4. Santa Cristina restaurant - my partner raved about the apple & custard cream cake. Grazie Mille Roma

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia S
Reviews.Content: We searched hundreds of hotels online, and took a chance on this one. My husband and I were traveling with our two teenagers (16 and 14) for my 50th birthday and were hoping to save some money by all staying in one room. Daring and unromantic, I know, but it was just for 2 nights and VERY few hotels in Rome can accommodate a family of 4 in one room (at a reasonable price). We had driven from Tuscany that morning and arrived in our rental car. Had no problem parking the car in the garage the hotel recommended (about 2 blocks away). Front desk was great--very helpful, spoke very good English, cheerful, all around nice to deal with. Were thrilled to get to our room on the 6th floor and find that the AC worked really well! That was my first test. Even though the room was small and the bathroom tiny, it did have a nice-sized recently renovated shower (passed my second test), and a delightful little balcony with a small table. Perfect for having a morning cup of coffee and spying on the nuns in the nearby church. I loved the little alley the hotel was on. It was quiet and a short walk to the cab stand at Piazza Barberini. The kids loved the Internet access in the lobby (which was great because it kept them out of the room!), and I loved the little courtyard where they served breakfast. Once you de-Americanize yourself and get used to the smaller scale of things in Europe (thinner mattresses, smaller portions, smaller rooms, smaller cars), you really start to appreciate the history, the culture and just the general "joy of life" attitude the Italians possess. Would definitely come back here again. It will be hard to top this first visit to Rome, but I'm willing to chance it. Pack your white clothes, good walking shoes, your Rick Steves' guidebook and meet me at the nearest gelato shop!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet spot near main sights.”
Reviews.Author: hmacdonald_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani was our final stop before heading for home. It is a quiet, clean hotel near many of the main sights in Rome. There are also lots of restaurants nearby. We booked a superior double which gave us lots of room as well as a great view. Staff was very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was good as well. We would certainly book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “BENE,BENE,BENE!”
Reviews.Author: Watterson S
Reviews.Content: Just like a home-from-home in Rome. Fantastic location well within walking distance of most of the major sites. Staff very friendly and knowlegeable and all done with a smile! Breakfast was great with freshly prepared crostini, pastries, good coffee and all you need to set you up for a busy sightseeing day! Lounge smart but friendly. Especially liked the art in the hotel and the amusing Modigliani Newsletter. Can highly recommend this small , but high quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: Karen3737
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet. Very good locaton. Helpful staff. Water temperature varied considerably in the shower. Didn't seem fixable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SeeTheWorldin2010
Reviews.Content: Great staff, very helpful. breakfast was ok, location is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Teri705
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani was a great hotel to stay in. The service was excellent, the location was great, the accomodations were lovely. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “peace and tranquility in the center of rome!”
Reviews.Author: natashagirl
Reviews.Content: What a joy to return each evening to the calm and elegance of this small hotel! The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff cannot be overstated -- every request was met with a smile. This area felt like a true neighborhood and was handy to everything. Breakfast in the garden was lovely, and I will never forget the view from our small balcony! We will not search for another place for future trips -- we've found our "home in rome"!!

Reviews.Title: “An utterly charming hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bubblesLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to find Hotel Modigliani and it did not disappoint! Utterly charming hotel in what we considered the perfect location. It was on the most enchanting little street where we felt like locals within the first few hours. We walked everywhere, Spanish Steps literally are just steps away. Our room was European small but with a lovely balcony that overlooked the lush courtyard where people would have breakfast and wine in afternoon. We used their car service to come from airport and it was perfect and so reasonable. Staff recommended restaurants were perfect as well. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again and will recommend to all our friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family owned hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emsizzy
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here! It was a little hard to find off the metro at first but friendly restaurant workers nearby helped direct us. The staff was very personable and knew us by the first night. The lounge and garden are great for relaxing, checking email, or eating breakfast. Rooms are comfortable and spacious in European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome Respite”
Reviews.Author: Maggie'sGirl
Reviews.Content: After 4 days in Rome earlier and a 20 day Holland American Cruise, we were ready for some peace and quiet and we found it. No problems with doors or thin walls. The patio/courtyard was a welcome place after one last day in Rome with brutal heat. Absolutely loved the free wifi internet in a cool, relaxing living room type area with lots of seating. Had a challenge printing our boarding passes for the flight out next day and staff seemed to defer to a comunal computer where it was not obvious how to print. Ended up not being an issue as the airlines wouldn't let us check in anyway. The price we paid was less than the confirmation and that is always a nice surprise. Once you are inside the compound, you cannot even remember what city you are in as it is so quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: brian d
Reviews.Content: Courteous staff, pleasant/comfortable room, excellent breakfast, great location, super wi-fi connection- it's all you could ask for in a hotel. Stayed here in September 2011 and had a fantastic time. With comparable rates I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for any vacationing or business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm in a big city”
Reviews.Author: Oxford-2-Jersey
Reviews.Content: We spent a delightful three days at the Hotel Modigliani during our honeymoon. The hotel staff could not have been more friendly or accommodating. Satisfying the different tastes and expectations of an American and a Brit is not always straightforward, but we were both delighted with our stay. We were so pleased to find so much local character (all good!) - a refreshing antidote to the same-old, same-old you find in the international hotel chains. Highly recommended - great location, great staff, great character.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jagfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Modigliani for two nights prior to a cruise. My only complaint was that we only had two nights here! We had arranged through the hotel for a driver to pick us up at the airport and he was waiting for us when we got our luggage. We were warmly greeted upon our arrival and had a speedy check in. The hotel is located on a quiet side street and was within walking distance of most sites. Our room was 602 and had a view from the balcony of St. Peters and a beautiful monument honoring the first king of a unified Italy! The room was large by European standards and the bath was clean and totally adequate. A continental breakfast was included and it was a great start to our days. The staff is exceptional and extremely helpful with reservations and dinner suggestions. The quaintness of this small hotel was exactly what I wanted for my first trip to Rome! I highly recommend the Hotel Modigliani to anyone visiting this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely second stay at Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: oscaris15
Reviews.Content: This was the second visit to this hotel, the first time was in 2002 and that time we stayed in the family room at the top (601) which had a really nice roof terrace. On this visit (Sept 24 - 27) we tried the other superior room (602) which has a balcony over-looking most of Rome, with distant views of St Peters and the wedding cake. The balcony was great and the sunsets were beautiful to watch from here, with the tiny bats flitting about in the dusk. The bed was fantastic, one of the most comfortable we have slept in, and it was nice to have the extra space with the two sofas in the room. The shower was good and a decent size. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful and happy to recommend places to go (although we did not take the recommended €60 per person trip to Tivoli, we went by Metro to Pont Mamolo for €1 each way and then got a bus to Tivoli for €2 return). The breakfast room is pleasant and there is bread, cereal, pastries, a few slices of salami, juice and hot drinks (from a machine which was a little disappointing). This hotel is in a very convenient location, near the Spanish steps, Piazza Barberini and the Trevi fountain, although all of Rome is easy for walking. The hotel location is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoeygirl1200
Reviews.Content: First let me say that this was my first time outside the USA so my expectations may be different than the seasoned traveler. The staff were fine the room was clean and the location was convenient for the metro and sites in Rome. The bed was decent, not to hard. The shower in my room 103 was only big enough to move in a circle, couldn't bend down if something dropped (I did no of someone that got a decent size shower in their room so its not all rooms), the water pressure was great but it would only stay warm for a couple of minutes (I took showers between 9 -11 pm). I had to turn it off to put shampoo on or soap and hope the warm water would be back on when I turned it on again. The walls are paper thin. I could here people talking next door and in the stairwell at all hours day and night. I could also here the toilets/showers in the rooms above and to the side of me like they were in my room. I think I was hearing the plumbing from all the floors above me since the water was pretty much continuous except in the middle of the night (1-6 am) I heard someones alarm clock going off down the hall like it was in my room. On the upside I couldn't really hear the street noise even though it was right outside the window. The breakfast provided was average. Free internet was available in the lobby. This may be how it is at all hotels in Rome since it is a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Mildly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: woggy1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I completed our honeymoon journey with a 3 day stay at Hotel Modigliani. It wasn't what I was expecting. It seems to be attempting a "5-star" status with a "3-star" facility. The room was small and was supposed to be a "junior honeymoon" room. It did have a balcony but not with the view as presented and the AC was operating erratically. The dining area is only open for a couple of hours for breakfast. Our checkout day, we were lterally 2 minutes late for breakfast and they wouldn't let us partake. With the exception of Laura, the receptionist, and a choice few other employees, client relations could use some work. On an up note, the location was on a quiet side street and within walking distance of most of the popular sites and some very good restaurants. The hotel was accomodating with helping us make reservations for the local eateries, setting up tours and getting transportation to the airport. Unfortunately, we were somewhat disappointed with the build-up in choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming family owned Boutique Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jeanjarvis
Reviews.Content: Loved this quaint hotel near most of the top sites. Excellent restaurant for breakfast. Our bathroom in 602 was renovated. Great little balcony overlooking the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great return visit”
Reviews.Author: themolitors
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HM for a second time on our recent return trip to Italy and once again enjoyed its convenient location, excellent service, and above average breakfast. We also took advantage of their airport pickup service which really went well, even though a 1-day strike had delayed our flight by 2 hours (and cancelled every other earlier flight). Only a couple of "glitches" which were easily resolved. Our initial room must have had a brand new mattress which had a "Sleep Number" of about 105 (very hard). Staff were able to relocate us promptly into the same room we'd stayed in 3 years earlier (mattress still a bit firm but better). Also, the value of carrying duct tape was also reinforced as we had to repair a broken hair dryer "on the fly" but other than that the room was more than adequate. As other posters have noted (41traveller must have been there the same time we were) there are good restaurants very close and some of the best attractions are nearby (the train station is also just about a mile away). Metro and the hop-on/hop-off buses also have stops in Piazza Barbarini just down the street and the Barberini Palace and its wonderful artwork is also just across the Piazza. All in all, the HM earns its stars. We'll definitely continue to use for future stops in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to Italy and Rome, we had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Modigliani, located on Via della Purificazione. The hotel is just a short taxi ride from the Station, a short walk from the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and in close range of some delightful Roma eateries! Our first impressions were fantastic as our taxi drove up the narrow Via to stop right outside the front door. We were rapidly welcomed by the hotel reception staff who eagerly assisted us transfer our bags from taxi to hotel. Having just got off the night train from Paris, my wife and I were both feeling in need of a quick wash and brush up before heading out to see the sights. Though we were early and could not get into our rooms, the staff directed us to their facilities and took care of our bags - including my precious musical instrument which I must say I was a little reluctant to part with. But I need have no concerns, the reception staff took into their personal care as if it were a small child!! A short sightseeing tour in the area of the hotel was called for and again the staff provided us with all the tools we needed giving us directions to the nearest resteaurants, local sights, farmacia and where we could get a SIM card for the phone! On our return to the hotel, the receptionist again welcomed us as old friends and advised me he had been unable to sell my precious instrument ( :) ) Our room was delightfully situated with its shuttered windows overlooking the street making us feel more like neoghborhood residents than visitors. The room was spotlessly clean and of ample size. The air conditioning was a welcome respite from the Rome summer heat though at night we preferred to turn it off and open the windows! Breakfast the following morning was buffet style and more than adequate - great coffee! The hotel staff again provided us with all the help we needed to book sightseeing tours and to make our stay enjoyable. After two great days, we arrived as tourists and left as friends ..... thank you Rick Steeves for recommending the hotel and thank you Hotel Modigiani for going that extra mile to help make our stay one of the best of our vacation.. David & Catherine Clark, North Vancouver Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 41traveller
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Modigliani for two nights- September 6 & 7, 2011. I got the best room in the house- Room 602. It has a balcony with a panoramic view of the city of Rome. The hotel also has some interesting art work decorating its walls. The staff are welcoming, friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend this charming hotel. Margaret C Montreal, Quebec

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: sLeslieNampa_Idaho
Reviews.Content: This was our very first trip to Italy and the first hotel we stayed in and it was wonderful!! The staff was very, very friendly and very accommodating. My sister-in-law and I had a wonderful time during our stay there and wished we had opted to stay in Rome a little longer! The staff suggested a wonderful restaurant to eat at only a few doors away!! It was one of the best meals we had in Italy. Thanks again, I am already planning to return and will most definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Incrediable value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Grace037
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Modigliani at the end of August and we were hugely impressed by the value for money that this hotel offers - for 100 euro a night we had a lovely room overlooking a courtyard where we ate a gorgeous breakfast each morning (option of pastries, yoghurt, fruit, cooked breakfast, toast, coffee, juice). The bathroom is small but perfectly formed, with a large double power shower. Modigliani is in a great location, within 10 minutes walking distance to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi, as Rome is relatively small its easy to walk everywhere, but this hotel is also right beside a metro stop and lots of buss stops. Our first impression of the hotel was the impressive foyer with art painted by local artists and lots of travel guides and books. The highlight of our stay at Modigliani was the staff, they were so helpful, going out of their way to look up bus timetables and even offering to book tables at restaurants before we set out for them! I was hugely impressed by the kitchen staff who each morning would happily take our breakfast out to the courtyard for us so we could eat in the sun. I tried to clear away my own plates one moring, and the lovely lady insisted on doing it for me, tutting like a mother and telling me to get on with my special holiday. This hotel really is a home away from home. Its nothing really plush, but you wouldnt expect that for the price. It is comfortable, clean, with a good breakfast and in a fab location. HIGHLY recomended!! It enables you to save money on accomadation in Rome, so that you can spend it at the amazing restaurants :-) The only thing I would say that could be worked on, is the coffee...not great...but you can get lots of brilliant coffees once you're out and about anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, super location.”
Reviews.Author: wanderbells
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights here and loved the homely feel to the hotel. The rooms were very clean, the communal areas attractive and well maintained (the garden for breakfast was lovely) and it felt like we were staying in a family run hotel where the owners took pride in every detail. Breakfast was good with less choice but higher quality ingredients than we've had at other hotels in Italy. In all, I would definitely stay again. The only potential negative we had was that one of the restaurant recommendations actually turned out to be the worst meal we had in 10 days, but that's more the fault of the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, bad bed”
Reviews.Author: shortyjames
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great - close to the trains. The bed though was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. It was lumpy!

Reviews.Title: “A great base for a short trip to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: TiggsT
Reviews.Content: A great location, we walked from the hotel to everywhere within about 40 minutes (you need comfy shoes to see Rome!). The Independent Apartment was ideal for us, a couple with 2 children. It is just opposite the hotel, across a quiet narrow street. It was clean and air conditioned (thank goodness as it was so hot outside). I wished it had had a mini fridge, which would have been wonderful for keeping drinks cold. One thing was that after each person showered, you needed to wait for 15 mins for the tank to fill again, or there was no hot water....it would have been nice to know this (eg. a sign) as the first night we all had cold showers, but once we got the hang of it, it was fine. Overall just what we wanted, and I would stay here again if we return to Rome. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The pick up service from the airport was worthwhile at 70E, as taking the train would have cost us E60, then taxi from station to hotel....We got home and found the hotel reviewed in the Sunday Telegraph as one of the best medium range hotels in Rome - I would agree!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellie_gr
Reviews.Content: A great hotel!! Very clean,wonderful staff, best location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: seb g
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the apartment right across the street from the hotel (literally approximately 4 metres from the hotel's front entrance). The room was clean and the air conditioning worked great (it was very, very hot in Rome while we were there about 40 celcius). The staff was great and they did everything they could to make our stay great. Location was excellent- just a short walk up a narrow road to hotel from Piazza Barberini were there is a Metro station to get around Rome very inexpensively. The hotel is located within walking distance from Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend this Hotel to everyone!”
Reviews.Author: M a
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well located and from all hotels we stayed in our trip to Europe, this one was our favorite by far! Very clean, adorable terrace and views. I will recommend our room that is on the top floor! Rooms are big and very clean, cozy place and wonderful breakfast and service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family of four”
Reviews.Author: cwhiggins
Reviews.Content: Our family of four enjoyed the family suite with a terrace on the top floor! It was clean, had ac, and they made excellent cappuccinos in the morning. We also enjoyed the surrounding neighborhood. The street the hotel is on is very quiet at night, yet you can walk to many nice restaurants, the subway, Trevi fountain or Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: Veronica L
Reviews.Content: Magnificent option when in Rome¡ The only "weird" thing was the water in the bathroom, it was so oily. We were told that It was a especial treatment but still taking showers was not a nice experience. Breakfast is very good, location is great. People at the desk was very nice and helpful. No wi-fi in the rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “First ever hotel stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 2067beachbrat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Rome after 12 hours flying time, tired but excited. We found the hotel without much difficulty and were pleasantly surpised. The lobby was immaculate, the welcome by the staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived early and as our room was not ready they very kindly stored our luggage for us, and we were off for a tour. We found the room small as expected, but very clean. The mattress was too hard for our comfort, but we were so tired it did not really matter. Breakfast was a feast. Fresh juice, cereals, yogurt, freshly made bruchetta, assortment of breads, and a coffee machine so you could choose what type of coffee you wanted. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and very hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Jackyvee
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed every minute of our stay in wonderful rome, and this hotel was all we could ask for. Very tidy room with a nice balcony looking out on the courtyard, excellent and central location, and above all a genuinely friendly and helpful staff. No better way to start the day than with a cappucino (splendid) on the breakfast terrace of the modigliani. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Bravo to Hotel Modigliani!”
Reviews.Author: LucianaLIdyllwild
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely property in 2004 so was looking forward to returning...my group stayed the weekend before and after our YogaTrip in the Roman countryside. Loved the helpful and friendly staff, the proximity to the Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese and Trevi Fountain. Loved being on a quiet street in a central neighborhood. Rooms are clean, enjoyed the garden courtyard for breakfast and the salon downstairs to meet up with friends. Can't wait to come back! PS The taxi driver yesterday got me to Fiumicino in just 25 minutes...he must be a professional race car driver...Luciana

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Modigliani for four nights at the end of our Italian vacation. We were immediately impressed, upon arrival, with the spacious lobby areas and how clean it was. Our room, on the second floor, was comfortable and spacious, with a double window looking out onto the Via della Purificazione. This hotel only has 23 rooms, and each has its own thermostat for the AC...very important in Rome in August! This hotel is situated close to the Spanish Steps (a five minute walk) and about a 10-15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. We walked everywhere during our stay and nothing seemed too far. The staff at Hotel Modigliani is courteous and knowledgeable and are quick to make a reservation for you at your request at a restaurant or local attraction. Everyone always greeted us with a smile and a "good morning" or "afternoon." The breakfast room is spacious and the selection for breakfast is good and fresh. It is the typical European breakfast with pastries, cheese, salami, hard boiled eggs and cereal. We loved the blood orange juice. The ladies in the breakfast room will make you a fresh cappuccino or espresso. Breakfast is also served in the interior garden from 9-10 each morning (in addition to 7:30-10 in the breakfast room)..but unfortunately, there was some construction going on when we were there, so it was a bit loud. The hotel also arranged transportation for us to the airport, at a rate of 55 Euro, all inclusive. The car was comfortable and air conditioned and we felt very comfortable using the service because of the hotel's recommendation. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for comfortable accommodations close to the sights and sounds of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, very convenient to all key spots in Rome, short walk to Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: MikeAdamsVT
Reviews.Content: My family of 8 just finished the most wonderful five days at the Hotel Modigliani. The rooms are well furnished and spotless. The staff is always happy and extremely helpful. The airline lost our luggage and the hotel staff called on our behalf every few hours, day and night, until each bag had arrived. The location is perfect, off the main roads but a VERY short walk to the Spanish steps. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Oh so close!! What a shame!!”
Reviews.Author: BrizGerl
Reviews.Content: We had a nice 2 night stay in this very clean, quiet hotel. It is in a great location and yes the staff are friendly and very helpful. We left thinking that we would recommend this place to anyone staying in Rome but then an incident after we left tarnished our thoughts on this hotel. My travel companion accidently left behind a cap and a pair of sunglasses in the lobby as we were settling the bill. The hotel rang us straight away and said they could post the belongings. We were heading to the UK and asked if they could post the items to there rather than to Australia where we are from. In the next email we found out that the hotel wanted to charge 50 Euro to post these 2 items to the UK!!!! We were completely gobsmacked at the expense!! It should have been only 10-15 Euro. We realised that we would pay a bit more than the usual postage rate because of the inconvenience but 50 Euros was just so outrageous!! If they had of charged a more reasonable amount we would now be recommending this hotel to friends who are going to Rome in September. Now we have told them to stay elsewhere. This was very bad PR move for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bearinthebushes
Reviews.Content: Sweet, charming, helpful staff, small room but clean and comfortable, nice lounge and garden pation, quiet, reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with excellent, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: KathyCH2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed my first two nights in Italy at this hotel. First impression is deceiving as you pull up this side street and see the entrance. Once you walk inside, you are greeted by a friendly staff member, immediately notice the well appointed decor/ cleanliness and have a sense of comfort. The location was excellent for visiting all the majors sites, the hotel staff was very helpful in arranging tours and the internet connection in the lounge was very dependable. The free breakfast had a nice variety and staff was always welcoming. I returned at the end of my touring around Northern Italy to the hotel for two nights. This time my daughter was with me. The room we received was a little larger than the first. Even though it faced the street, it was quiet and very comfortable. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Modigliani and would stay again if my travels take me back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location, tremendous value!”
Reviews.Author: 1Ceres
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely budget hotel near the Spanish Steps, Via Veneto, Villa Borghese, and the Barberini Metro stop for two nights in June. Our room, which had a balcony and overlooked a courtyard and Rome, was very clean (with a/c) and included breakfast. The hotel is an a excellent value in pricey neighbourhood. The staff is helpful and friendly and there are many good restaurants nearby. Make sure to read their newsletter (it is quite funny). There is free wi-fi in the lobby as well. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience at Hotel Modigliani!”
Reviews.Author: Pigscanflyhi
Reviews.Content: Our experience was great. The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and well appointed, and the air conditioning provided welcome relieft The breakfast was wonderful and it was a great start to the day to enjoy it in the courtyard. We will definately stay here the next time we come to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great, accessible location on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: hoponatrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights at the end of June and beginning of July. The hotel is very pleasant, more modern than many at this price range with a nice bathroom. Our room was a little small. We faced the street, but there was no problem with noise. Some of the interior rooms have balconies. The only noise was from a room next to us with teenagers for a few nights who made a lot of noise. We called the desk and they gave us a hard time, telling us to solve the problem. We did not feel as though we should have. Perhaps it was the person on duty, since everyone else working at the hotel was very nice, helpful, and polite. Otherwise, the stay was great. One negative was that we could only use the free wifi in the lounge so we had to bring our laptops there every time we wanted to use them. It was a comfotable lounge, but sometimes inconvenient to have to go there. Breakfast is good, but my friend who likes coffee didn't like the coffee machine. One day we had a lot of fresh fruit. The next day when I went to choose some fruit, I discovered it was all fake, and for some reason they didn't have any that day. Another negative was we had to pay the entire 6 nights when we checked in. We later realized we didn't want to stay in Rome that long, but we were committed to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and cozy apartment.”
Reviews.Author: daybee1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an apartment that was actually across the street from the hotel. It was clean and more than sufficient. The location was perfect for exploring Rome on foot. The breakfast each morning was excellent except for the coffee was from a machine and not what I would have expected in Italy....not so good. That is my only complaint however. The staff was wonderful. We would happily recommend this for visitors to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lily57
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Modigliani, the first was in 2008. This time we booked the family suite (room 602) on the 6th floor and it was absolutely wonderful. The panoramic views of Rome from the terrace are breathtaking and it is very quiet as it faces the inside courtyard/garden. As was the case during our last visit, the hotel was extremely clean and the staff helpful and friendly. The location is perfect: within walking distance of many must-see attractions and close to the subway, Via Veneto, and Villa Borghese park. We wholeheartedly recommend Hotel Modigliani to anyone who wants to experience "la bella vita" in Italy at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ariestom62
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in Rome at the hotel Modigliani. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great and the internet service one of the best throughout our entire italy trip. We would definitely stay there again and recommend the hotel to everyone. The hotel has no pool and we didn't eat there, so no idea about that. Neither did we have a car in Rome. We asked the staff and they recommended the sight seeing busses. Go for the one that has more frequent pick ups. Same price and same stops as the others. We had no problem to communicate in english and once you're there go to the restaurant 21 just a few meters from the hotel. Great food and decent price. Cheers to all, Thomas

Reviews.Title: “We loved it. Very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: vetdrjill
Reviews.Content: We are a mature couple who spent our last two nights in Rome at this hotel. It was close to the train station (walking distance) and had a beautiful lounge and lovely breakfast area including a garden. The room and shower were very small. We also had a balcony that was swett facing their courtyard. Located on a very small street it was a little difficult to find initially so I suggest you find it on the map before getting to Rome so you know exactly how to get there. Convenient to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain and many wonderful restaurants. We had trouble getting out boarding passes from the Alitalia website. The staff at this hotel accually made a call for me to my NYC travel agent to ask for help with this problem. I highly recommend this hotel for service, friendliness, delicious breakfast and ambiance. Jill and Ken

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAUSNJ
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff and a cosy ambience all adds up for wonderful stay in Rome. Excellent wifi in the lounge for connected souls as well. Toss a coin over your shoulder at the nearby Trevi Fountain and you'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Z0ltan
Reviews.Content: The staff were outstanding - very friendly, and the room and facilities were very nice. This is a small an intimate hotel on a quiet side street. We found it to be a very convenient location. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A charming small hotel with lots to offer! We loved it and will return!”
Reviews.Author: jlucas2011
Reviews.Content: Andrea's help before the trip and during the trip was outstanding! The rooms are small and very clean. We had the honeymoon room with a view of Rome and surrounding hotels. It was so relaxing sitting on our balcony and enjoying the birds, sights and beauty of Rome. The food was very good (home baked pastries, eggs, cereal, juices, etc.) and I had a cappacinno every morning. The hotel is near the Barbarini Piazza and a short 5 min walk to the Spanish Steps and other sights. "Rick Steves" reccommended this hotel and my husband and I loved it. This was our first trip to Europe and we enjoyed every minute of it with the help of the staff at Hotel Modigliani! Thank you for making it a wonderful stay! Joan & Terry Orange County, CA

Reviews.Title: “Great vaction”
Reviews.Author: Tito35
Reviews.Content: The Modigliani hotel is located at a great location (only two blocks from Spanish Steps). The room was very clean with floor tiles. Free Internet, staff was very helpful, and breakfast was satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff with great local knowledge. Great location with easy walking to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps.”
Reviews.Author: nicole_travel_world
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, we could easily walk to many of the sights but was also very close to a metro station if we needed it. The street is quiet and the rooms are clean and well looked after. Quite small but I guess that is what you get in Rome. The breakfast was great each morning - loved the chocolate donuts! The staff were very friendly and helpful, they had great knowledge of Rome. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Roma Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kk1648
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming hotel June 1-3, 2011. It is in the most perfect location of Rome, with easy access to everything!!! All of the staff are very helpful and friendly (especially Silvia), and assisted with transportation to & from the airport, and to Civitavecchia to get on a cruise ship. Even the gentleman who was cleaning the rooms "whistled" as he worked. We had 2 hotel rooms (3-people in one room, and 2-people in another room) - the rooms had twin beds, and a roll-away bed for the room with 3-people. Though the rooms are small (typically European), the space was adequate and a nice-size bathroom with a full-size shower. Our rooms faced the front of the hotel, looking out over the quaint street (looks like an alley), and it was very quiet at night. A great continental breakfast is served in the morning, with plenty of options. The rooftop balcony (in the rear of the hotel) was delightful too, for taking a break, resting our feet and drinking delicious Italian wine. I really enjoyed the beautiful artwork that is placed throughout the hotel, along with great photos in the hotel rooms which were taken by the hotel owner. Trust the restaurant recommendations by the staff - all were delicious!!! To reserve a room, I contacted the hotel directly at info@hotelmodigliani.com , and did not have any problems making a reservation. We loved our stay at Hotel Modigliani and will definitely return. This hotel is very quaint and charming and perfectly located to everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: kmbell11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Italy with our honeymoon, and we stayed in Rome for the first three nights. The hotel was very nice, clean, and comfortable. The staff, especially Stefano, were extremely nice and helpful. We really liked Stefano and appreciated all his help. The hotel is also a very great location and in walking distance to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, and about five minutes from 2 metro stations. They did have free wifi only in the lobby, which might be an inconvenience to some, but we thought it was great and very helpful. They also have a computer you can use. Overall, this hotel was very clean, the staff were helpful, the breakfast was very good, and it was a great location. It isn't anything super fancy, but it is a perfect place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: marinedermdoc
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is clean and near triton fountain, the booking process is deceiving. We were misled re. a quad room and charged 620 dollars for 1 night for an "apartment " with six beds. We were a party of four and not given the option of a quad room. Also, when asked if we could have the room with 4 beds, we were told that we would be charged a 1 night cancellation fee. They were not very receptive to our concerns despite having stayed there before. Be careful when booking. Also, free wi-fi only in lobby...for that price????

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, jury's still out on the hotel...”
Reviews.Author: LKBrown
Reviews.Content: I'm still in two minds as to what to say about this hotel. We came to Rome at the end of a tour of Italy where we had stayed in some great hotels. We were told by the tour company that we had been 'upgraded' for the Rome hotel as there was no availability in their usual options, and given the standard of the other hotels we were expecting something quite special. We arrived just after lunch and got the metro to the hotel. The check in staff were friendly enough and took us through the map telling us how to get to some of the main attractions. We went up to the room and were a little disappointed. Judging by photos and other reviews, I think it really does depend on the room with this place, but ours felt very basic. It had a door out to the courtyard, but it was very dark in the room and the marble floor made it feel quite cold. The real plus with this hotel was the location. It is walking distance to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, and about five minutes from Barberini metro station so you can access everything else from there. We got the Metro some days (e.g. over to St Peters/The Vatican) but you could actually walk to most places. We walked to the Vittoriano, the Colosseum, and over the river to Trastavere one evening for dinner. Walking about was a nice way to see more of Rome, but the Metro is also really convenient. There are also some nice places to eat around the hotel. We used the lounge area a bit, and there was free Wifi, which was a bonus. There isn't a bar as such, but if you asked the reception staff they would get you a drink and bring it to the lounge – a little bizarre but it seemed to work! The breakfast room was nice and the breakfast was good quality. The other downside was the amount of noise. This is not the hotel's fault, as there were some really loud guests (surprisingly, older guests) staying at the same time as us who liked to shout up and down the stairs to each other and make phone calls outside other people's rooms. Also, you couldn't close a door without slamming it, which added to the noise. In trying to give a fair review, I would say the staff try quite hard to create a friendly, family run hotel, and they have no control over the other guests' lack of manners, but it is quite basic for what I imagine is not a cheap rate. The location is excellent, and I suspect that's what you pay for, and the public areas of the hotel are good, but I felt the rooms (or ours, anyway) let it down. Also, to be fair, we don't know exactly what it cost as it was all included as part of the overall tour of Italy, so it may have been a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and we will return!”
Reviews.Author: joepalace
Reviews.Content: Great location near Metro. Plenty of restaurants around. Quiet street makes for a good night sleep. The folks at the front desk are very helpful and always willing to help. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great value”
Reviews.Author: gdgc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The room was spacious and nicely appointed. While the breakfast buffet was not extensive, there was sufficient variety to cater for all tastes - and the food was always beautifully fresh. A great way to start the day! But where this hotel was ' first class' was in the service and advice provided by the helpful and friendly staff and in its location - we were able to walk to most places. We would not hesitate to recommend this lovely hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with loads of charm”
Reviews.Author: hcj56
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivers all that it promises on the web site. Clean, professional with a quaint charm in a central location in a quiet street. Staff were very friendly and spoke English very well. The room was large enough to be comfortable (the shower alcove was a little small) and we were pleased that we picked this hotel. It was walking distance to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Via Del Corsoand lots of churches with magnificent domes and frescos. Barberini Piazza was just down the road for access to buses and trains. The Piazza is very cosmopolitan with shops and eating places. The hotel has free internet and a very comfortable lounge area and bar to relax in after a day out. Breakfast is excellent. Highly recommended. A great place to centre your Rome Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel- A perfect ending to our Italian Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: BarryMoloney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our Italian honeymoon and we loved it. The hotel is an oasis of peace right in the heart of Rome - a few minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Our room overlooked their cute little garden in the back - we breakfasted in the garden one morning. Laura, Stefano and Francesco made our visit here a dream ending to our holiday - On our last day we had a late flight and they even stored our bags while we toured Rome. I work as a tour guide in Ireland so my standards are high. We will never forget our Italian Honeymoon - We will be back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Now I understand all the rave reviews!”
Reviews.Author: WendyM2
Reviews.Content: We reserved a "Little Honeymoon" room (small room with balcony) for our 3 days in Rome last month. The room is very small but there was room to unpack and store suitcases under the bed. The balcony was charming and had 2 chairs to sit and enjoy the scent of Jasmine from the flower garden. Bathroom also tiny- stand up shower stall- but honestly not much different than other big European city tiny rooms. The location is fantastic! Metro, Hop on bus, and walking to just about anywhere. 10E cab from train terminal. Very helpful staff, serviceable if a bit boring breakfast options. My only complaint would be that wi-fi is only available in the lobby/lounge area, not in the rooms or garden. If there is wi-fi why not just make it accessible in rooms? Seems silly! By the way although in photos the street looks a bit down & out it's not at all!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and good value”
Reviews.Author: ClaireJLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located although the road is a little scruffy. The hotel is obviously loved by owners and staff and although rooms and bathrooms are small they are spotlessly clean and showers are powerful and the hot water plentiful. The breakfast is good but the coffee which comes from a machine is weak and disappointing. The staff are very helpful and friendly and could do no more to help.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Grahamc33
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just got back from a trip in Italy. We only had one night in Rome and booked here based on the location and the mostly glowing reviews. I can't possibly begin to say anything that hasn't been said in all the other reviews except that from the moment we arrived, we were treated as if we were family. After a few hours in Rome, we realised that we hadn't scheduled enough time in such history and splendour, and will definitely be heading back....... Where will we stay? Hotel Modigliani of course! Location is superb, staff are incredibly helpful, rooms were clean and in keeping with European City sizing.... We loved our time in Rome and it all started at the wonderful Hotel Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: AMA0123
Reviews.Content: Great room, we stayed in the apartment quad room. Shower is a little small, but a terrific room with small private patio. Great location close to Spanish Steps and Via Veneto. Breakfast in mornings were wonderful and a great way to fuel up as we walked everywhere while staying here. I would stay here again and recommend to friends and family if vacationing in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: Pgw21
Reviews.Content: A million dollar view overlooking St Peter's square from our top floor room was the icing on the cake for our splendid two day stay at the Modigliani. Pleasant staff, close to restaurants and within walking distance of Ancient Rome, the Trevi Fountain and Villa Borghese. It was our first trip to Rome but hopefully not our last and without a doubt we will stay at the Modigliani again

Reviews.Title: “Great little find in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: elizhWorcester
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples) have just returned from 4 nights at this lovely small hotel, hidden away in a quiet street close to the Spanish Steps. The rooms are very clean, extremely comfortable and spacious for a city centre hotel. Location is great, all the main sites are within walking distance. We have nothing negative to say. Once again Trip Advisor has helped us find a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, quiet and wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: gmorel038
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit to Hotel Modigliani and it will not be our last...still incredibily quiet for it's fabulous location. Service is wonderful and the included breakfast is more then we expected in Italy..given breakfast are usually a sweet brioche! In the summer months the terrace is open for a glass of wine or breakfast in the morning, just a great way to start or end the day. They now have a bar with some wonderful apetizers. The rooms are clean and bright with access to a balcony if you are facing the courtyard. Thank you we had an enchanting stay at your hotel..Ginette Morel - Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: teterdank
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and really enjoyed it. It's in a great location on a quiet street between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. Rooms were simply decorated but extremely clean and comfortable. The breakfasts were great with lots of options and fresh fruit. Staff was friendly and helpful. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abbeysm0m
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Modigliani. We have traveled to Italy before, but this time we took our two teenage children for their first trip to Europe. We stayed for 8 days in the independent apartment. The accomodations were perfect for our needs and the hotel location is fabulous. The staff was delightful and very helpful. Their recommendations for restaurants were excellent and they even helped us make arrangements for a birthday dinner. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel Modigliani and look forward to going back.”
Reviews.Author: JASpence
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Modigliani to be perfect for our needs. Very bright and cheery, clean and quiet. Located on a quiet street close to the Barberini subway stop and a short walk to the Spanish Steps. On our first day in Rome, after an eight and a half hour flight from Philadelphia, we walked from the Hotel through a lovely park to the Borghese Villa and immediately felt very much at home in this corner of the Eternal City. The staff was helpful and attentive. The breakfast selection was excellent and the mirrored walls allowed for a bit of fun as we were able to observe the other international guests without being impolite and staring. We traveled from Rome to Siena and Florence, and then returned to Rome and the Hotel Modigliani. We would rate it as the best accommodations overall of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a Surprise”
Reviews.Author: JoyLawrence_Kansas
Reviews.Content: I originally found the hotel through Rick Steves' travel book and then read the reviews. This was our first trip to Europe, and I was really nervous about making our travel plans myself. When we arrived at the hotel's street, my husband and I were a little leary about the location. It seemed a little dreary and off the beaten path. We were hesitant but continued up the street. When we entered and saw the pleasant smiles that greeted us and their smart appearance behind a very nice counter area, I felt more assured. When we asked what was in the area to visit, Flavia took the time to draw on the map where we were and the several sightseeing places that were within walking distance. Our room was a good size, very nice bed, a closet, a full bath and end tables with lamps. It was cleaned every day and fresh towels were left. (The only negative comment I would make is that when staying 5 days, it would have been nice to have some drawer space to lay out personal garments in instead of a small writing table with 4 tiny drawers.) The breakfast was good and plentiful, and the breakfast staff stayed on top of refreshing everything. The rest of the hotel staff was always helpful and cheery. We found ourselves visiting with them about our day when we came in from sightseeing. The availability of free Wi-Fi was extremely helpful to us. We had family members that anxious were about our travels (since we were touring for a month), and it was great to be able to communicate with them each evening. Would I recommend this hotel to others....DEFINITELY.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil haven to escape from the hoards”
Reviews.Author: SteveR-01
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel via Tripadvisor, it looked reasonable and so to Rome. 5 days amid the hoards of tours (I guess being tourists ourselves we can't really complain), it was always a bit of a relief to get back to the Modigliani - cool and relaxing. The via della Purificazione is a shady street off the Piazza Barberini, close to the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain, and with a metro station on the Piazza it's an ideal location for getting to most parts of the city.
