We stayed in the Hotel's apartment just across the street 2 rooms + bathroom were ideal for the 2 of us and our teenage son - much preferable to cramming into a Hotel room with 3 beds. The rooms were spotlessly clean and well maintained. The lounge area (with the free wi-fi and a PC available) is a great place to meet and chat with other guests, a great change from the faceless chains. The staff need a special mention - all of them were very friendly and extremely helpful. We wanted to go to the Stadio Olimpico for the Roma-Inter match, plenty of guidance about getting tickets and travel to the match. All are happy to chat and give advice, really makes you feel welcome. The recommendations for local eateries were excellent - a special mention to the Osteria Barberini just down the street, a small family run restaurant with very welcoming staff and excellent plain Italian cooking. All in all, the Hotel really added to out trip, Rome can be a frantic city and being able to chill in the splendid little Hotel was marvellous. I recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: zann44
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great base for our visit to Rome. The staff was very friendly and helpful, with good recommendations on tours, etc. Room 602 was spacious by European standards, comfortable for our family of 4, with a lovely balcony that offered views from the "wedding cake" building to St. Peter's. The breakfast was delicious.. italian pastries, fresh cheese, salami, yogurt, coffee...more than enough for a great start each morning. Superb restaurants in the neighborhood... located between the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps! Try the Hostaria Goia Mia, just a few blocks away.... we dined there twice! When we return to Rome we will return to Hotel Modigliani!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: AprilD21
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Hotel Modigliani at the recommendation of my son who stayed here several years ago. Traveling with friends, we found the hotel has a great location. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean and roomy for European hotel rooms. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: BarronB
Reviews.Content: Sourced this hotel from Rick Steeves "Rome". Excellent 7 night stay, very helpful staff and small but beautiful hotel. We had one of the two large rooms on the top floor with a balcony and distant view of St Peter's and other city landmarks,(beautiful at night! )Lovely to be able to open the two sets of french doors onto the balcony. Very comfortable bed, two large sofas and coffee table and lots of storage made this a perfect spot to relax after a long day sightseeing. Small but immaculate bathroom with shower and towels changed every day. Loved the elevator to get to the 6th floor! Enjoyed the free wi fi in the attractive mirrored lounge. Amusing and very useful newsletter on arrival.(Use the reccomended restaurants) Good European style breakfast in lovely mirrored breakfast room. There is also a small walled garden where you can sit and have a glass of wine..We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Modigliani, and although somewhat over our planned budget, we felt it was excellent value for location, service offered, feeling of safetyand comfort. We willdefinately return and reccomend it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Travelmen48
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, Close to the subway so easy to get anywhere in Rome. Staff very friendly and room very clean. Breakfast was good and would stay there again. Room are small that whats you would expect in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: dubros
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed. A lovely, quaint hotel with lots of character. The location is a superb base for exploring the City. Couldn't really find fault with anything. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff, very clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: steviewonder14
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay here! The staff are incredible, especially Luca and Stefano. They were extremely helpful. Great location too, only 100 yards or so from Piazza Barberini (and the Metro). The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The nights were quiet. A lovely lounge, with a computer for internet. They also have wifi as well. Breakfast was very good with an espresso bar (great capuccino!). I will stay here again if I ever return to Rome and highly recommend this friendly hotel. My only regret was that I didn't listen to their advice on restaurant choices. I chose a place myself and regretted it immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel great location great value”
Reviews.Author: ILMWDC
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great location, excellent breakfast and staff, comfortable beds, spotlessly clean, excellent value. Perfect for exploring! Rome

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: megrez
Reviews.Content: This excellent hotel is tucked into a quiet street in an excellent location (within an easy walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain, to name just two sites). The staff (especially Sylvia) was exceptionally helpful and considerate. The rooms were small, but normal for European hotels. Everything was clean and pleasant. Free WiFi was available in the lobby area. Breakfast incised a vareitybof choices in a pleasant room. There was a wonderful, friendly restaurant down the street - the Osteria Barberini.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Modigliani made Rome even more memorable”
Reviews.Author: AFCAMPANA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Modigliani for 14 nights in Nov-Dec 2010 and we enjoyed the entire time immensely. The owners, Marco and Giulia di Tillo, are personable and gracious hosts. They have set up the hotel facilities -- the lovely WiFI lounge, the inviting breakfast room, and the front desk where everyone drops off their keys -- so that guests regularly interact with members of the hotel staff and with other guests. We met many interesting fellow travelers and are currently corresponding with several of them. The staff was attentive, caring, and well-informed, and the entire facility was spotless. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarjorieSarah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fabulous time at this hotel! We celebrated our anniversary and the owners left us a chilled bottle of wine in the room with a note that said, "Happy Anniversary," when we checked in. It was completely unexpected and incredibly kind. Their staff is helpful, funny and really nice. They care about helping you. They have a hysterical newsletter that tells you about the staff and the neighborhood and more! The Breakfast was super awesome and the "lounge" room was a nice space to go. Our room was small, but that was OK because it was nice and neat and we had an awesome little balcony. I will stay here many more times to come...

Reviews.Title: “A trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: jclaning5
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed eight nights at the Hotel Modigliani, myself, my wife, two of our three teenage children. We took the apartment across the street from the main hotel which was wonderful. Plenty of space (we weren't in the room much), a nice bathroom (even being shared by four adults), and the perfect balance of charm and functionality. While not the cheapest accommodations they were by no means the most expensive either and offered a great location, off the main streets and close to almost everything. I can't say enough about the owners and staff. They were charming, helpful, friendly, and patient. The hotel itself is impeccably clean and had the right level of services and amenities. We thoroughly enjoyed the morning breakfasts, at least my wife and I did, as our children could not be roused in time on several mornings. I would enthusiastically recommend the Hotel Modigliani and would also recommend the time of year we visited. It was not crowded, the temperatures were pleasant, and a little rain on a couple of days didn't dampen our enthusiasm. fino alla prossima volta. grazie mille.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, attentive and friendly”
Reviews.Author: BWFC82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Modigliani twice while in Rome recently, with a journey to Florence in between. On the first occasion we stayed in one of the two 'luxury' rooms on the top floor with spectacular views across the city. The room had a lovely balcony overlooking the small hotel garden and the gardens of local buildings. The room was extremely stylish, with original photographs and objet d'art. Throughout the hotel, there is a sense of style, elegance and comfort, and the owners encourage young local artists by displaying their work. When we returned from Florence were were in a standard room, which was again very smart and stylish, though a little on the small side, with some noise transmission from other guests, possibly through the heating ducts. The staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful and professional, and certainly achieved the owners' stated aim of making us feel valued and 'at home'. A nice touch was the owners' Newsletter, with its pen portraits of the staff. The lounge was again comfortable, spacious and elegant. All in all, the hotel had a very 'upmarket' feel to it, and is very reasonable when you remember it is in a very 'sought after' area of Rome, only minutes walk from sites such as The Spanish Steps'. It is situated on a very quiet and characterful street leading off Barberini Square, a lovely, understated area. The owners' reccomendations for local restaurants and dishes were very accurate - we ate at four of their six recommended places.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with a couple of surprises”
Reviews.Author: kcowan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its convenient location, one block from Via Veneto and 3 blocks from the Spanish Steps. Because we enjoy relaxing in our hotel room, we booked the large penthouse unit with its own balcony. We avoided the minibar, preferring to order drinks and food from their bar. We were shocked to discover that we could not take delivery in our room. We also expected wifi in the room and were diappointed that it was only available in their great room. So I was doing email in the morning and then dropped by the breakfast room at 7:25. The lady there escorted me out and shut the dioor. So I was standing in the hallway for five minutes until the door was opened at 7:30! So much for flexibility! On the plus side, the staff were very helpful, the breakfasts were superb, and there was a garden area where breakfasts and special order snacks were served. The great room was large enough that we were able to do email and make Magicjack calls without interference. Prices were high but we were in Rome. I would recommend saving the money on the room with a view and using their garden area and great room to relax. Or better yet, dine and drink out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's really the little things that count!”
Reviews.Author: ViaggiatriceSydney
Reviews.Content: My enjoyment of this hotel was immediately soured, when after checking in, I ordered a glass of prosecco from the bar. Having read on Tripadvisor, the glowing reports of this hotel's hospitality, I was astounded to receive, literally, half a glass of said prosecco from a small bottle that in my room''s minibar would have cost 7 euros (and given me at least two full glasses). This half glass cost 4 euros! It wasn't the money that bothered me - it was the mean spiritedness of the act! Having developed the habit of enjoying a glass of prosecco over the previous 7 weeks in Italy, I know that a glass of prosecco usually means that the glass is reasonably full. (in fact, in my hotel in Taormina the first glass of prosecco was complimentary.) Not here, it seems. The same attitude continued at breakfast. By 9am, fresh fruit was limited only to apples and even though breakfast ran til 10am there was no chance of replenishment when requested from staff. Only cereals available were Kellogg's Cornflakes. Also very disappointing was the hotel's recommended restaurant, Osteria Barberini. Not only was the food fairly mediocre - aimed at tourists who don't know better - but the owner was a bit free with his hands (three times) as he passed my table. True, the staff at the hotel were, generally, helpful and accommodating and the ability to use the spacious lounge was a bonus. But as this was my fourth trip to Rome/Italy, I know what to expect of the city (and of TripAdvisor recommendations) - and, on this occasion, the Modigliani's reputation seemed to be be very overrated.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonykel
Reviews.Content: the staff was exceptional the location was ideal will highly recommend to all our friends

Reviews.Title: “SMALL BUT MIGHTY”
Reviews.Author: vnoodle
Reviews.Content: yES, THE ROOMS WERE SMALL BUT YOU REALLY AREN'T IN THEM MUCH. The STAFF WAS super helpful, from getting us cars to serving us snacks in the lounge. Could not get the computer to work for me but I don't think it was their fault. Since our flight got in so early, our room was not ready. We walked the city while they sweetly watched our luggage and they recommended THE BEST restaurants, one of which was two doors down, Osteria Barberini. Definitely recommend, especially for the location

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable, and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: elkebritt
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based upon the reviews we read on Trip Advisor and we were pleasantly surprised that it exceeded all our expectations. Our room was perfect with a view of the quaint courtyard and our bathroom was twice as big as expected. The staff was helpful with directions and dinner suggestions. We took advantage of their aperitif special in the courtyard our first evening and enjoyed excellent wine and snacks for about 7 euros a person. The breakfast spread was just what we needed to get our days started. We had friends staying at a different hotel in the area and they were immediately jealous upon visiting our hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: izewine
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks much nicer than the photos so we were pleasantly surprised. Aside from cleanliness and the convenient location, what I like most is the professional service by the staff. They are extremely helpful and are willing to go an extra mile to ensure our stay is pleasant. I arrived the hotel on my birthday, and the hotel staff was so thoughtful they brought us a glass of wine and snacks for celebration. Very nice touch. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tfisher33
Reviews.Content: First time travellers to Rome/Italy, we stayed at this hotel which was recommended through a family friend. Located on a small street, just off of Piaza Barberini and a very close walk to everything you want. Spanish step and Trevi Fountain are just around the corner. Easy and quick subway ride to either the Colosseum or Vatican. Lots of great restaurants and gelato close by. We stayed in the "honeymoon suite", located on the 3rd floor. The room itself was smaller by North American standards, but had a great little balcony with table and chairs to sit and a clean bathroom. Plus, we didn't travel all that way to sit in the room. The staff was very friendly and pointed out directions to major attractions. Nice breakfast every morning and if you need it wifi available in a large common room. All in all, a great spot to stay for an incredible trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Things you should know before booking...”
Reviews.Author: Starnova514
Reviews.Content: I thought I had made a good choice according to the reviews and ratings of this hotel, but it turned out to be not so great after all. Yes, the staff is kind and helpful and the location was great for walking to all the attractions but there were irritants that made the experience at this hotel not the romantic and charming one we were looking for: - The street the hotel is located on is quiet but the hotel itself is definitely not sound proof by any means. You have to slam the doors of the rooms to lock them, and as you can imagine, that made for rude awakenings at night . - The walls are paper thin. We were able to hear every word of what the people in the room next to us were saying very clearly. Every single thing! I know our neighbor needed a new toothbrush and what their itinerary for the next day was. - The floors are marble. Cold, cold marble. I can understand how that could be good in the hot months but in September it just made the room so chilly. I wish I had brought my warm fluffy slippers with me! - The breakfast was pretty drab. Sweet croissants, cheese and some sliced up sausage. No fruit. The "cold" milk for the cereal was left out on the counter the whole time and turned out to be room temperature by the time you got around to using it. - The strong smell of cleaning products. The hotel is definitely clean but the smell of the cleaning products just hit you when you walked into the room and took some getting used to. For these reasons, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. Although, I was really hoping to have a more positive review because the staff really great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Charming”
Reviews.Author: dennis10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani is lovely. The rooms were spacious and clean, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the location was on a quiet street, but just a few blocks from Via Veneto, the Spanish Steps, and the Trevi Fountain. We enjoyed our stay and would highly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “a nice, clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bestkids
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by friends. We had a good stay... it's very clean, the staff is helpful and it's in a great location on a quiet street close to the Spanish Steps and the Metro. We stayed in one of the apartment rooms. There were 4 of us, and space was tight. That said, we had room to fit our luggage is a way we could get to and use it without tripping over it. And it was very quiet... nobody above us, although we could hear our next door neighbor one night after we'd gone to bed. The beds were comfortable, but the pillows were very thin. We still got good rest! The one inconvenience was the shower. It was the smallest shower I've ever seen in my life! It's about 2 feet square -- no extra room to move! I still wonder how my 6 foot tall husband managed! The breakfast was nothing special, not great, actually, but it did get us started on our day. There is free WiFi but you have to go to the lounge to use it. They recommended their private car service to the airport -- convenient, but expensive, 70 Euros, and he didn't drop us at the correct terminal. We had to catch a shuttle to the correct terminal. It wasn't a problem for us as we allowed plenty of time. All in all, we had a very good stay at Hotel Modigliani!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, convenient location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Clarksterh
Reviews.Content: We, and our entire entourage (we came with other family members), enjoyed our experience in the Modigliani. Rooms - Nothing special to note about the rooms - about average for a clean European boutique hotel. But certainly nothing wrong with them - the beds were comfortable, air conditioning worked, reasonably quiet (insulated from street noise). Yes, the rooms (and showers) are small by american standards - but pretty typical of most of the boutique European hotels. Breakfast - European continental breakfast. Not American or British. A meat, some cheese, danish/croissant, toast, yogurt, milk, juice, coffee (american or espresso based). Again typical of a hotel such as this. Anyone who expects more should stay at one of the big (and much more expensive) hotels like the Marriot on Via Veneto. (Nothing like escaping the US by staying at the US-away-from-the-US -g-.) Staff - Very helpful. We used the staff repeatedly to help us get reservations (e.g. at the Borghese Gallery), print out reservations (at the Vatican Museum - do NOT go in August without reservations since the line at 10:30 was already 1/2 mile long or more), restaurant reservations, ... . And in all circumstances they were friendly and helpful - even when we ignored their suggestions for restaurants (they seemed to mostly know only a few of the nearer restaurants - and we were interested in exploring). Altogether about what I expected of an better boutique hotel in Europe. With the staff being more helpful than I would have expected. I'd certainly recommend it to experienced travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: foggyrabbit
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the "Garden Apartment" at the Hotel Modigliani. I will do my best to describe this "apartment". The apartment is accessed through the courtyard. You enter it through a door that opens onto the courtyard. Once you open this door, you see two more doors, each of which locks. Each door leads to a room, and each room has beds and toilet/shower. You cannot really leave the doors to the rooms open at night, as there is a light illuminating the area between the exterior door and the inner doors that cannot be turned off (at least I could never figure out how to turn it off). So, if you are travelling with younger children and want to be able to leave the doors between the two rooms open, this apartment may not be the best choice for you. I noticed that the bathroom in room 104 ventilates into the courtyard, which means that persons who may be enjoying a drink or breakfast in the courtyard can hear what takes place in that room (and vice versa). The rooms are very basic, but clean and quiet. The location is excellent, a short walk to the Villa Borghese, and the Trevi Fountain. You do, however, get what you pay for. While I found the staff quite pleasant, housekeeping neglected to provide sufficient toilet paper in the rooms on our last day. I also thought the staff unhelpful in providing accurate information about transportation to the airport. They were happy to arrange an expensive car service (70 euros for 4 people), but provided misleading information about the cost of a taxi to the airport. One of the staff told me, incorrectly, that there was no fixed tariff to the airport from inside the Aurelian wall, where the hotel is located, and stated that the fixed tariff only applied outside the wall. This was completely wrong, as I learned the next day when I booked a taxi to the airport and was advised by the driver that the rate from inside the wall was a flat 40 euros. I suspect that the staff member was simply mistaken when she provided the erroneous information, and doubt that she was trying to tout the more expensive car service. However, you would think that such basic information would be well-known by anyone working in a hotel. Breakfast was okay, although my kids kept commenting about a funky odour they noticed in the breakfast room (I never noticed it myself). So, if you want a clean, basic place in an excellent location at a reasonable price, you might want to stay here. Just remember - you can take a taxi to the airport at a flat rate of 40 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajohnson444
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April 2010. The staff could not have been more helpful and welcoming. The rooms are comfortable and very clean, ours had a small private balcony as well. I would recommend this hotel if you want to stay in central Rome. It is in an ideal location - close to the Spanish Steps and has a number of really good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, excellent location and the right price”
Reviews.Author: ckay09
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other hotels in Italy, I will say that the hotel was very clean and is rated exactly right at 3 stars. The beds were a little hard for me though. Okay breakfast, nothing lavish but enough to start the morning. The orange juice was bright red - clearly some sort of sugar product. The only flaw in otherwise an okay breakfast. The location of the hotel is very convenient walking distance to the Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and an underground train line. All-in-all a decent place to stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Charming and impeccably clean hotel with remarkably courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: TheManorFive
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani is a wonderful little hotel nestled on a suprisingly quiet street only a few minutes walk to/from the Spanish Steps/Trinita dei Monti (4-5 minutes), Piazza Barberini (2 minutes) and Via Veneto (2 Minutes). It is impeccably clean throughout! (E.g. We watched one of the staff members from a distance meticulously clean every inch of the hotel's very charming lounge area). We noted that cover blankets on the beds were changed frequently (something that many hotels don't do). The rooms are cozy, air conditioned and are stocked with a mini-bar and a safe for your valuables. Rooms also have LCD TVs (Note: Italian television has a long way to go by North American standards; watch it at your own risk. You might find it amusing only because it's so bad...but honestly, you really shouldn't waste your time with it, especially if you are in a city like Rome). Almost every wall in the hotel is decorated with some type of art: paintings, photographs, collages (...even the guest rooms!). Some of the art appeared to be contributions from friends of the owners and appreciative guests. Room rates include breakfast, which is served in the hotel's quaint breakfast room or on a small open air terrace. The breakfast room doubles as a bar/lounge for the balance of the day. Free WiFi is available in the main hotel lounge area (this is a larger guest lounge with couches, sofas and small tables where guests can read from a library of books provided by the hotel or play some traditional board games. It was a great place to cool off for a bit and gather yourself after returning from a hot day of sightseeing or shopping or to wind down before turning in for the night. Each staff member was very knowledgeable and most of all courteous. All staff members spoke English fluently. We were travelling with 3 children (12, 9 and 7 years of age) and we all had a very pleasant experience at Hotel Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “They Treat You Like Family”
Reviews.Author: RPilchSr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple immensely enjoyed our stay at Modigliani. Great breakfast, staff is very friendly and extremely helpful and free WiFi. Comfy air-conditioned lounge and an outdoor patio for relaxing. The location is on a very quiet street right off Piazza Barberini so you get the best of both worlds - a nice respite yet a close walk to everything in that section of Rome, including the Metro. Did I mention the great breakfast?

Reviews.Title: “It is a very pleasent hotel to stay in .”
Reviews.Author: chrisbourne23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights with two grand daughters aged 8 and 6. We used the garden suite which was ideal with young children The hotel is in an excellent location with all major sites within walking distance even for a 6year old . The Metro is very close . Also the Villa Borgese is near which the Children enjoyed particularily the rickshaws . Children can have to much of monuements . The accomodation is fine and the staff are very friendly and helpful . For us it was a very good choice

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: ausbiker
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the long hauls Australian flight and we appreciative of th eattentive service and help from the moment of arrival to departure 5 days later. We could walk to all the major sight seeing points in Rome with the Vatican the furthest at about 40 minutes. Rooms are "cosy" clean and comfortable and the only thing missing is in room tea coffee making facilities. Good breakfast provided in and outdoors and wifi available in the comfortable lounge. I suggwest you take the restaurant reccomendations as they were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and super clean”
Reviews.Author: andrews510
Reviews.Content: Pros: SUPER clean, great breakfasts, pretty helpful staff. Location is not in the thick of things, but it's near Spanish steps, 10 minute walk to Trevi one way and Borghese another, and VERY close to Metro stop, which is rare in Rome. Buses also worked well, and it was only 6 Euros for a taxi from Colisseum to the hotel. So, it's not in the middle of all the sights, but it's within easy striking distance by Metro, bus, walking, or taxi. We often took the Metro out to sights and then casually walked back at night (safe area). Transit strike one day meant that we had to do a lot more walking than usual because of the location, but that's pretty common in Italy. AC worked great, the room had a safe, and our room was exceptionally quiet, even though it was a street view room. Great for siestas, unless you have a loud American family next to you. Cons: Price could have been a bit more competitive, but it was Rome in the summer, after all. Standup shower was pretty tight, so if you're a larger person or pregnant with twins, you may want to ask about that ahead of time. Also, they didn't let me bring pizza back to our room. That's not really a huge deal, and I'm usually not a nag about this. However, when you carry a box of pizza from the Tiber through the hot streets of Rome, on a 92 degree day after lunch, all the while navigating through the sea of people trying to sell you roses, helicopter toys, and stupid green lasers, you naturally get peeved when they tell you that no outside food is allowed in the hotel. Although I don't agree with their food policy, I still loved the hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - hotel exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: ColleenaRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. The rooms were clean and bigger than I expected. The staff were really friendly and helpful. It was great to have internet access freely available . It is really well located - very close to many attractions and the metro. Excellent value for money. Would strongly reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, comfortable, value.”
Reviews.Author: Oz_WandererGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8amafter a long flight from Australia and were able to go straight into our room which was a wonderful start to our 3 nights here. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and all spoke English. We had an attic room at the front with balcony overlooking the quiet narrow street with beaut bed and our own lounge area. We enjoyed a couple of beautiful meals at close-by restaurants recommended by the staff and breakfast at the hotel was nicely presented and plentiful. We chose the Modigliani because of its good reviews and apparent value and fully endorse earlier reviewers' favourable comments. The location is within walking distance of everything provided you like walking as we do. Wireless internet is available in the downstairs lounge. The Modigliani - a great find!!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Positive Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: BDT76
Reviews.Content: My spouse, 23 year old daughter and I had booked an escorted tour commencing in Rome, so we decided to fly in one day early and stayed at the Modigliani. We had heard positive things about the Modigliani and were not disappointed. The service from everyone was fantastic, we had a great nights sleep (it is on a quiet street), breakfast was enjoyable, and the location extremely convenient to walk to the key sights of Rome. All too soon it was time to leave......next time we will stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: Mcusnir
Reviews.Content: It was a real nice experience to stay at Modigliani Hotel in Rome; clean comfortable and the most important, the service, they make feel at home

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, attractively decorated, warm staff - highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: irenmpage
Reviews.Content: We were an extended family group ages 18 to 67. It was a great location, handy to major sights, but on a quiet, tiny street. Staff was friendly and happy to advise - great sense of humor shown in their in-house newsletter. Reasonable price for Rome. All 7 of us were very happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very friendly staff, excellent location, attractive common areas.”
Reviews.Author: rodinrae
Reviews.Content: Staying in a room three minutes from the Piazza Barberini, and subway station, made seeing the sites of the city center a breeze. The hotel is very clean, and attractively decorated, while our room was clean and bright, with reasonable space and appointments. The staff is fluent in English, and very friendly and helpful. Making reservations, calling taxis, getting directions were all done quickly and efficiently. We even were able to get last minute reservations to the Galleria Borghese because Stefano was kind enough to wait to see if there were any cancellations on the days that we could go.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with Great Staff in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SusanL2010
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Because we were travelling with our three teenage boys, we were fortunate to have "The Apartment" which was a stand alone building with two bedrooms and two bathrooms across the lovely garden courtyard in the back of the hotel. The location was surprisingly quiet and peacful in the heart of busy Rome (just a few blocks from the Spanish Steps and the Barberini Metro station). The front desk staff was helpful with suggestions and happily made phone calls for taxis and dinner reservations. The breakfast was plentiful and tasty, with the best coffee of our two week trip. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The shower was a little tricky and might be difficult for less able travellers since there were no shower bars to hold getting in and out of the shower/tub. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jdvranek
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an exceptional time at Hotel Modigliani. Our room, 602, had the most breathtaking view of St. Peter's and Vittoriano. The staff was incredibly accommodating and made excellent suggestions for dining. It's located within walking distance to the metro. We found it easy to walk to the ruins and all the other sights. A number of beautiful restaurants and nightlife are also nearby. The WiFi connectivity is located downstairs in the lovely lobby--we found it a nice spot to unwind, check email, and drink a glass of wine. The elevator is a bit small--as is the lobby--so checking in with a lot of bags may get cramped. However, the room, location, staff and charm make it a wonderful choice.

Reviews.Title: “This was a wonderful place with friendly staff and reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: sheri13
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd Hotel we stayed at during our trip to Italy. This was my honeymoon and we found this hotel in the Fodor's book for Italy 2010. This was a great recommendation. The staff was super friendly and included in the room rate was a nice breakfast buffett. We spent 4 nights here and there was a beautiful garden where we met other travelers and drank wine and realxed after long days of tours and sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: lmagliari
Reviews.Content: During my recent trip to Italy,my friends and I stayed at Hotel Modigliani in Rome at the beginning of my trip and 15 days later at the end. It was the perfect way to begin and end a wonderful vacation. The staff at the hotel are excellent; they went above and beyond to be helpful and make our stay comfortable. It's a small hotel and this created a sense of intimacy with the hotel staff as well as other hotel guests. There's a delightful garden in the back where guests can enjoy breakfast or just share a bottle of wine at the end of the day. The location is very convenient. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: arjem
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 days in this hotel. Good location near Trevi and Spanish Steps but in very quiet street and not inundated with tourists. Small but pleasant garden to sit in after a day in Rome. Smallish rooms but good ensuite and TV with BBC World. The drinks from the bar and mini bar were very reasonable. Staff are excellent with good advice, directions and suggestions. Good selection of restaurants within 5/10 minutes walk of hotel. Breakfast was okay but we could have done with more fruit and the rumoured fruit salad was never forth coming. Guests were mainly Americans but Rome was full of Americans last week.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rcman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at Hotel Modigliano and completely enjoyed it. The location is terrific, the common spaces are excellent, the staff was friendly and very helpful, the rooms were a bit sparse but fine, the beds were very comfortable and quiet and the breakfast was fairly sparse in selection but fine, The hotel recommended restaurants were very good, ranging from the best value we've ever had in Rome to one of the best restaurants in the city. The metro stop is just a few minutes walk away and you can walk to many of the cities tourist spots in 20 minutes or less, yet the hotel is on a quiet street. All in all we competely enjoyed our stay and would stay there again and recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service, overpriced, quiet, unimaginative”
Reviews.Author: LUCKY006
Reviews.Content: Rooms were sparse but clean. Breakfast was boring and very mediocre, especially for the price of the hotel. Location was central to everything, very quiet and beds comfortable enough. Staff was very friendly and service extremely accommodating and efficient. Because of the negatives, we would seek another place if we were to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem of a "boutique" type hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAB31
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a triple room with my spouse and one grown child for three nights. The hotel's location could not have been better ---on a charming, small cobblestone street near Via Veneto and within walking distance of many of Rome's major sights (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, etc.) Also convenient to the Metro, and, as it turned out, rental car offices where we picked up a car for the next leg of our trip. Front desk staff was actively helpful in many ways. They were prepared to fill the role of a good hotel concierge. Everything that should be charming was so---the building's layout, the food and service at the daily morning buffet, etc. Our room was not huge, but spacious enough, and its amenities and appointments were quite pleasing. You will be delighted with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great website but not that friendly”
Reviews.Author: jacjosef
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely slick clean modern hotel with a nice small garden . The reception staff (probably understaffed) do their job are polite but that is all , dont expect them to go out of their way . You cant get a cup of tea at 10pm. I only stayed one night but I found greater hospitality in other hotels in Rome and far better service at a cheaper price

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Loren050410
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Modigliani based on guidance we received from our travel agent. Having never been to Rome before, we had no idea how nicely located the hotel was. Its an easy walk to everything. The hotel is tucked away on a small street that is mostly quiet. The only downside was that the tour buses couldn't get through and we had to walk to Via Veneto for our tours. The front desk was very helpful and my husband and I were particularly impressed with two things they did for us. One, when we were going to Florence for a few days, they kept our luggage so that we didn't have to take it on the train. Secondly, when our tour for the Vatican was a no show, they called the tour group continously for 45 minutes until they got through and found out what was going on. We were about to give up when they reassured us that the tour group was on their way. I would recommend that you request a room on the upper floors. During the first part of our stay we were in a room on the 5th floor facing the courtyard and it was very quiet. When we came back we had a first floor room and it was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: travelforfun14
Reviews.Content: Our flight from the US was canceled because of the volcano in Iceland. The hotel CHARGED US FOR THE NIGHT anyway. Once we finally got there, the room was small, noisy and furnished for the 12th century!! There was no place to put our clothing and the room was tiny! Go somewhere else. Anywhere else is better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Merenz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here around Easter. The hotel is very nice. Our room had a small balcony that opened out to a courtyard below. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and they spoke English. The hotel is located in a very cool part of Rome. Only a few min walk to the Spanish Steps and some very classy shops. I would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in quiet street near Via Veneto - very helpful staff and pleasant ambiance with terrific little ostaria w”
Reviews.Author: PedroTotnes_Devon
Reviews.Content: Recommended to us by a frequent visitor. Nearly everything we would wish in a small hotel - only 23 rooms - but rooms also small. Tremendous location off Piazza Barberini, 3 minutes from Via Veneto, yet quiet esp at nightime. Our room on 3rd floor (no balcony) overlooked small courtyard garden: ask for a room at the back, and try to get a balcony! Staff really helpful and good info on local places to eat. We highly recommend the Ostaria Barberini - about 30 seconds walk down the street. Try their fish soup at E25 for 2 people!! Also good Saltimbocca alla Romana. Prices reasonable compared with other rip-off local restaurants and an intro from the hotel will get you extra discounts. Hotel's breakfast is good continental with tasty croissants and also cheese etc. The cereals are very limited, but get down early before all the fruit salad goes!

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vedanne
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel located in a quiet little street between the Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese. The rooms are small, but tidy, cosy and nicely furnished. They have everything you need for a trip to Rome - where you don't want to spend the whole day indoors - but still want a comfortable place to stay - with a nice atmosphere. I went with a friend this time, but will certainly try to book one of the hotels 2 appartments for a family trip with my children. Very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Max0031
Reviews.Content: Simpel hotel in a quiet area, but excellent location next to the Via Veneto and close to the metro. Good bed, shower and breakfast. Good atmosphere with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel near the Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: Island-Jay
Reviews.Content: A great find in the heart of Rome. About a quiet block off of the Barberini Piazza & Metro stop. It’s an easy 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain. Lots of great places to eat in the area. We had two rooms; one looked over the courtyard with the noisiest thing being a pair of romantic seagulls at 3am. Our other room looked out over the front. One room had a large bathroom and the second room did have a shower that was a bit tight, but it worked. The staff was great and room came with a great breakfast. Next time we are lucky enough to be in Rome we’ll be back to the Hotel Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly and welcoming, English spoken and knowlegable staff”
Reviews.Author: spongopollo
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel, located to Via Veneto and Borghese gardens is owned and staffed by the most friendly, knowledgable English speaking team. A smile at every turn and nothing too much trouble to organise or help you with. Although small, one can walk to all places in Rome and feel the quite like a Roman. Good restaurants located clsoe by and owners and staff anxious to hear feedback. If I have a critism it is the rooms are just a little too hot(and thats from an English woman!)

Reviews.Title: “Good job!”
Reviews.Author: RenBod
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 3 days spent in the best city and best hotel! The staff was wonderful Stefano and Andrea know how to make you feel at home, our room was big enough for European standards, clean and quiet. I 'll reccomend this hotel to everyone Ren

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: roberth8867
Reviews.Content: This is not a good hotel. From the time you struggle to get your suitcase down the front door stairs into the hotel, while the staff stands by and watches with no assistance, to the ride in the smallest elevator ever, where you each have to take turns riding up with your luggage , this place stinks. The worst part is the so called "conceriege service" . They do not know what is going on in Rome..they are no help. We missed out on seeing the Vatican Museum because they reccommened we go with a tour on Friday only to find out on Thursday afternoon that the Vatican was closed. Friday..yes we missed it. The street is noisy, the room temptaure is not easy to control, the rooms are incedibly small. Do not waste your time or money here, there as so many better small hotels that know what is happening in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler416Usa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well located and well appointed. The staff is always courteous and interested in making your stay in Rome the best it can be.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlrut60
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel is a gem in the eternal city of Rome. The ladies and gentlemen who worked the desk went out of their way to make us feel at home. As one member of our party was dealing with a handicap, they called ahead each day to make sure that we would be picked up outside the door. They recommended restaurants and called cabs. They have s lovely sitting room where guests could enjoy American coffee, pastries or spirits. There is a wonderful garden that had it not been so cold would have been a respite from the long walking tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GabrielsGrandpa
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 nights at Hotel Modigiliani and found it to be excellent. The staff is fantastic--all spoke English and were very helpful with information and making reservations. Our room was small, but normal by European standards. The location is very good--close to Piazza Barberini near many good restaurants and a Metro stop. We would definitely stay there again without hesitation. A charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A FABULOUS FIND”
Reviews.Author: conversano
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights. Entire front desk staff was superb - couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Our room was up on the 3rd floor facing an interior garden courtyard. We had a small balcony to sit out on, which we did almost every evening with a glass of wine and some cookies from the great little bakery right down the street. Room was spotless and quite comfortable. Bathroom was the same. Breakfast was included and was great also. When we booked, we didn't really realize how great the location was. We were one block over from the Via Veneto, 5 minute walk to Trevi Fountain, about the same to the Spanish steps. We literally walked all over the city from this location. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful - it's ok unless anything goes wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Terminal_999
Reviews.Content: In January I arranged for a party to visit Rome. We were caught up in our outward bound flights being cancelled due to snow and subsequently arrived 1 day late. I advised the hotel immediately of the problem and asked for the reservation to be updated. When I arrived at the hotel I asked to speak to the manager about the cancellation invoice I had received for 1 nights cancellation for every room. I was advised the manager doesn't work Saturday or Sundays. I asked the hotel to show some discretion, we have booked several rooms and spent a considerable amount of money. The receptionist would not put me in direct contact with the owner and acted as a go between. The owner refused to discuss further stating that its the policy. I think the hotel could be good if the owners brushed up on their customer service skills, they are at best poor. The hotel is good unless anything goes wrong, then good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler283
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Modigliani after reading some less-than-stellar reviews of the hotel my husband had booked. We were on our honeymoon, and the balcony view was really special. We stayed for a total of four nights-- two at the beginning of our trip to Italy, one in the middle, and one at the end. At $100 per night it was a relative steal. I liked that it was close to Vio Veneto, the Villa Borghese, and some good restaurants. The subway access was very convenient. Make sure to stop by Santa Maria Della Concezione dei Cappuccini, which is just around the corner. I would definitely stay there again and will recommend it to any friends who are traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FionaFlowerpot
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Modigliani and cannot recommend it highly enough. The team at the Modigliani are an integral part of the hotel and really make this place special and the owner Giulia is never far away, and always happy to lend a helping hand to help make any guest's stay special. The location of the hotel is brilliant, very close to the Spanish steps and the Trevi Fountain, as well as links to the main train station. The rooms are simple, comfortable, very clean and functional. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely rebook should we ever have the pleasure of staying in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “central location, clean, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: frauchang
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights, it was the second time I've stayed at this hotel because I think it is a very good value. The location is very central, the metro is nearby so you can zip off anywhere you need, though you can do quite a bit in the neighborhood, as it is so close to the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. I generally liked the breakfast, delicious crostata, and they also had some protein options like boiled eggs, cheese and yogurts, so it was quite filling. The wifi worked well in my room. The hotel is very clean, and the staff quite friendly and helpful. I will likely stay here again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DiannaD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid August for four nights. The first two nights we had a large room with a balcony and a sitting area. It was booked the last two nights so we had a standard room. This room was very small so during the time frames we were relaxing at the hotel, we used the lounge/lobby and that was fine. The hotel is in a great location. It is clean, comfortable, quiet and has a good breakfast. The best part of the hotel is the friendly staff. They DO make a difference. This is a Thank You to ALL of them for their help. It was very much appreciated. The Spanish Steps are close by and on Friday evenings in the summer, at least, they have a variety of things going on there. Go over and check it out. The staff suggested several restaurants. Our favorite was at the top of the hill and just to the right. You can also get directions to a supermarket nearby to get snacks, lunch food and drinks. It is worthwhile to book a tour of the Vatican and the Coliseum. It will save you MUCH standing in line and offer you insights you won't get on your own.

Reviews.Title: “I loved staying here”
Reviews.Author: travellinglady1
Reviews.Content: I loved the ambiance, helpful friendly staff, the location, the intimate feeling of this small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HiltonAC
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay at in Rome. The price was reasonable and it included breakfast. The rooms were small but clean and fine for a place to sleep while we were out all day exploring. The location is close the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain, as well as being close to the Subway. There was nothing extraordinary about the hotel, but it was solid and served its purpose on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Randilynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here four nights in October. The location is fantastic -- just steps away from the Spanish Steps. A great location to visit many of the attractions. Our room was small, but comfortable, with a tiny balcony. The breakfast, included in the price, was quite nice. And the staff -- well, we couldn't say enough nice things about them. Everyone at the front desk is extremely pleasant and helpful and all seem to really enjoy their job and meeting people. If we return to Rome, we would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel central to Rome's highlights and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel1111
Reviews.Content: The Modigliani is a very nice traditional Italian hotel, in a perfect location near many of Rome's highlights. The staff was always very helpful, it was nice to leave the key at the front desk each time we left, and the staff was especially patient with us when we returned very late a few nights since we were enjoying wedding festivities all weekend. The shower was a little small (for a guy who lifts weights), but the room was spacious and certainly a good value. They serve contintental breakfast like most, and it was nice and clean. It is the best value in the best location!

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ScooterKitchener
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Modigilani for three nights in late September. The private car that picked us up at the airport was arranged through the hotel. It was a relaxing way to start our vacation. From the moment we arrived, the front desk staff was wonderful. Stefano and Dario in particular were great with maps, schedules, recommendations, and even making dinner reservations for us. The location of the hotel is incredible; close to the subway, great restaurants, and just a few minutes from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The hotel is very clean and nicely decorated. And the balcony in our Little Honeymoon Suite was a great place to unwind at the end of each day. When we checked out, Marco was there to personally thank us for staying at his hotel. We loved everything about Hotel Modigliani, and look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault”
Reviews.Author: LooLoo029
Reviews.Content: This is a very cute boutique hotel in a fantastic location near the Spanish Steps... and good price as well. The reception staff were amazing and would go to great lengths to help in anyway including looking up train/bus timetables and directions. There is no view but there is a nice garden area at the back if you want some fresh air. The rooms are clean and beds comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent reception staff ... rooms soundproofing a bit of an issue though”
Reviews.Author: AlexNorfolk_UK
Reviews.Content: I have yet to come across reception staff as helpful as Dario etc. Free wi-fi was appreciated as is the humour of the hotel owners. On the negative side, noise is a bit of an issue. If people leave or arrive on your floor, you will more than likely wake up. Room decoration was a tad too austere as well. But for the location and the intimacy, we would probably re-visit it. Cost 378 euros for 2 nights in standard room inc breakfast. I would suggest HM reconsider their recommendation of a restaurant called 'Girarrosto Fiorentino' which was thoroughly overpriced for very underwhelming food. AD

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sharp025
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff in a great location - within walking distance of all main attractions. Breakfast good and all requests dealt with promptly. Our room was on the small side but clean with very comfortable beds. We faced the small street but it was very quiet. The shower was a little compact but worked well. I would definitely stay here again but would probably go for one of the large rooms with balcony on the sixth floor next time as I'd like a good view!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwws
Reviews.Content: In July ’09, a friend and I stayed 9 nights in 2 separate rooms at this hotel. What else can I say that is nice and good about this little hotel that has not already been said by others? It has the best central location and it's close to everything. The friendliest and most efficient staff I think I've encountered in all my years of travel. The room and bath are super clean. Since it's situated on a small street, it's peaceful and quiet. I read one comment about it being on a steep hill. Well, if you look at the map of the Spanish Steps/Piazza Barberini neighborhood, you’ll discover other less steep approaches to the hotel, i.e. via Via Sistina then turn on Via Francesco Crispi, a quick turn on to Via Degli Artisti and then Via Purificazione down or, up the steps, yes steps, off Via Veneto or other side streets (after all, to see Rome and many other places properly, one has to be reasonably fit—think ancient cobblestones in Foro Romano) The breakfast is perfectly acceptable but it doesn’t ever change. Overall, the price and the service at this Hotel are excellent especially for Rome. I really couldn’t ask for more. The Hotel staff also has a few good restaurant suggestions. Girrarosta Fiorentino http://www.girarrostofiorentino.it/ right by the U.S. Embassy, however, is a must! It costs a bit more (oh, do get off the pizza by the slice and Spaghetti Bolognese once in a while!) but what delicious food and such an interesting and reasonably priced wine list. The atmosphere is a real throwback to the late 50's and 60's, the heyday of Marcello Mastrioianni, Sophie Loren, Fellini, "La Dolce Vita" etc., so elegant and classy. In a few more years, it'll probably be gone. One last bit of advice. Stay a few more days to get a feel of the place before hurrying off to go elsewhere. Rome wasn't built in a day and it takes many more to begin to really enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico!”
Reviews.Author: ACanuckToronto
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a gem of a hotel in Rome, thanks to a recommendation from friends. Great value. Very clean and quiet. Excellent staff. Really deserves a four star rating. Well-placed, just two blocks from the Metro. What a wonderfully memorable stay. Thanks Giuliana and Marco and staff. We will return. Sheila and Mark Gregory. Burlington ON Canada

Reviews.Title: “Superior Staff and wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTeacher59
Reviews.Content: We experienced the best that Rome had to offer meeting the wonderful staff at Hotel Modigliani. From check in to check out we were treated with kindness and respect. My boys (22 & 23) and I stayed in the independent apartment across the street, and felt right at home using all of the amenities offered in the main hotel. The best feature is the central location and proximity to all of the wonderful sights. You are close to the Spanish steps, shopping and marvelous restaurants. Our favorite was Marcello's!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome”
Reviews.Author: hildemy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani is a very nice and medium size hotel. It is situated about 200 meters from Piazza Berberini. Perfect it you want to get to know Rome by foot. The staff is serviceminded and speaks english well. The rooms are neat and clean, and they are bright colored. The hotel serves continental breakfast. If you want something besides white bread, yoghurt and jam, you should go out for brekfast - but by all means; it is OK food in the hotel. The best part about staying at this hotel is that it is in walkingdistance to almost all the tourist attractions - from the Pantheon and Colosseum till Saint Peters Square and the Vatican. You really don`t need much money for transport here.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful location, staff and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sophia32
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at Hotel Modigliani. It is truly a wonderful hotel. Starting with the staff - what a great group of folks! They are so friendly, helpful and have a great sense of humor and fun about them. They always go the extra step...whether it is with directions, recommendations or advice. The rooms are adorable, clean, and have great water pressure. Also, it was extremely hot this trip and the AC was just perfect. The hotel is located right near the Spanish Steps and is also a short walk to the Barberini metro station. The breakfast is wonderful and it's so nice to sit outside in the garden and plan the day's activies over a great cup of cappucino. It's a great value and quite the hidden gem. Thanks, Ms. Amoroso

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in this friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: hkcjmc
Reviews.Content: This was the final stop on a mother-daughter trip to London, Paris, Sorrento, and Rome. The hotel feels like a comfortable, family-run hotel that's a bit quirky...not like a big chain or a pretentious boutique hotel. It was nice. They even had a cute little newsletter that told you about the staff and nearby restaurants. The staff were very friendly..recommended/made reservations for 3 good restaurants, gave us ice when we asked, and generally answered our many questions with a smile. When we had to leave before breakfast service (for tours and airport), we were given pastries and juice. On the down side, I couldn't get the free wi-fi that was supposed to be available in the lobby to work despite trying it from several different locations. Felt a bit like the "Can you hear me now" commercials. Although the location was convenient to the Spanish Steps, restaurants, banks, and shopping, it was up a very steep hill. Would not recommend it for people with limited mobility. The room was adequate/clean. Biggest con is definitely the shower. I'm 5'4'' and it was almost too small for me--yikes! When I washed my hair, both of my elbows were touching the shower walls. My mom (she's 5'1'') and I started leaving the sliding shower doors open a bit just to decrease the closed-in feeling. Would I stay here again? I don't think so...mainly because of the shower. I loved the attitude of the place though. Having trouble deciding if I'd recommend it to a friend...I'm going to say yes, but I'd be sure to warn them about the shower, hill, and wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NapervilleTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Modigliani July 27,28,30,31, 2009. Took a side trip to Sorrento on July 29. EVERYTHING was wonderful. We had a great room the first 2 nights. We had early AM appts,before breakfast. Dario made sure we had something to eat and drink before we left each day. We stored our luggage when we left for Sorrento, and when we came back, it was waiting for us in an apartment room! Great service, this is what all hotels should be like. Dario, Andre, Sylvia and Stefano-great job!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on - made the trip”
Reviews.Author: nakedcowgirl
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a typical European small hotel in a side-street, but we walked in to a lovely, welcoming small hotel in a quiet but convenient side-street. Admittedly we had the top floor balcony room, but we couldn't fault the stay. Breakfasts were small but varied and good (except the coffee - the espresso was so bad I was forced to drink "Cafe Americana" - yes, it was that ordinary). Staff were always friendly, and as we were there a week they ended up having the room key ready for us when we walked in the door. Americans - take the concierge's advice. There are better restaurants than those near the Hard Rock cafe / American embassy and Via Venuto. Free internet, comfortable lounge, air-conditioning that worked, welcoming staff in a quiet location, but close to sights and metro (a rareity in Rome). It really made the stay to have a hotel you wanted to go back to. We actually had lunch / dinner on the balcony a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay at Hotel Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: nic12cm21
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Hotel Modigliani from June 29th until July 3rd. The reviews are true--it's in a great location, close to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain, etc. The room and bathroom were small, but clean and comfortable. They gave us a hotel newsletter at the start of our stay, which was funny and original. Breakfast was okay--there wasn't much "protein" and a few hard-boiled eggs (this was offered at the prior 2 hotels we stayed at in Italy) would have been welcomed. There is a lovely garden where you can eat breakfast, which we took advantage of most mornings. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helfpul. The first night was blissfully quiet but our last 3 nights were a little noisier, as a large group of people came and were staying on our floor, and we learned the walls are quite thin--lots of door-slamming, talking, and we could even hear their sink and toilets flushing...but, I guess this is normal for many Italian hotels? Overall, very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: longtimetravelers53
Reviews.Content: The Modigliani has small, but comfortable well appointed rooms, good air conditioning which was not turned off at night as in some hotels, a good breakfast, and excellent staff--probably the best staff of any small hotel I've stayed in. It is conveniently located. Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about Hotel Modigliani!”
Reviews.Author: reluctantraveller77
Reviews.Content: My first clue that we had made the right decision to stay at Hotel Modigliani was from the cab driver at the airport. Of course he knew where it was--in the best location in Rome to walk to all the historic and cultural sights--20 minute walk at the most to the Coliseum. He was right. The hotel was perfectly situated to everything we wanted to see in our two days in Rome. We are a family of 5, three of whom are in their 20s. We needed two rooms but were cost conscious and didn't want to spend a fortune. They offered us 2 apartments next to each other that were plenty roomy and each had their own bathroom. We also had a small patio outside our apartment where we could take our breakfast later in the morning. One of the most interesting sites in Rome is closeby on the Via Veneto and should be on everyone's itinerary--The Cappuchin Crypt! They recommended one of the best restaurants we experienced in our 2 week stay in Italy, Girarrosto Fiorentino in the area near the US Embassy. I would definitely stay there anytime I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location on a quiet sidestreet; we had an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: PikoVancouver
Reviews.Content: Dear Reader, We were in Rome over Easter and so it was difficult to find reasonable accommodation. We were very happy with the hotel. The staff were very friendly. The breakfast was good. Our standard room was on the small side, although clean and comfortable. To make up for this, the hotel has a very large lounge area as well as an outdoor sitting area. The location is very central (we generally went by foot or used public transit) and, as a bonus, is on a quiet sidestreet. We had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mamona84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Modigliani for two nights and had a great time. Though, Rome is'nt a city where you spend so much time in a hotel - the city itselfs has so much you should see and experience, so the only thing you do in the hotel is sleep and shower. We were met by a very nice receptionist who gave us advise of what to see and what to do. Then we got a brouchure from the hotel, which also includes some tip on where to eat. We booked at the advised restaurants for both nights, and had two perfect meals. The rooms were ok size, clean and with no strange smells. The view from the room was directly to one of the mainattractions, or to the very cozy garden in the 1. floor. If I should find one big negative thing it is that it was very thin walls between the rooms. I actually heard the man in the neighbourroom breath when he was sleeping! So it's no hotel for lovers.. But all the rest was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful boutique hotel; friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Geggy28
Reviews.Content: Lovely view from balcony, top floor room. Room spacious, bathroom shower rather small. Everything a delight! Location very convenient. We had a lovely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling at home in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: pehafly
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 small kids (4 and 1 year) and have been doing siteseeing in the beginning of March for one week. As this is always difficult with small children and definately more in Rome, it was important for us, to have a place where we could lay back and relax. Modigliani provided us with an appartement (room 601) including a small kitchen, which was a very positive added value, and plenty of space for a very reasonable price. The staff is very friendly and the roomservice is good. Although dishwashing is not included, the maid did it two or three times. The room itself seems to be new, its clean, nice and functional and located in the first floor of the opposite building on the other side of a tranquil one way road. I only missed a coat rack to hang the jackets. With a buggy its a little difficult to get through the narrow house door, but doing siteseeing seriously, you need to do that only twice a day - morning out, evening in. Breakfast is nothing outstanding but quite good average in Italy - at least you get a caffè latte on request. The location is very good, you can have a short walk to piazza di spagna, fontana di trevi, or a little longer one to the park of villa borghese, or you take one of the different buses to get e.g. to the capitol within 10 minutes or directly to the vatican in maybe 15 minutes. Summarizing all that - for us it was a perfect stay and even our kids enjoyed it very much. Anytime I would return to this Hotel. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: LRB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Modigliani for four nights in early March. The location is very good, close to the subway and within walking distance to all the sites. Great service and helpful staff. The room (standard double) was small but comfortable, with a nice balcony. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ekcihey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, only a few minutes walk from the Metro, Spanish steps & Trevi Fountain. Although the hotel was in a great location, it was in a quiet area. The hotel staff were very helpful and quick to respond to issues (the only one we had was a blown light bulb which was fixed in 3 minutes). The room was small and clean. I paid about 430 Euros for 3 nights in early April - rather expensive but that's Rome. Negatives: the walls between the rooms were quite thin and you could hear conversations. The pillows were very hard and the beds very firm and bouncy. If your partner rolls over in the night expect to be bounced out of the bed (and my partner is only 8 stone). Our room didn't have a bath only a shower. The breakfast was simple with no frills. A few tips on the rest of Rome: The main shopping area is on the Via Del Corso which was about 10 mins walk from the hotel. If you like Prada, Versace etc, you'll find a whole street of these brands on Via Condotti (near the Spanish Steps) - again only a few mins walk from the hotel. Many of the locations around Rome are easy to walk to but be aware that most streets are cobbled to you will need some very comfortable shoes. My wife advises the ladies to not wear high heels or stilettos. The Metro is very cheap about 1 Euro to get to most places. There are also lots of buses and trams to hop on and off. If you want to go on tours then I'd recommend Eden Walks - they did a great job for us. Food is expensive - about London Prices. Drinks are very expensive - expect to pay 4 to 5 Euros for a 33cl bottle of beer/coke/water. Coffee is also similarly expensive and you get a very small cup. We tried a whole variety of different restaurants and the food was quite plain and not of a very high quality. The food in a good Italian restaurant in England is far better. Rome offers some fantastic architecture and history - around nearly every corner you'll find a building that would stand out in most other cities. I recommend the Vatican Tour and St Peter's (San Pietro) Basilica if you can only do two things. If you have more time then head off to the Colosseum and Roman Forum which can take a full day. Note there is no shelter in the Roman Forum so expect to take adequate protection.

Reviews.Title: “This boutique hotel has a fantastic location and extremely helpful staff .”
Reviews.Author: paullisaEngland
Reviews.Content: It is located near the Spanish steps and is within walking distance of all the major sights . The rooms are excellent , particularly room 602 on the top floor - the balcony has stunning views of the Rome skyline . The staff are extremely friendly and helpful - their restaurant recommendations were well worth listening to . Would definitely recommend this hotel . We'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Friendly, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: BuonAppetitoMaryland
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located near the Spanish steps in Rome--a great central location. The room was very clean and had a nice view of the rooftops of Rome. The room was small, but had all the amenities--nice bathroom with big fluffy towels and even a towel warmer. The bed was comfortable with a nice reading lamp next to it. I did not have an opportunity to eat the breakfast which was included because I had to leave for the airport too early. However, the person working at the desk went to the breakfast area and prepared me a wonderful cup of coffee with warm milk almost an hour before the breakfast area opened. The very best part of the hotel was the staff. Each person was friendly and helpful. They even recommended a wonderful small family-run restaurant where they themselves like to eat. The food was delicious! It was the first time I have ever gotten a good restaurant from a hotel recommendation. On top of it all the price was very reasonable especially for Rome. I hope to be able to go there again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Decent,comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: NafLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Decent comfy hotel...great location,close to most of the attractions and the bus stop is just at the end of the street. The room we stayed in was quite small but the bathroom was a good size. I have to compliment on the clenliness of the room and hospitality of the staff. Breakfast could be better....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: kbignell
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and knowledgable & nothing was too much trouble. The room was fine, if a little small, and extremely quiet for a city centre hotel (quietest rooms are at the back) The location is perfect, everything we wanted to see was within 30 minutes walk. Best thing, excellent service. Worst thing, the Americano coffee (best to get freshly made expresso & top up with hot water and/or milk).

Reviews.Title: “Well located quiet hotel at great price.”
Reviews.Author: jmbmfb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 5 nights at this hotel. We also had my wife's Aunt traveling with us and staying in a separate room. I thought it was a great hotel. It is very well located and is extremely quiet at night, which was very important to me. The rooms are about the size one would expect in Europe but are very nicely decorated, have all the appropriate amenities, and are spotless. The breakfasts are typical in a nice breakfast room. There is a very pretty sitting area. We were there off season and the prices were really great. We have traveled a lot in Europe and I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel at any price. The staff, to a person, were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here if we go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet place in a good location”
Reviews.Author: LilyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani is a small hotel in a very convenient location. It's a short walk to the Piazza Barberini, but far enough up the hill to be away from all the hustle and bustle and it's not far from the Spanish Steps. The staff is friendly and eager to please and the rooms are clean. We stayed on the top floor with a wonderful view of the city. The breakfast was just ok. We enjoyed our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malteser65
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel and we were not disappointed. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The room was spotlessly clean and we had a superb shower. Can't beat the location. Would definitely stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: dgcCambs
Reviews.Content: The welcome on arrival is as bright as the colourful interior. The friendly Reception team are unfailingly helpful, keen that guests should make the most of Rome. In an expensive city, this hotel offers good rooms and very good service at a reasonable price. The standard rooms are simple, comfortable and clean. A first floor patio and a basement sitting room are valuable corners for the weary tourist to recover. In its quiet location, yet so near to the action, this is a great base for value conscious visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Romance”
Reviews.Author: Ben0B
Reviews.Content: Can you fall in love with a building? You can, when it is as beautiful and full of personality and friendly people as Hotel Modigliani. In five mostly sunny winter days, we walked the wonders of the Eternal City and returned each time to a warm welcome and a room with a view that uplifted the spirit. And if all that wasn't enough, the Italian Starlings performed a sunset aerial ballet, swooping and swirling over the Dome of St. Peter's. Miribile dictu, and no mistake. Experience, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: independent50s
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. We stayed in one of their spacious adjoining apartments after negotiating a very reasonable (for Rome) price. After weeks of hotel rooms, it was nice to spread out and have a mini kitchen. The rooms were impeccably clean and spacious. Reception staff spoke excellent English and nothing was too much trouble.
