Breakfasts were excellent. You can sense the pride the staff have in the hotel. Location is superb...very quiet,10 minutes to top of Spanish Steps, many restaurants in the nearby Piazza. Laundromat (with Internet point) and metro 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful service”
Reviews.Author: MillieYassNSW
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Modigliani a wonderful friendly, helpful place to stay - the reception staff outstanding - we had lots to do Valarie and she could not have been more helpful. Handy to the railway and walking distance to Spanish Steps - wonderful resturants around - take a look at the newsletter from the hotel - most helpful. Sally from Australia

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: alisonthompson388
Reviews.Content: Centrally located of the Piazza Barberini. Up a side street so not too noisy. Staff efficient, friendly and welcoming. Must stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Inspirational Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: joaniemason
Reviews.Content: Giulia & Marco, Modigliani's owners are brilliant... This very quaint hotel provides such kindness to it's guests. They have published a book that takes you on walking tours of Rome in such an unusual way...you see the 'other Rome'!!! If you have a chance, stay at the charming hotel....your heart will soar!!!!! Joanie & Richard Mason Los Angeles, California

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful Haven”
Reviews.Author: Ffriddygog
Reviews.Content: This was a small and very friendly hotel in a very convenient location for seeing the tourist areas of Rome. The staff were very helpful. The bedroom was clean and comfortable and there was a very pleasant lounge area where there was a plentiful supply of tourist books for browsing through. There was also a small garden area for sitting in. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Roman Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LawyerMike33
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a wonderful hotel in Rome, I urge you to give the Hotel Modigliani a try. The location is fantastic, and the hotel staff could not be nicer or more accomodating. The rooms are very clean and quiet, and the service staff does a great job with getting the rooms made up early in the day. Again, if you are looking for a small, intimate hotel, where personal service really counts, then book a room at the Modigliani. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: PecsNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect,walking distance to trevi fountain,spanish steps and more.Staff was very nice and recommended a really could restaurant around the corner.Rooms are small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Tireless
Reviews.Content: Just returned with my mother and aunt, We spent 7 days with Hotel Modigliani, there is a 'little' lift to the floors, cannot fault the staff. Very helpful, phoned resturants for us, found out and printed train times to Anzio wake up calls everyday (on time) and were always interested in how our day went. Breakfast room was a lovely little area, the breakfast was always the same but so is mine at home every day with less selection! and I have to make it! We had a triple room which was adequate for a base (you need to be close to whoever you are staying with!) It was also very clean and we all had fun trying to squeeze into the bathroom/shower. A little selection of soaps and shower products for us to use. Clean towels everyday and your bed turned down at night with a little chocolate left. We chose hotel Modigliani for the little garden and it was so cute and great in the mornings before breakfast and in the evenings after a hard day to sit out in. Location was excellent, 5 mins walk to the spanish steps and the Trevi fountain, we also managed to walk back from the pantheon without much trouble. The Metro which even we managed to figure out! and the open top bus is just down the end of the street, and you have a mountain of places to eat. We ate icecream from Valentinos every night he is near the Trevi fountain. We never bought water we would just fill up at the top of the hotel street or half way down the bottom out of the water fountains. My only two little moans were that the garden was shut for maintenance for the last three days of our holiday and we were not informed beforehand and we couldn't have a packed breakfast made for us one morning when we were leaving at seven to go for a trip. All in all we had a wonderful stay made even better by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location....”
Reviews.Author: Free2Trvl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Modigliani for three nights while touring around Rome and found it very comfortable. The hotel is located about a 5 minute walk from the Spanish steps and just up the road from the Barberini Metro stop. I attempted to return a rental car before checking in however the agency was closed so I went to the hotel first and the young gentlemen at the front desk immediately called the rental car company and provided directions on where to return the car. Then, upon learning that it was just I who would be occupying the room, slashed 15 euros off my daily rate; so I knew then it would be a pleasant experience. Make no mistake however that this hotel is quite basic but the owners invested in what counts! The rooms are very clean, and I had quite a decent size bathroom with a large glass enclosed shower. Obviously their are numerous room layouts as other reviewers had some negative reviews of the bathroom, however I thought the accommodations were very comfortable. Its obvious from the staff that this hotel caters to mostly americans, which was just a safe bet, as you never know especially in a city like rome what you could end up with. I happen to visit on an italian holiday where many of the museums and other points of interest were closed for several days. The staff thoroughly researched this and upon originally providing some ill advice on the sistine chapel, caught me just before leaving for the day to inform me that they were in fact open, which showed me that they were willing to go the extra mile for the guests. I also felt the rate was very reasonable. If you're focused more on the bottom line and are looking for a great location with friendly service, I highly recommend the Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “Modigliani a perfect getaway spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tacowolf
Reviews.Content: We were searching for a property near the Spanish Steps and found this. A small property with extremely helpful staff and a decent breakfast. It was very convenient for walking around Rome. The room was smallish, as they are in most European hotels, but the bed was very comfortable and it suited our needs perfectly. I would recommend this wholeheartedly for a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worked really well for us.”
Reviews.Author: Chica-linda
Reviews.Content: Good location, near metro station and walkable to everywhere. Clean rooms, albeit a bit small. We had breakfast included and it was yummy! We spent 5 nights there and used it as a homebase to really enjoy Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended as first choice”
Reviews.Author: yankeesman714
Reviews.Content: The positives about this hotel are that it is conveniently located near the Spanish Steps and the air conditioning worked well. Other than that, there was not much to make this hotel special or unique. The staff was OK but not especially helpful. This hotel seems to cater to Americans (most of the guests were American). So if you're looking for Italian style and flavor, this hotel is not for you. The rooms were very small and more expensive than other hotels in the area. The general opinion we had of Hotel Modgiliani was that it's OK but check around first before booking here. There are lots of better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: stellamo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying two nights at the Hotel Modgliani.Great staff, great location. The rooms are a bit on the small side but were very clean and fresh. The bathrooms vary from room to room. WE had booked 3 rooms and some had big showers others were quite small. I highly recommend this hotel for sightseeing in ROme.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: RobgLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night as a stop over in Rome. It was in a fairly good location for getting to see the sights of Rome but I wouldn't recommend this as a hotel to stay in for any length of time. Our room was very small and rather dated. It was fairly clean but it wasn't particularly comfortable. I think it was quite poor value for money and that you can probably find a lot more for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Personal Touch - Loved Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolChuckles
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked in for the weekend as it was her birthday. I have absolutley no hesitation in recommending this fantastically situated, friendly hotel. The hotel itself was really easy to find. It's literally 2 mins walk from the main metro line thats 2 stops from Termini station and has all the other main tour sites on the same line. The hotel interior is lovely. The staff there were fantastic and couldn't do enough to help us. We'd booked via laterooms.com and they'd booked us a queen bed, instead of 2 doubles. The receptionist immediately sorted this out for us, giving us a tripple room at no extra cost. All the staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. We hadn't told them it was my sisters birthday, but they had checked our passports when we checked in and, when we returned from a days sightseeing ,we found a lovely bottle of prosecco with 2 champagne flutes and a happy birthday note from the owners. It was a really lovely touch and helped make my sisters birthday special. The beds were comfy, the minibar was well stocked and very reasonable and the bathroom was spacious with a really good shower. 2 main tour buses stop at the bottom of the road and there are loads of good bars and restaurants around Piazza Barberini which is right on the hotels doorstep. Some extra tips - definitely book your tickets to get into the Colosseum online before you go as the queues can be huge. We also booked a Sunset walking tour of ancient rome through viator which lasted 3 hours and was worth every penny. We also booked the open bus tour through viator as the bus stopped at the Piazza Barberini which was really handy. One other tip - the dress code for entering St Peters Cathedral is really really strict. Please make sure you wear something thats below the knee and have your shoulders covered. We saw loads of people turned away for even having their knees showing!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots to like about Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: AM-TJ
Reviews.Content: our 4 night stay during second week of July was very enjoyable. I found the previous comments perplexing as we needed wake-up calls three of the four days and they came exactly at the time requested. We booked the independent apartment across the street for 3 of the 4 nights and it was fabulous. Good sized bedroom, nice bathroom and a sitting area. very accommodating staff for the most part. Helpful with restaurants and tours. I got a bit of resistance when asking for extra towels and pillows, but they showed up nevertheless. We went to two of the restaurants they recommend in their 'newsletter' and they were great food and very good prices. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “a bit incompetent...”
Reviews.Author: casablanca22
Reviews.Content: Given the reviews, I was looking forward to my stay, but was extremely disappointed. My mother-in-law was travelling with us and had a much better experience than we did. The room was fine, until we sat on the bed. It was slanted, and that's not the best way to spend 4 nights. Then, we had issues almost every morning. The first morning, we were woken up by housekeeping at 6:50 am. When we asked at the front desk, we were told that it must have been the new person. Next, we asked for a wake-up call at 7:30 am. The call came in at 6:30 am. Another day, it was 15-20 minutes early (better, but still not good). On the final night, the recepionist asked if we wanted a wake-up call. At first I said yes, but given the history, I said no---at least 3 times. Wouldn't you know it, we got a wake-up call. For the first few mornings, we had breakfast in the garden. We were not allowed to get anything until I gave over the breakfast coupons. Hard to imagine someone wanting to steal a dry croissant, but guess so. Then, we had breakfast inside, and while still not large, there were more options. We were just never told that. Now, the hotel was clean, and the room was adequate overall (but beware-the shower is a 2x2 box). It's on the top of a steep hill, so if you have trouble walking up hills, you'll end up taking cabs. Again, my mother-in-law didn't have the same issues we had, but each day, we kept wondering what would happen next.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanLLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Hotel Modigliani. We booked a standard room so we were expecting just a basic room, which was what we got. It was not large but fine for a short stay. If you are going to spend more than a few nights there I would probably upgrade. The room and bathroom were very clean and toiletries were provided. The only complaint about the bathroom was the shower which is very tiny. A large person would have a very hard time using it. The closet had ample shelves and hangers. The breakfast buffet was very nice with cereal, juice, fruit and bread and pastries, and we had wonderful cappucini every morning. There is a nice sitting area just below the lobby where you can read or just relax. Best of all was the staff. The people at the front desk are wonderful, very nice, patient, and accommodating. The housekeepers and staff in the breakfast room were great too. And you can't beat the location. We were within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The metro is right on Piazza Barberini which is just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickelass
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in a book tittled "Special Places to Stay", and it couldn't have better lived up to its promise. It's a quaint hotel on a quiet street between Piazza Barberini and the Spanish Steps. The location is great for seeing all of Rome, as it is very central. The rooms were very clean, and we even had a balcony! Our room was filled with sunshine and incredibly charming. The hotel staff was also very nice, and happy to provide recommendations for restaurants, or help with any other request. Even though this is only a 3 star, it was an incredibly value and felt very clean and nice. I would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: smilingathena
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent three wonderful nights in Rome and were so happy that we chose Hotel Modligiani. The location is perfect -close to the Metro, Spanish Steps, Tivoli Fountains, Borghese Museum...we spent most days walking to all the sites and took the train to the Vatican and other spots that were further away. Valerie was especially helpful and friendly at the front desk, always pleasant and friendly -- with a smile. Breakfast on the outside patio was another special place within the confines of the small, intimate hotel. We also enjoyed a bottle of wine and fruit on the outside patio during the late afternoon. Very quiet street as well. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Gem”
Reviews.Author: Yonderhill
Reviews.Content: The combination of a small size, lovely appointments and an all star staff gives the Modigliani great charm and enables guests quickly to feel welcome and at home. Its location on a quiet street near the Borghese Gardens makes it possible to walk to many attractions or gain easy access to public transportation. And its rates are quite reasonable by Rome's standards. Many Roman hotels are bigger, but none that my wife and I have stayed at appeals to us as much as the Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: filosab
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Welcoming staff. We arrived in the morning and they gladly held our bags while we went exploring in Rome. When we got back, our bags had already been delivered to our room. The room was small and lovely. Bathroom was super clean, roomy, and stylish, plenty of ammenities. Room is cozy, simple, quaint. Window view was nice. The breakfast is wonderful! Coffee bar, pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit, toast, meats, cheeses. Exceeded expectations. Very close to everything! Will definitely stay again. Very satisfied, good value for location and time of year.

Reviews.Title: “3 star = 5 star”
Reviews.Author: David002
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a sense of playfulness + humour that runs through all the staff - they were all helpful and interested in what the guests are planning and how they got on on a day's visit in Rome. Handy to get places - no hesitation in recommending Hotel Modigiani.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller18England
Reviews.Content: Following a recommendation in, 'Alastair Sawday's Special Places to Stay - Italy', we booked a room direct with the hotel via email. The hotel was excellently located. The hotel staff were very helpful, polite and welcoming for the entirety of the stay. The hotel owners produce a light hearted leaflet detailing, among other things, local restuarant recommendations which proved to be useful and accurate. We had a standard double with a balcony (enough for two to sit out on) and ensuite shower room. It was adequate but a little cramped at times. The hotel did not have wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: cmt9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with 6 friends recently stayed at Hotel Modigliani. It was a great experience. The hotel is charming. The location is perfect and breakfast was delicious. The rooms are a good size; extremely clean and very comfortable. The staff were terrific, always pleasant, informative and very helpful to tired tourists. If I ever return to Rome, this is where I want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is my new favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saintpetepaul
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Modigliani is a perfect hotel for a short stay in Rome. I had the good fortune to stay at the Modigliani for the previous two weekends and was pleasantly surprised by both the quality of my room and the attentiveness of the staff. I felt genuinely welcome to be there and that's a rare thing indeed. The Modigliani is small enough to be an intimate setting and it offers an oasis of quiet in hectic Rome. Its location is perfect, the hotel is on a quiet, narrow, residential street and it's within easy walking distance to most of the attractions that bring people to Rome in the first place. Also within easy reach are the Metro and bus stops. I will be back and I would encourage anyone to stay at the Modigliani if you have the opportunity to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aoifs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend two years ago and we had a great time. When I was organising a trip for my father,grandfather and uncle it was a natural choice as I was familiar with it. The staff in the hotel could not have been more helpful. The hotel was booked out on all of the sites that I normally use, so on the off-chance I emailed the hotel directly asking for 2 rooms. They emailed back to say that they had two rooms available on the friday night but only a double room available on the second night. They offered to put an extra bed in the twin room so that the three guests could stay together. They also arranged pickups from the airport which worked out really well. My family came home with a fantastic impression of the hotel and my father said that the staff were the friendliest that he had ever met.. They were chatty and extremely happy to recommend restaurants and bus tours etc. It really helped to make their trip to Rome memorable. The hotel itself is lovely with a small courtyard in the middle. The rooms are very clean and the location is superb! I would definitely recommend this hotel and I know that some friends and family members are already planning trips over with this hotel in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Problem, Partially Resolved”
Reviews.Author: jcfnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here upon the recommendation of a doctor we know. It was the most reasonably priced hotel in Rome that was in a central location. The bed in our room was broken (we stayed in one of the rooms in the "apartment" off the garden) and after a few long distance phone calls with the manager upon our return to the US, he did refund 1/3 of our room charge (although we wanted a full refund). Apparently, the front desk person could have offered for us to stay at a different hotel and I think they would have paid the difference, but that was not offered to us. It worked out ok in the end, but it was a frustrating experience as all you want is a good bed - they were unable to move us to another room as the hotel was booked. I would recommend the hotel, but unfortunately we didn't have a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DavidKeltner
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to this wonderful hotel. I cannot wait to go back again. It's a tiny botique hotel with the best location! You can easily walk to all the major tourist attractions in Rome. The staff is wonderful, friendly and helpful. Don't miss Steffano and Adrianno. They are great. The breakfasts are memorable. Who could ask for anytime more. The owners are also charming folks, who set the tone for this great little gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “modigliani great location”
Reviews.Author: ianEngland
Reviews.Content: Hotel small up a side street . It was very clean and and staff very friendly and helpful esp on the desk . English understood . Bedrooms basic and functional again very clean but beds comfortable and bath rooms sparkling with a good powerful shower . The location is excellent and you are within walking distance of all the main sites except the Vatican which is only a 10 min ( depending on traffic) taxi ride away . The only downsides , breakfast very basic and the cost per room high for basically a B&B but the euro vs pound exchange rate has not helped

Reviews.Title: “Modigliani is not just a good painter!”
Reviews.Author: Tiem
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel at splendid location in the centre of Rome. Very quiet during the night and almost everything is just a walk away. Clean room, not big but sufficient for two. Very friendly and helpfull personnel. Mathijs & Marjolein (Netherlands)

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but buyers beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: jen20005
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful visit to Italy with only one really unfortunate event. We stayed at the Hotel Modigliani for 3 nights and had a very nice quad room in one of their garden apartments. The hotel was in a great location and quickly became one of our favorite hotels during our visit. That is until the last morning.... The hotel arranged a shuttle service to the airport for an early flight. Our group packed all of our belongings and had a few minutes until our shuttle was to arrive so we went to the dining room for a quick coffee and to see if our shuttle had arrived. Unfortunately we left our carry on luggage in our room unattended. After 10 minutes we returned to our room and found a man who was dressed in the hotel uniform coming out of our locked room. We thought he was there to tell us the car had arrived, but he quickly walked away. Once in the shuttle on the way to the airport, we noticed all of our wallets had been emptied. We specifically took out money for the shuttle the night before and we all clearly remembered packing it with our documentation the morning before our flight. We emailed the hotel to make them aware of the situation in hopes that others would not fall victim to theft and maybe an apology. We did get an apology that basically said they didn't believe us and that we brought it on ourselves. Here is a quote to enjoy: "But the guest has always reason, at the end, the proverb tells. We reply: the guest could be reason." We were all shocked to be insulted after being robbed. Think twice before staying here or keep your belongings on you at all times - otherwise you are asking to have something stolen.

Reviews.Title: “excellent all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgegal67
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 nights at the hotel. There were 5 of us (girls).The hotel is in an excellent location and we could walk to everything we wanted to see.There seems to be 4 rooms on each floor. My friend and I had asked for a quiet room and we were rewarded with a room at the back overlooking the courtyard. Our friends had rooms at the front and they heard alot of outside noise. The walls are thin and this can be a problem. On the Sunday morning after a late night, we were woken with the maid next door at 8am cleaning a room. But the staff are very good and are always smiling. The breakfast was a bit basic and after 4 mornings we were glad to see the end of it. But other than those few things we cant fault it. We had a lovely double shower and plenty of handtowels and a bath towel each. The recommendations for the restaurants proved honest and well worth a visit.I would definately use this hotel again.P.S We did take a travel kettle as they had no tea faclilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Hotel Modigliani!”
Reviews.Author: PeteyTravels
Reviews.Content: What a gem! This perfectly located boutique hotel fulfilled all of our expectations after reading the rave reviews on Tripadvisor (which is how we selected it). The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. The location couldn't be better - walking distance to practically everything, and public transport just around the corner. Yes the hotel is a little noisy (earplugs can solve this issue) and the bathroom was a little tight but we felt welcome and "at home" and it was a wonderful place to take an afternoon siesta when we returned from our daily trips around the city. We had a very nice room on the fifth floor with a balcony which overlooked the city and the garden below. I highly recommend this hotel - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “What A Gem”
Reviews.Author: mcavinpac
Reviews.Content: Superb boutique hotel with an excellent location, tucked away in a little alley off the Pizza Barberini and close to the Spanish Steps. We were able to walk to all of the sites from the Modigliani. The staff is wonderful - helpful, knowledgeable and charming. It was my husband's 60th birthday and his daughter called from the States and asked if something special could be done for her dad. When we arrived back from sightseeing there was a beautiful plate of cookies from a local bakery and shortly a bottle of prosecco was delivered. The restaurant suggestions were perfect. Never a bad meal. We were on the top floor in a beautiful room with a queen bed, two sofas and a darling balcony overlooking the courtyard. We fell in love with Rome and the Hotel Modigliani and plan to visit again next year. I will insist that my friends stay at the Modiglian when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: tri914
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Modigliani was very quaint in a nice little side street that was very close to alot of the attractions we wanted to see. The hotel staff was great. They helped book our bus tour and our taxis. They also provided a wonderful restaurant for us to eat - Girarrrosto Fiorentino. I highly recommend it. The food and staff were beyond anything I have experienced in Italy. The rooms are about on par with size in Europe. We had two twin beds which were a bit smaller than a U.S. twin bed. But the rooms were clean and we weren't there much so it didn't matter. Overall we enjoyed it. I would recommend it to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FyvieScotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just lovely. My husband and one of our children stayed for 2 nights in a triple rm. The room and en suite where very clean. The staff where really helpful and friendly - booking restaurants etc. The hotel is only a few minutes from the Spanish Steps so it's very central. We have been to Rome a few times and love the City - now we have found this 'gem' of a hotel we can't wait to take the whole family back.

Reviews.Title: “Modigliani Hotel”
Reviews.Author: debManchester
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked this hotel for a 2 night stay after reading all the excellent reviews on Tripadvisors. It is indeed a lovely, clean & extremely friendly hotel, with a personal touch.The staff on the reception desk were very polite, interested & helpful. The waiter/waitress were efficient although not overly friendly. Breakfast was adequate, the coffee, made to order,wonderful. Now to the down side! I think we were unlucky with the room we were given, room 101, it was right next to the wooden staircase so the noise in the morning was horrendous. The room was on the small side with a tiny shower cubicle, it was overlooking the garden which is pretty. Rome is wonderful, the Vatican museum & St Peters a must. Would we stay here again? Yes definitely, providing we weren't in room 101!!

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: Edna27
Reviews.Content: Found this little gem on the internet and after reading various reviews, including those on tripadvisor, decided to book a room for our first visit to Rome. Don't let the picture of the street the hotel is located in put you off. - the hotel is a gem - my wife regards it as the best hotel we have stayed in during our 'budget' trips abroad (and we have found many pleasant ones). From the moment we arrived on the doorstep my wife was impressed. The warmth of the foyer, the welcoming staff and the allocated bedroom quickly confirmed this. Our double room was very clean, fairly spacious and overlooked the quiet courtyard. The en-suite bathroom was also very clean and the shower cubicle quite large (perhaps this room was an exception given some of the other reviews). As we were only staying for 5 days (3 full days) I purchased a 16 Euro weekly transport ticket (from the tobacconist in the square)which meant free entry to the metro and, trams and buses (including the metro link to the airport). This is a must as it meant we were able to visit all the major sites quickly. The Barberini metro is at the bottom of the street (3 minutes walk from the hotel). The Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain are also within 10 minutes walk of the hotel. As with all holidays, the hotel makes or breaks it. and I an honestly say that we had a superb short break and would not consider staying anywhere else when we return to Rome. We visited two of the restaurants recommended in the hotel literature and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Little pearl”
Reviews.Author: Skiman
Reviews.Content: Well, sometimes, too many positive reviews seem "too good to be true".. but fortunately our friend Tripadvisor is a good place, where you can surf into all the reviews and feel if the reservation you are going to do will be done in the right place.. So, after looking for a nice place to stay in Rome, without spending a monthly salary, we decided to book a double room at Modigliani. As usual, my plus and minus (and some so-so). Please, note that sometimes I'm forced to find some "minus", especially when I enjoyed my stay (like in this occasion). PLUS 1) Location - Placed in a small street near Tritone Square (Via Veneto bottom), is located in a safe area just 300 m from the nearest Subway station (leading to S.Peter in 5 stops) and 5 minutes walking from Piazza di Spagna and Trinita' dei Monti. 2) Atmosphere - Friendly, family atmosphere, helpfully with suggestions and helps (maps, reservations, etc) 3) Suggestions themselves - we are Italian.. we were looking for a typical Roman restaurant, not a tourist-trap-fake-trattoria.. the simple, genuine restaurant we have been sent shows how serious they are (ask for Sora L.) 4) Room - clean, warm (maybe too much!!), good bed, good quality bath free items.. so-so bathroom (small shower, I agree). 5) Peaceful place, you don't even think to be in Rome during the night: you can keep the windows opened, without being disturbed by noises. SO-SO 1) Breakfast - probably it is perfect for Italian.. but foreign people maybe would prefer more "salt" items (just some cheese, ham and salami - no eggs, bacon, etc)... but.. ok, you are in Italy, you are expected to eat and drink like an Italian.. so, cornetti (brioches) with chocolate, marmalade, cream; espresso, cappuccino (made by a barman, not an automatic machine), cakes.. if this is ok for you, this is your perfect breakfast.. 2) Light in the room had very low power.. to have a good light we had to keep all 3 bulbs switched on at the same time (who cares?) MINUS 1) Thin walls - the TV in the nearest room when switched on is like in your room.. but you cannot change the program!! Acoustic insulation is not working very well.. 2) Temperature - well, this is not really a minus.. we have been give a 5th floor room. When entered, we found about 25 C (too much for us).. we had to keep the heater off for all the three days for having about 21 C in our room. But, I repeat, this is not an objective minus (just subjective).. 3) TV!! Wow.. I did not ever think that an old 15'' cathode ray tube TV can be still present in an Italian 3 stars Hotel.. Bad video quality, remote control not working from distance.. If they will change them with some LCD (maybe fixing the LCD on the wall), the result will be fantastic... Ok, now, the final question: would I suggest this hotel to my best friend? Definitely YES! I loved the stay, for a reasonable price, in a good location, a clean and friendly hotel. Probably one of the best quality/price hotel you can find near Via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Pearl.”
Reviews.Author: Carnil
Reviews.Content: In february me and my wife visited Rome for the first time. We choosed Modigliani for its central location and for the reviews we read about it on this side. We where not disappointed. - Visiting Rome means a lot of walking to get to all the "must see places". And after "a hard days walk", you feel that you have to get off the crowded streets for a while.- Take a time-out. And what you need then is a siesta in a peaceful place with a comfortable bed just to rest your weary legs. Modigliani got what you are looking for. A nice clean room, friendly staff, and I must not forget to say the breakfast is good too. It`s a quiet place in a quiet street. Even though the walls beetween the rooms could have been thicker. Quiet, exept for the hairdryer which sound like a Stuka comming down on your head. But if you are not a dive- bomber, you don`t have to use this machine all the time. Our stay in Rome was an unforgettable pleasant experience, and Modigliani was a part of it.- This hotel is a Pearl. Kurt. Larvik. Norway.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's in Rome”
Reviews.Author: L0u1
Reviews.Content: The owners and staff at this charming family run hotel made the experience truly memorable. The location of the hotel made access to all of Rome easy. All in all our stay at the Hotel Modigiliani was wonderful! The Rader Family, Stuart, Florida

Reviews.Title: “The staff make it”
Reviews.Author: MrsPJT
Reviews.Content: We spent an idyllic weekend at this hotel which is centrally placed, reasonably priced and really made by the staff, who are extremely helpful, very friendly and speak excellent English - who knew a hotel like this existed in Rome? The rooms aren't that big but are clean, quiet and have everything you need. I hope I'll go again - and I'll certainly ask for one of the rooms with a balcony over the courtyard. This was my fifth trip to Rome and by far the best hotel I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice hotel that deserves its good rating”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMaggie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in a number of luxury or near luxury hotels in Italy and elsewhere, but due to the euro/dollar exchange rate now, I just couldn't bring myself to book an expensive hotel this time. So we chose Hotel Modigliani for its more reasonable cost. We were delighted with our stay! Our room was small but comfortable. The bathroom was perfectly adequate, and I loved having the little balcony off the room. This hotel is spotlessly clean in a quiet, yet very central location. The breakfast was very good, and the cappuchino was the best I had in Rome! The young people who take care of the reception desk are unfailingly polite, friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel. I should add that if you are a light sleeper, you may want to bring some earplugs as the walls are a little thin. We weren't bothered by it because the guests around us were quiet. The restaurant La Scala that was recommended by the owners was wonderful, as was Girarrosto Fiorentino, also recommended. I can't say the same for Il Giardino di Albino though! Did not enjoy my meal there at all.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: Bonzotti
Reviews.Content: My second time at Modigliani hotel because somehow I remembered it as a charming place. And now I got this confirmed! It's probably the best hotel I've stayed in, and that's been a lot. I definitely have never slept so good in a hotel: quiet and neat room, possibility to turn down the heating and open the window, nice bed, new and clean bathroom... The hotel does not show off with luxury or gadgets but has a human warmth and charm that is irresistible, not least because of the very friendly and truely interested staff. On top of that breakfast is very good and the breakfast room is intimate. Unfortunately the weather didn't allow checking out the garden terrace. Ideal hotel also for romantic weekends, although I was here for business. When going to Rome again, this is my place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and charming”
Reviews.Author: zephyrsong
Reviews.Content: Modigliani is a lovely place. We liked everything about it: its position, tastefully decorated and immaculately clean rooms with beautiful photographs on the walls and bright bathrooms, very friendly staff, a cozy breakfast room. The hotel is located just a few steps from Piazza Barberini (hence close to the subway station) and very close to Piazza di Spagna, Corso, Via Veneto, Palazzo Barberini, etc. Although it is in the heart of Rome, it is very quiet and peaceful, so nothing disturbed our sleep after a good day of sightseeing (even though our window faced the street).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: JaneGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel, right in the middle of Rome, 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. Good rates per night for being so central. Our room (if a little on the small side) had a nice balcony with a couple of chairs and a lovely view over the rooftops to the Palatine Hill and Victor Emanuelle. The staff couldn't do enough for us and were very informative about places to eat in the area. I mentioned it was my birthday and the owners left a bottle of bubbly in the room with a nicely written card. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly”
Reviews.Author: sidsel_b
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in this little hotel, and loved every minute of it! It is situated in the middle of Rome and within walking distance of most important sights, as well as close to Metro and frequent buses. The staff is very personal, helpful and friendly, and we very much enjopyed our quiet room overlooking the back garden with birds and flowers. The aitconditioning worked well (which is not ususal in hotels!) and the bathroom was very clean and warm. All in all, we would like to stay in this hotel many times, and warmly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: veneziaLasvegas_Nv
Reviews.Content: I try to consult Tripadvisor whenever I travel and so I checked the reviews of Hotel Modigliani before our first trip to Rome. It seemed it would be the ideal place for us--small, accommodating staff, reasonably priced, close to public transportation. So many people raved about the staff, but we found them to be slightly aloof and not able to answer our questions most of the time. We are in our 60's but in fairly good shape but the walk up the street after a day of sightseeing was sheer torture! I don't remember reading anything about the angle of that street in the reviews, but if you aren't in tip-top shape I'd suggest that you stay elsewhere. The first two nights we were there, we stayed in the apt. across the street, which was beautiful. However the bed was as hard as concrete. I kid you not. The next four nights we were in the main hotel in a room the size of a postage stamp. I caught a cold and was not feeling like dressing for breakfast and my husband wanted to get me something to eat from the buffet and was told he could not, but for 8 euros we could have room service. I feel this was rude since breakfast was included in the cost of the room already. I know I must sound like a crabby old lady, but I try to be flexible and we've been to Italy before so it's not like I didn't know what to expect. Since we've been back I've had time to think about the Rome experience and I'd go again in a minute only we'll be looking for an apartment next time--on a flat street!

Reviews.Title: “Modigliani in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: forloveofitaly
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay at Hotel Modigliani in a quiet street near the Spanish Steps in Rome. As in January 2007, we found this hotel convenient, well appointed, immaculately clean and staffed by very professional and friendly Italians, prepared to speak good english. Furthermore, the staff always try to be as helpful as possible, checking on opening times and bookings for Roman attractions and booking taxis, etc. The room was ideal for our three nights' stay with en-suite bathroom (shower, toilet, bidet, wash basin and fitted hairdrier). The room also had a small balcony overlooking the inner courtyard. The breakfast was good with a choice of toast, cereals, yogurt, fruit juices, cakes and fresh fruit. Fine Italian coffee, including their speciality cappuccino, is freely available as well as a range of teas. All in all, a fine hotel in a convenient and delightful part of the city and reasonably priced. My wife and I cannot wait to return! Patrick of London

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time at Hotel Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: cberli2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic weekend in Rome, and the Hotel Modigliani was a great place to stay. The best things about the hotel are it's central location near a metro station, pretty entrance and sitting area, quiet rooms and exceptionally pleasant and helpful staff. Everyone was extremely nice, and the hotel newsletter had some great recommendations of restaurants. We went to two of them and they were terrific. The bedrooms are fairly basic, but very clean, and as mentioned, nice and quiet. The breakfast was very good also. It's clear the owners and staff take pride in the hotel and rightly so! Would definitely stay at the Modigliani again and certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the Room”
Reviews.Author: happycaryn
Reviews.Content: The positves: Great staff Excellent location Delicious Breakfast The Negative: We stayed in the garden apartments. It was dark and sparse and the bathrooms were tiny. I imagine if we had stayed in the main building our experience would have been different. One day the cleaning lady did not clean the bathtub. Rigid check out time We were 25 ate for check out and were giventhe distinct impression that we needed to exit rapidly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: Taloura
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Modigliani. The reservation was made based on this site recommendation, and we absolutely enjoyed our stay! The hotel is very well kept, quite new and centrally located. Very close to metro station and in a walking distance to the major sights. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Hint: do not miss the book Walking Rome offered at the reception - it's written by the hotel owner! You can find very good recommendations to see the unique places in Rome! Can be recommended to anyone! We were really glad to find such a charming hotel in Rome:)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: CPOttawa
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this charming, well-kept hotel. It is small and centrally located (though uphill). We found the staff to be very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: mgbrook
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Modigliani. My stay was short but sweet. My last night was there New Year's Eve and a nice bottle of prosecco was in my room with a charming hand written note from the owners. The location of this hotel is perfect - it is within walking distance of everything or, if you prefer, hop on the metro or one of the buses at the corner. Noise between rooms is a bit of a problem, but nothing intolerable. Bring along a pair of foam earplugs and any problem will be solved. The front desk arranged for a car for my return to the airport and it was well worth the money. The driver was on time, drove sensibly and helped with the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: El_Huevo
Reviews.Content: Located close to many sites and in a fairly quiet street, the outside noise was not a problem. We could hear anything above muffled conversation from the next room and there were noises coming from other rooms you just don't want to hear. The staff were ok but we didn't get any warm, fuzzy feeling that they were really interested in us having a good time while in Rome. Two of the four restaurants selected by the hotel were good; the other two were the standard types of places that tourists end up in. The shower was cramped and I'm skinny and under six feet tall. The review on tripadviser left us feeling we were picking the best of a not-so-great bunch - having stayed here, I would probably first look for something else next time, but would choose this for proximity if I couldn't find anything else that took my fancy. If it was in Germany, I would rate this hotel a 2 or 3, however relative to other Italian hotels it's above average, despite the noise. At least you won't get bored listening to what else is happening in the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: irishfamilyIreland
Reviews.Content: Location is everything in Rome and in the Hotel Modigliani you not only had Location but a small friendly, Quiet and clean hotel. It really is only minutes from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish steps. You want to do some shopping in Rome? this is the Location, all the designer wear you wish for. . We will stay here again. The Lambe family Ireland Dec 07

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: JAJDallas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending the Christmas holidays with our 3 daughters and son-in-laws in Rome. This is the 2nd time we stayed at Hotel Modigliani and we highly recommend this hotel to everyone. The hotel location is perfect - walking distance to all Roman sites, the room accommodations are clean and breakfast is adequate to start the day. We had the larger room with a fantastic view of St. Peter's and a place for all 8 of us to relax at night. Travel to and from the airport was arranged by the staff at Hotel Modigliani, as well as day trips and restaurant reservations. The hospitality that everyone showed us was excellent. The staff quickly became a part of our family, knowing all 8 of us. We didn't need to give them room numbers, as they knew who was staying in which room!!! Arlene & John J.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, charming staff, right price!”
Reviews.Author: p.zindler
Reviews.Content: Positioned between the Borghese Museum and the Palazzo Barberini, Hotel Modigliani was located perfectly for our Rome visit and a "Winter Special" was being offered at a rate that couldn't be refused. Upon arrival we were greeted by the hotel's friendly owners, Marco and Giulia at the front desk. Check in was quick and efficient with welcoming converstion and we were given a gift of Marco's own humorous guide book. Elevator to our room worked well, room is fine, clean, pretty fabric designs on bed and draperies, not lux. Bathroom is spotless, soap smells nice, flowery. Breakfast served 'til 10:30. Many choices, all well displayed, in a lovely breakfast room. Meats and cheeses covered for freshness, warmer for pastries, fresh whole fruits, yoghurts, breads, cereals. Best cappuccino I had in the 3 cities visited on this trip! I have 2 complaints with this hotel - the noise in the mornings and the mattress/pillows. The elevator chimes upon arrival on each floor and all the room doors open onto the elevator vestibule. No hallways. There is no way to close the room doors quietly. They must be pulled forcefully to close and engage the lock. Any conversation by others in the vestibule will be heard as well as the necessary morning cleaning sounds. Our mattress was depressed on one side and therefore slanted and the pillows are extremely flat and stiff. These discomforts, added to the morning noise made for too few hours of sound sleep. I liked the staff very much. They were extremely helpful in guiding us to a simple local restaurant, La Scala, on our first night and in sending us to a great travel agent, Sunderland, for the easiest train ticket purchases i've ever made in Italy. Conversations with the desk staff while waiting for taxis was always light hearted yet educated. Thank you, Hotel Modigliani, for a lovely stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: David_AT
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani is excellent location in walking distance to many attraction of the city and to many restaurants. The staff was helpful and friendly any time we asked something. Unfortunately we stayed only 1 night due to a flight the follow day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rupbert
Reviews.Content: So glad we chose this hotel - could not find a fault - the location was excellent - rooms very clean, comfortable with powerful shower -breakfast buffet good selection, food very nice - staff extremely helpful and friendly. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: R0bbie_S
Reviews.Content: Re-iterate the excellent location of this hotel. Stayed in the apartment which is across the narrow road from the hotel entrance (no traffic to speak of). This was excellent for the 3 of us with a sofa bed in the lounge for our daughter. The lounge also contained a small table and chairs. There was a small kitchenette with fridge, good sized bathroom with shower, WC, bidet and wash basin (no bath). The TV was in the bedroom (CNN and BBC World only English speaking channels). The room was well cleaned everyday so we have absolutely no problems in that area. Breakfast was good and the staff were friendly and helpful. I thought the hotel was not cheap but where in Rome is? I'd have no problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Tigger00
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful gem in the heart of Rome, next to many 5 star hotels on Via Veneto, the property is located in a quiet side street for half the price. It is close to the Villa Borghese, a 5 minute walk to both Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The closest metro station Baberini is a mere three minute walk. The staff is helpful and speaks fluent English. The room is plainly decorated, yet very clean and cozy. Breakfast is included and the dining room gives it a homey feel. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. If I ever go back to Rome, I know where I will be staying at!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Modigli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent an autumn break in Rome and stayed at the 'Modigli' on the recommendation of our daughter, who spent part of her honeymoon there. What a great little hotel it is! Tucked up a quiet little road just off the Piazza Barberini, it is ideally situated to walk to most of the attractions and there are some great restaurants nearby. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and the premises are very well presented. The inclusive breakfast is excellent, catering for most tastes, and self-serve. We would not hesitate to return and recommend the hotel to our friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant weekend”
Reviews.Author: SJWilson
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for my perfect Rome hotel for about 12 years now and still haven't found it, but the Modigliani was a nice enough place to stay for two nights. If you'te going to stay longer, than I suggest you specify one of the larger rooms - if we'd had a lot of luggage, it would have been a tricky business putting everything away, and we'd probably have wearied quickly of the tiny shower as well - you have to get the knack of shampooing with your elbows tucked into your sides! But the room had a nice wee balcony overlooking the typical Rome higgledypiggle of courtyards, terraces and gardens and it was quiet too, fine for a cold beer before hitting the sack. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and immensely patient with a series of tedious questions from a rather boring guest. So, not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: telarika
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 hotels in Rome and this one was disappointing compared to the other even though the price was the same. The hotel's location is very good. It is located in an alley up a pretty steep hill, which is not ideal especially with bags, but is around the corner from the subway and is within walking distance to most sights. The hotel itself is just OK. The room and shower were quite small and we could hear our neighbor snoring through the walls. Also, the service was all but non-existent and there was no internet access whatsoever. I would recommend the Relais Fontana di Trevi instead of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a nice enough stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: mandys97
Reviews.Content: Small but nice rooms... ours had a balcony overlooking the garden area which was very nice and gave us the opportunity to watch the sun set over the nearby church spire. If you're an American, you likely have never been in a shower as small as this one but at least the bathrooms were clean, as were the rooms. Outdoor area was nice. The staff was helpful and courteous, but not overly so as some as the reviews on this website seem to allude to. The hotel is located in a convenient location with nearby good restaurants and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: RivermanCambridge
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel ideally located for seeing the sites of Rome. Our room was modest in size but comfortable, with a good shower. It overlooked the small terrace "garden". Breakfast was good, with a reasonable choice of foods. Staff were very polite and helpful. Altogether a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience - Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: lwjava
Reviews.Content: I was initially worried about the noise and size of the room after reading the reviews, so I called the hotel to voice my concerns—not only did they exceed all expectations with a great sized room, but the Hotel Modigliani staff provided me with one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Their breakfast is delicious, service—gracious, and most perfect location in Rome (a short walking distance to everything, including tour buses down the street). Best of all, when inside the Hotel, not one voice or car can be heard from the outside street. Compared to other hotels we stayed at during our Italy trip, this one was unbeatable. It was my first time in Rome and after walking past a few hotels and talking to other tourists, I realized our hotel was perfect and far beyond any expensive big hotel chain in terms of service and room quality. I’d book Hotel Modigliani in a heartbeat for my next Rome trip.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Winel0vers
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed four days in Rome in April this year and also enjoyed our stay at Modigliani. As we arrived late the first night, we had the hotel arrange a car for us. A comfortable 45 minute trip later, we arrived at the hotel to a warm welcome. Our friends, who had checked in earlier were also impressed with the hotel. The hotel's recommendation of Il Giardini di Albini for dinner was a good one. After a great night's sleep in the comfortable room, we enjoyed a fantastic breakfast - huge choice of pastries and great cappuccino from Ronald. It was then an easy walk to the many attractions we visited while in Rome. This formed the pattern of our 4 night stay at Modigliani - good advice from friendly staff who couldn't do enough to help us, great breakfast every day, comfortable room although not huge, good sized ensuite. The location turrned out to be very convenient. We found a number of good restaurants and shops nearby. The staff made the stay very pleasant - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Charming friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: friendlytraveller440
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani in Rome was one of the nicest and friendliest hotels I have stayed in. The rooms were lovely and clean and the staff very helpful and friendly. On arrival you receive a newsletter that introduces you to the hotel, it's owners, staff and the local area. It was very helpful and welcoming. I loved staying in this hotel as it was reasonably priced and in a great location. Piazza Barbarini was at the end of the street and the Spanish Steps and The Trevi Fountain a five minute walk. The breakfast room is delightful and with only 23 rooms you could get to know the other guests easily. It also had a nice courtyard at the back for you to sit and have a drink or breakfast in the mornings. I thoroughly recommend this hotel as a warm and welcoming place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: K_J_Nottm
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading reviews on this site - lived up to all expectations. Staff very friendly & helpful, room great and even had a small balcony. Despite the hotel being very central, the peace & quiet sitting on the balcony late at night was unexpected. Good central location within walking distance of all the major attractions - we didn't use public transport once! Would definitely stay here next time we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hosts”
Reviews.Author: milesjve
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Modigliani for three nights in Sep '07 and were treated like royalty. The owners and staff are true professionals at the hotel game and we felt very much at home here. Although our room was not enormous nor grand, the facilities at the hotel such as the huge communal lounge and garden, far eclipsed any shortcomings. John, Vicki and Emily, (Victoria, Australia)

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Raine75
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The Hotel Modigliani is situated up a side street just off a busy square with banks,bars and shops.It's a peaceful haven from the hubub of Rome as excellent double glazing and the quiet street mean restful silence when you return to your room after a hard day of sightseeing. The reception and breakfast room staff were very attentive,friendly and helpful (especially Giuseppe). Restaurant recommendations were all great especially Ciampini at the top of the Spanish steps. We had a superior room on the sixth floor which was spacious with a queen size bed,sofa and 2 armchairs and in addition a small balcony terrace.There wasn't a great view but it was useful to step out from the airconditioned room and judge the temperature of the day or soak up the late afternoon sun. The air conditioning was totally controllable by the guest and in early September we needed it for the first three nights as it was still quite warm. We loved this hotel and will go back when we next travel to Rome Lorraine and David Fitches

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: DaniK123
Reviews.Content: Me and my Mum stayed here for 6 nights at the end of August. We were upgraded to the appartment across the street, and were so happy we stayed here. The apartment was lovely, only bad point being that it was a little noisy- although set off the main road, it was in a residential block and neighbours noise seemed to be amplified by all the marble, and we were right next to the big and heavy front door, which seemed to see comings and goings at all hours. Although we were in the apartment and had our own kitchen area, we were still entitled to the hotel breakfast. The hotel was in a great spot in the city- right in the centre - max 10min walk to the Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain. Breakfast was nice and all staff friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Calm, charm and location”
Reviews.Author: Nige and Jane
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here in transition to Marche, and chose it because of its good location for the station and central sights, and also because of good reviews we had seen. We were not disappointed. It has a warm, friendly and helpful ambience and the staff there give the clear impression that they enjoy being there. It is easy to access by Metro from Termini station, and is within easy walking distance of most of the central area. Rome is not a quiet city, but the Modigliani is in a sidestreet that is unusually free of noise. The room we had was comfortable and smart, not huge but small city centre hotels with charm rarely are. We strongly recommend the Modigliani for its calm, charm and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great small Hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: dptg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Modigliani for 3 days in August. We were upgraded to a superior room on the top floor of this small hotel and has a great view of the Rome rooftops from our balcony including St Peters. The room was extremely spacious and very comfortable. The staf were fantastic. They had masses of good advice and we ate in two of the excellent restuarants they recommended. The hotel is just off the Plaza Barberini and so very central and we found we could walk practically everywhere, but when our feet gave up the metro was just at the end of the street. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: joepyeweed
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay in Roma. Off of Piazza Barbarini. Down a narrow ally/street, it feels hidden from the hecticness of the city. Our room have a small balcony overlooking an inner courtyard. The rooms were small and simple, but clean and comfortable. (Watch out for the slippery bathtubs!) Breakfast was served every morning with amazingly strong (but delicious) cappaccinos. As an alternative to the bigger breakfast, there is a cute bakery across the street. The hotel was very convenient to the Spanish Steps, banking, shops, subway, and other sites. Try to avoid the more expensive restaurants along Via Veneto where the food is okay and the prices outrageous. The only problem we had was trying to check in after arriving on an early morning flight, but I think that's a universal issue for people arriving from the US.

Reviews.Title: “Affortable, great location and serene!!!”
Reviews.Author: myu7
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed there for 3 days from Aug 6-9, 2007. We have a garden appartment for 3 people. We paid 170 euro. It is quite reasonable for what we have and the time of the year. The beautiful garden is right outside our door. The room is spacious and teh in-room faciliites are convenient. There are many things to see within walking distance from the hotel. The frontdesk staff are friendly, but sometimes seem a bit 'stiff'. We left some food in the fridge and we were told that we cannot eat in the room. Overall, it is a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: compucombo
Reviews.Content: This place was right in the heart of where you want to be. Close to all in Rome. Better that that was the staff at this place who made my vacation a great one. The front desk could not do enough for you and never asked for anything in return. My wife and my five children loved this place. thanks from new york we will see you again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: TX4Traveling
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel conveniently located to the metro. Our triple was small but attractive and clean with nice linens and bath. The personnel were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Gem in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: acannada
Reviews.Content: The Modigliani is a great little hotel. The rooms and bathrooms are small, but very clean, nice and comfortable. The staff is top notch! The breakfast is very good. The hotel is close to the Spanish Steps and the via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeSurrey
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed for four nights and had a wonderful time in Rome. The hotel was in a brilliant location very accessible to all the sights. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel was bright and cool, the rooms and bathrooms were very fresh, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good and the courtyard garden a lovely place to eat it or have an early evening drink before dining out. We ate in one of the restaurants recommended by the staff, the Ciampini just above the Spanish Steps, it was superb. Would return to the hotel again and wouldn't hesitate in recommending to others. The Dix family Surrey

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Sandgolds
Reviews.Content: Our (family of 4 - 2 parents, 18 yr old, 15 yr old) stay in this very small hotel was wonderful, from the extremely clean rooms (and bathrooms) to the wonderfully helpful and accommodating front desk staff (several of them). The continental breakfast is very nice, including capuccini to order. Beds were very comfortable. Location is 1-1/2 blocks from Piazza Barberini, which is a nice area, just off Via Veneto and not far from Spanish Steps. Actual street is tiny, but that meant no noisy traffic. We had requested a room for 4 (they have 1 available), but it wasn't available so they put us into 2 rooms, 2 doors apart on the same floor (thoughtful). Don't stay here if you require American-size hotel rooms, fitness facilities, pool. But if you're looking for a very well-run hotel where you can enjoy your night's stays, especially at a moderate price, this could be the place. They even provide recommendations for restaurants (we tried 3 -- 2 were excellent, the 3rd good). We'd be thrilled to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Hotel Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: selSt_Petersburg_FL
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on their website - what a pleasant surprise. We stayed 4 nights. Hotel staff was wonderful - friendly, courteous and owners very pleasant. European breakfast indoors or outdoor courtyard. Close walking distance to many sites, we felt very safe walking and hotel staff was accomodating with directions. Would stay again - and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “What A Find”
Reviews.Author: Jipli
Reviews.Content: Amazing place to stay in Rome. The accomodations were excellent. We stayed 4 nights with 3 in an apartment across the alleyway and 1 in the top floor triple room. The apartment allows for the illusion of living in Rome. What fun that was! The triple room (602) was fantastic. What a view with a balcony to observe it from. The staff were charming, helpful and quite friendly. Location was perfect for us. Within 15 minutes or less walking your at Trevi, Spanish Steps, Via Veneto, Villa Borghese and its a pleasant walk. The Metro is quite close, so any other locations( usually within two stops) are easily accessible(safe also). There is also a stop nearby for Tour Buses(Barbarini Square). We highly recommend this hotel to only our best friends(dont want to spoil a secret) and plan to stay here everytime we come back to Roma

Reviews.Title: “A Covenient and Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tefari
Reviews.Content: On our way back to the States from visiting Africa, my sons and I recently stayed at Hotel Modigliani while visiting Rome. The room was relatively small but otherwise I have no complaints. The hotel was clean, quiet, relaxing, safe, and near a subway stop and many of the major tourist attractions. The staff went beyond the call of duty to make our visit a pleasant one. What impressed me most is that we never felt that the staff was attempting to gouge us in a city where everything is overpriced. We felt that we was staying in a friend's guest quarters. Lastly, Hotel Modigliani could not acomodate us on our last day in Rome. Hotel Modigliana arranged alternative accomodations for us and we reluctantly moved to a neighboring hotel which was an entirely diferent experience. Despite the move, the classy Modigliani staff arranged our transport to the airport in a Mercedes van at a price which was 1/3 less the price quoted by the other greedy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quiet, good location”
Reviews.Author: Trav_L_Moore
Reviews.Content: Pluses: * Very helpful English speaking staff. * Cute newsletter with recommendations of several excellent restaurants within walking distance. * Quiet street but easy walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Metro line. * Clean rooms, good water pressure in shower (no bath). * Breakfast included breads, cheeses, ham, yogurt, fresh fruit, and cereals. All types of coffee drinks included (e.g., American, espresso, cappuccino). It worked great for us. Minuses: * No internet (internet cafe is a short walk away) * We had a "regular double" which was small (but probably average for a boutique hotel in a big city). Larger rooms are available if you have the Euros. * Apparently rooms with a view are available but ours only had a view of the courtyard below. * Neighborhood is not terribly exciting. Last time we stayed near the Pantheon and Piazza Navona which we liked better. But it's easy enough to get around, and a quiet neighborhood can be nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Vatican Delight”
Reviews.Author: kingarthur75
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights, and walked all over the old city of Rome. The hotel was just perfect for location and the staff was extreme helpful with recomendations. Breakfast excellent. We will stay there on our next trip to Rome. CIAO.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: winnipegMbMarg
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff - most spoke English, others happily tried to - extremely helpful staff - clean rooms - lovely peacefull patio deck. Centrally located.....we couldn't have been happier there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get a room here”
Reviews.Author: Buzzpack
Reviews.Content: WE were very disappointed in this hotel, rooms on the lower floors facing the street which we had were noisy and dark. We had one on the 2nd floor and found it to be sparsely furnished, our luggage had to be put on the floor and we had to get on our hands and knees to access our clothing from them. Tried for an upgrade (told them we would pay extra) but they wouldn't hear of it. It was our anniversary trip to Rome and this hotel was a real "downer". Jim Packard

Reviews.Title: “what a great location!”
Reviews.Author: RockyMontana
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by friends. We were very happy with the location (near Spanish Steps, shopping, Trevi Fountain) and walked everywhere (except to the Vatican). The staff were very helpful - arranged a hotel driver to take me to the airport at 3:30am - I was traveling alone at that point and very grateful for a safe ride to the airport (not cheap, but worth it). The standard rooms are quite small but clean, bathrooms were modern and clean - and although the hotel is in the middle of Rome, it was a quiet retreat at the end of each exciting day! Apparently the view from the large 6th floor room is awesome if you're willing to spend the money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience at the Hotel Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: thecoaling
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani, Rome, Italy. We gave it an above average to excellent rating for several reasons. We arrived from the airport a little after 10:00 a.m., and were immediately checked into our rooms. This was quite good as it allowed us to nap after the all night flight from the States. The hotel staff is very accomodating to client needs; the hotel is clean and neat and well appointed. Breakfast was very good with a variety of foods and drinks. Its location close to the Piazza Barbarini allows for a comfortable walk to many attractions, or a taxi ride at a reasonable cost throughout the city and to the Vatican. We would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Modigliani again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Gem”
Reviews.Author: yorkshiretraveller59
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani - Rome April 2007 We have just returned from a wonderful break in Rome. The hotel's location was very good, near to the very expensive hotels on the Via Veneto, the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain on a very quiet back street. The hotel was sparklingly clean, and the staff were helpful, informative and polite. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: yalding
Reviews.Content: The Modigliani is in a good location, minutes from the central sights, particularly The Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Villa Bourgese. Also on bus routes when needed. The (standard)room was big enough with good storage space and separate bathroom (bath and shower); large lounge to relax; breakfast excellent and staff extremely helpful. All facilities are modern but with old-fashioned service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quality service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NipperNipper
Reviews.Content: We booked the independent apartment at this hotel as all the main rooms were full and we were looking to book for three people. This apartment is literally over the narrow street from the hotel. We were very pleased with the two rooms making up the apartment ( one with a double bed and one with a sofa bed) and the stylish bathroom with shower, There was a ( tiny) kitchen area with sink, fridge and two cooker rings ( though who needs to cook with so many splendid restaurants around?). The apartment was very quiet, it has no view onto the city but is well appointed, particularly by the standards of a capital city. The location is ideal for all major sites, ( it is very close to the Spanish Steps) the staff very helpful, will reply rapidly to any email enquiries you have and provide a friendly service. Oh and the breakfasts area great too. A very strong recommendation from us - we would certainly go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: cliffhangerkaz
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room in this hotel for three nights over Easter and found it to be excellent and very reasonably priced. The staff were extremely helpful and very attentive. The room had quite a large bathroom with a powerful shower. The beds were comfortable and the room was nicely furnished with interesting artwork on the walls. Everything was very clean. On Easter Monday they left us each an Easter cake on our pillows which was a nice touch. The Continental Buffet Style Breakfast was excellent and was served until 10.30. The reception area and lounge are very pleasant and there is a lovely garden terrace to relax in. The hotel is located on a side street away from the main road which was very pleasant. The metro is only a few minutes walk from the hotel and the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps are close by. The hotel is in a great location as most of Rome's attractions are within walking distance of the hotel and the Vatican is only a few metro stops away. Would definately stay again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking Rome”
Reviews.Author: mineolakid
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast, clean rooms (small, but we expected this in Rome) and clean bathrooms (even good shower pressure!) Stayed on the street side, 5th floor; no noise to speak of. We were able to walk almost everywhere from this location; 5 mins to Spanish Steps, 10 mins to Trevi Fountain. The only negative: beds a little on the soft side. For the $$, we would certainly stay at HM again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: LeedsEddie
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel within walking distance of the major sights of Rome. Very clean although rooms are smallish, but we expected this to be the case in the centre of Rome. As a family we took two rooms; one facing the front (via della Purificazione) and one the rear courtyard. You may find that the noise of the Romans going about their business early in the morning wakes you up if your room faces the front - so if you're sensitive to noise ask for a rear room. We can recommend taking tea in the shady garden! Receptionists very helpful and spoke good English. We would love to return to Rome and would chose Modigliani again.

Reviews.Title: “a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: kathleen53
Reviews.Content: we have just returned to ireland from rome having stayed all too breifly at the modigliani hotel for one night. we were in other nearby accomodation for 3 nights and had the good fortune to be able to book into this lovely hotel for an all too short stay to finish our break in rome. i would highly recommend it to anyone planning a break in rome, its central to everywhere spotlessly clean, pleasant courteus staff the whole place is clinically clean but very relaxed and comfortable. the balconies are lovely and quaint and every whim is catered for. you would be reluctant to go out and about to sightsee you would just want to retreat into this lovely oasis in the centre of the city. breakfast is a lovely experience everything laid out in pristine condition sorry we were responsible for burning the toast! and our every request was met with understanding and good humour. i brought home a quantity of business cards to pass onto anyone who is planning to travel to rome. dont hesitate book this hotel now for your next trip to rome five star service for 3 star prices!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: English woman in Aix en Provence
Reviews.Title: “Clean and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LaLoubiere
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani is a small hotel in an ideal location, within walking distance of most 'big' sights, paricularly the Spanish Steps, where there are a good selection of restaurants and shops close by. The staff were very welcoming and friendly, and keen to help. The rooms were comfortable and clean, although one of our bathrooms was very compact, which, had you been on the large size, might have proved difficult. We booked online and the rates were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Litetraveller
