Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel in a great location not far from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The staff are very welcoming, helpful and able to recommend some very good restaurants. Thank you Francesco on the reception. The rooms are very small but well equipped with a TV and mini bar although the showers are a challenge for those above average height . Our room 502, had a wonderful little balcony overlooking the roof tops and terraces of neighbouring properties. Perfect for a pre dinner Prosecco. With so much to do and see in this wonderful city the room size was not a problem for us. The breakfast buffet was good and plentiful with enough choice to set you up for a days sightseeing. Thank you Modigliani ,if we ever return to Rome we will certainly look you up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view from the terrace of room 602”
Reviews.Author: Pamela24
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in this perfectly placed hotel. Stayed in room 602 on the top floor which has a terrace with table and chairs, where you can sit and drink wine as the sun goes down over the humped and dome skyline of Rome and St Peter's lights up. Very comfortable room with a double bed, two sofas, fridge, tv, etc, and some colourful modern paintings on the wall. Not quite Modiglianis but cheerful. The staff were a joy and made our first visit to Rome (even more) memorable. Go! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: TerryAbby
Reviews.Content: A short break away from the kids, the hotel is in a great location to explore Rome, and is good value. From Ciampino, get the bus to Anagnina and the metro to the Trevi stop and the hotel is a 2 minute walk away. Trevi Fountain and (top of) Spanish Steps are both a five minute walk, but the metro and bus service are literally at the end of the hotel's street to access all other sites. 11 Euro 3-day travel card is great value (about the only thing that is cheap in Rome!). Hotel rooms adequately sized (tight fit bed and shower for anyone over 6 foot and/or 16 stone), but clean. Grey paint slightly depressing. Breakfast is fine / fresh and cappacino goes down well. Only regret is that we didn't ask for enough advice from the reception - they have plenty of advice to share if you ask! Avoid the Trevi Restaurant also. Horrific meal and mysteriously lost my wife's bag and contents.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & convenient.”
Reviews.Author: DATP
Reviews.Content: We had a half-term break with another family and wanted somewhere inRome, not too expensive, quiet, clean, comfortable and welcoming. Impossible? no, we found it all in the Hotel Modigliani. We found the hotel in Alastair Sawday's Special Places to Stay - a worthy guide. The rooms were on the small side and quite sparsely furnished but clean and the bed was comfortable! The twin room on the back on the 5th floor had the best rooftop view - and the children had that one! The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. Great cappuchino in the morning and a good breakfast buffet. We liked the newsletter which gave recommendations for eating out in the evening and all were good. Try La Scala Restaurant, we returned there twice as the food and service was excellent. The hotel is well placed for walking around this most "walkable" of cities but is also convenient for the metro and buses. All the staff speak good English - which puts us to shame. The hotel sells a reasonable Prosecco which they serve,if you want, in the lounge area - a pleasant aperitif before venturing out to dine! Obviously run by a family that cares about their guests. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty little hotel with sweet people”
Reviews.Author: WeeKee
Reviews.Content: The people here are absolutely sweet. The front desk of the small 3* hotel makes an effort to know the guests in its 24 rooms, and there are nice, personal touches that make guests feel welcomed. In the stylish and bright lobby lies newspapers and travel books for sharing between travellers, as well as a personal note by the owners to its guests. There is a spacious indoor sitting area for guests to chat or read and a pretty garden at the back of the building. The room is bright and cheery with a tv and fridge. The bathroom is very new and clean, and well equipped with a comfortable bed. The heater is always turned on during winter that kept us very warm. The room services also left us each with a piece of chocolate on our pillows every day, which brings on smiles every day when we return after our sightseeing. The breakfast buffet was included and generous, with different cuts of hams, many types of breads and croissants, cereals, fruits, premium Italian coffees, teas and yogurts. We got a good room rate per night as it was the low tourist winter season. The hotel is located near to the Barberini station and makes it easy to get to places of interest. Our only complaint of the otherwise wonderful hotel is the thin door of the rooms. There are only 4 rooms each level with a small lift lobby. When a family moved into 2 rooms on our level, we can clearly hear people shuffling between rooms, arguments in the lift lobby and doors slamming over several days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: CJefferson
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to the U.K after spending 4 days in Rome. What a wonderful city, something to see around every corner and so many wonderful meals in restaurants recommended by the hotel staff. The hotel was in a great location within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, shops and restaurants, immaculately clean, with plenty of choice for breakfast . All the staff were helpful and friendly and this really made the holiday for us, nothing was too much trouble. We are looking forward to returning soon. Camilla and Andrew Jefferson, Bristol. U.K

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Derfel1
Reviews.Content: A lovely place - wonderful location, with access to everything, and professional, yet friendly staff, and great value for money. Excellent cappucinno, and they even surprised me with a bottle of champagne on my birthday! True, our room was small, and simple, but very adequate and clean, and best of all, had French doors opening onto a lovely interior courtyard. I understand upper rooms have balconies with views - if that is your preference, ask! We didn't specify, but our first floor room with a view of the courtyard was perfect for us. We didn't want to leave, and are already making plans to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keilyme
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a great find. Within a 5 minute walk of the Spanish Steps, even closer to Via Veneto and the Metro Stop at Piazza Barberini. Our room was small and the bathroom extremely tiny, but everything was clean and adequate. The balcony off the room was a nice feature which we were able to use even in December. There is a lovely little courtyard where breakfast is served in nice weather. Staff is friendly and helpful. We stayed in Room 402. Room 602 has a better view, so I would request that room if the rate is similar. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: erikapAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Right above the Spanish Steps for under $300 euros a night was a pretty good deal. We found it difficult to find with the map we printed from the website, but that was really our fault for not requesting more specific directions. The room was on the top floor with a balcony that overlooked some rooftops which was quaint. The room was right next to the elevator, which was noisy when awake but did not disturb us once asleep (if you're a light sleeper, be warned, however). Just a few blocks from great shopping, the Spanish Steps and the Spagna train station. Just a few blocks more to the Trevi Fountain. The room was a little sparse and the bed spread scared me to death. The bathroom was small and it was tough not to touch body parts to the walls of the extremely tiny shower (yick!). The room was very large and slept additional people so for a family, this could be a very good value. The breakfast was nice. Overall, I would rate this above average given the location.

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: twosheds
Reviews.Content: myself,my husband and two of our friends stayed here at the end of november,based on reviews i had read on trip advisor and it was a great choice. the rooms were super clean and modern,yes they are a little small but it was no problem. The restaurants recommended by the hotel were first class,and the location of the hotel could not be better. all in all a great place to stay when in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingASAP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The location is ideal and easy walking to all the local sites. The Metro is on the corner and you can be anywhere in Rome in minutes. Stefano at the front desk arranged for a private tour with an English-speaking guide of the Vatican for our group of 6 people. We bypassed the thousands waiting in line. The breakfast room is charming with muffins, yogurt, fruit, pastries, good coffee, cereal, meats and cheeses. Best to get a room away from the street, although the windows are very soundproof. We found the rooms and the hotel to be very clean and well cared for. The hotel has a small patio in the rear that is great for relaxing away from the noise of Rome. We were with a group of 8 so it came in handy as a "happy hour" gathering spot. Right down the street is a small liquor store that carries great wine and some beers. Would definately return to this wonderful hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “nice option in Rome”
Reviews.Author: theroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Modigliani for 3 nights starting on November 5, 2006. The Hotel is very, very, very clean. The room is very tiny, but ours had a very nice and surprisingly big balcony facing a pretty courtyard which made the room fill much bigger. It was also very quiet , because it was not on the street side and we slept with our windows open. The staff is very helpful and attentive and the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, lovely city”
Reviews.Author: Mackywag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at end of October, arrived at 12 noon expecting to leave luggage until check in time & were pleased to find that our rooms were already available for us. Room 504 spotless & plenty big enough for 2. Lovely powerful, hot shower, tasty breakfast. Would recommend buying a bottle of Chianti from Reception & sitting in the quiet lounge or court yard, enjoying a nice glass of red for a peaceful end to a busy day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Eccentric Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GASGODDESS
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this charming hotel.It was very clean and in a quiet but centrally placed street in Rome.The staff were delightful and we would heartily recommend the place.It was off-beat in the best way!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: B_Steve
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Modigliani is small and intimate, and it is clean and charming, too. The staff are extremely polite, friendly, and helpful, especially Veronica and Francesco, who went out of their way to help us find our way about Italy. The breakfast was good--except perhaps for the Cafe Americano! :) Everything else was very agreeable. We never heard a sound at night, and we were in a busy Roman neighborhood. I would recommend this hotel to any American traveller who wants good accomodations at a reasonable price and wants a real taste of Italy! We loved our stay at Modigliani!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Modigliani lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Cabbage5
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and we only had 1 day/night to enjoy the city. The Hotel Modigliani was perfectly located in an area where we could walk to the many sights near the Spanish Steps. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room, although tiny was spotless and quiet. We chose to enjoy our morning breakfast in the courtyard. The entire experience was fantastic. Our only wish is that we could have stayed longer. We will be returning to Rome and will most certainly stay at this terrific hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: WestLondonTraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from spending 3 days at the Hotel Modigliani and were very impressed.The hotel is very well situated and in(for Rome!)a reasonably quiet side street but the double glazing is very effective and the room was a decent size although the bathroom was small.The breakfast was good-make sure you drink the fresh coffee though(which is offered automatically)and not the so-called American coffee in the urn! The hotel itself is immaculate but I agree with some of the previous reviewers in that it is the staff at the Modigliani which make it special -they are all extremely pleasant and very helpful. We used a couple of their restaurant recommendations and one,the Ciampini,was very good-we went twice and found it excellent- good food and wine and not expensive. One small criticism of the Modigliani-the rooms are not that well insulated.Apart from the usual early morning departure noises which you always get in hotels, we could also hear the snoring of the inhabitant of the next room!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: pear3150
Reviews.Content: My sons and I were very pleased with both the hospitality and the accommodations at the Modigliani. We had a room with three beds and while they were narrow they were more than adequate. The location is excellent...just a short walk from Barbarini Square where transportation can be secured but you can really walk to anywhere you wish from this location. The Spanish Steps are very close as is the Trevi Fountain but we also walked to the Pantheon and the Colosseum and the Vatican (a long walk but doable). If you love to walk - Rome is the place for it. Around every corner is a "wow, look at that!" - wonderful sights you would miss if you were not on foot. The neighborhood offers shops, interesting restaurants and is very charming. The hotel itself is located on a narrow uphill street. The front desk personnel were a great resource in getting us hooked up with day excursions to Pompey, Sorrento, Naples etc. They arranged transport from and to the airport for us as well. Pickup at the airport didn't go well as our driver never showed up (we later learned he had a small car accident on his way to get us....no surprise there, as we were later to find when we took a wild ride in a cab). There is a train to Rome from the airport, it is easy, inexpensive and I will use it next time instead of getting a driver. The hotel offers an included breakfast. Fruit, cappuccino, rolls, cereals and pastry were provided...more than adequate to get you started in the morning. The only downside was that the rooms are not soundproofed in any way and we could hear anything said by the occupants on the other side of our wall. We were so tired that we would fall asleep despite the noise but those who are light sleepers may wish to take that into consideration. I would stay here again because of the excellent location, good value and helpful personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: cjohnsonla
Reviews.Content: the hotel is perfectly situated - 7 min walk from Spanish Steps and 10-15 min walk to the Trevi Fountain...My 70 year-old mom did these walks...so these are easy ones : ). the walk from the Spanish Steps at night and the hotel's locations itself is on a narrow side street that may feel sketchy on the walk home - but it's really okay. accomodations were good. my only "complaint" was that on 2 different nights I tried to shower very late i.e. midnight and there was no hot water more lukewarm...it got warmer over time but not hot like in the daytime. i didn't make a complaint as it was late and wasn't worth the effort - but if this will break your trip then beware. even with this quirk i'd stay their again for the good value in price, although i may check the price against hotel hassler and the intercontinental hotel - which were right on the spanish steps....somehow i'm thinking modigliani is cheaper : ). stayed in room 504 per the recommendation - it met expectation. didn't do breakfast. my mom did and thought the food didn't look as fresh as the food in our florence hotel. the garden seating area is cute. the staff was quite helpful although they receptionist told us the car service to the airpt. would be 55EUROS and it ended up being 65 - thank God we had the extra EUROS on us. still i'd give them a favorable rating. as a word of warning the hotel doesn't look "pretty" from the outside as the street is older and resembles an alley way BUT the hotel is nice inside AND the street is safe and clean. when i first saw the hotel i was a little concerned, but don't be. it really is fine. for the value and location, i'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and great hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Greg's_mom
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Modigiliani in Karen Brown's book. It was every-thing we needed, ie: great location, comfortable surroundings, and a great breakfast. The capucino was super. Also, the staff was very accomodating. Bob and Sanchia Mazza

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: chalka
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Modigliani and cannot recommend it enough. The hotel itself is simple yet elegant, small yet perfectly formed. However, what really made our stay special was the staff. They were all wonderful and so helpful with whatever we asked of them - restaurant recommendations and reservations, directions, advice. Also, the location is really ideal - literally 2 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps, 5 minutes from the Trevi Fountain. If you are looking for a decent base at a good price but want to feel well looked after then use this hotel and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dee70471
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in this hotel. Our family had an apartment consisting of 2 connecting rooms with its own porch. The location was most convenient to the Spanish Steps. The room was clean if a bit sparse and the bathroom modern. Breakfast was good. The staff was helpful with questions and information. The A/C worked well which was important in July.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful haven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: denmuir
Reviews.Content: In the heat of a roman august the hotel Modigliani provided an oasis of peace and quiet. This was complemented by exceedingly helpful reception staff, a good breakfast and a very reasonable summer discounted room rate. The location just adjacent to the via Veneto , was convenient for the subway and major attractions such as the Spanish steps. The hotel had nearby restaurant rcommendations on its information sheet. We sampled two of them and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ewc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani is a wonderful hotel. Staff very helpful and pleasant. The room on the sixth floor with the balcony was outstanding - panoramic view of Rome with St. Peters in the background. Delicious breakfast included. I would definitely stay there again when I return to Rome. Pam & Buddy, Memphis, TN

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kikilim
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Modigliani at the beginning of August for 4 nights. I stayed in a double room on the fifth floor, my friend had a room opposite, also in a double room. We both used the rooms as singles. We can't speak highly enough of our stay there - the staff (especially Stefano) was really helpful and friendly and relaxed, the rooms were nice and perfectly clean - mine was quiet even though facing the street , my friend had a georgous view from her tiny balcony over the rooftops of Rome! The breakfast had everything that we wished for - both fresh pastries and breads,cereals and plenty of coffee, juice, joghurt, well the lot really for a continental breakfast. It was a personal ambience, with family photos on the walls, but still managed to be stylish at the same time. The location was absolutly perfect, not three minutes away from the spanish steps, and close to many other attractions - we really did do a lot by foot. As first timers to Rome a thoroughly enjoyable experience, one we won't hesitate to recommend to you all!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greencountry
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were clean and comfortable, just adequate in size. We needed to book earlier to get the larger top floor rooms. Apparently we had quiet neighbors all around as we did not hear any other guests such as other reviewers have complained about. Our rooms overlooked the small quiet street and the street noise was not a bother. The lady practicing the violin in a building across the way was actually a nice touch! The hotel is in a good location. It is close to Metro at Piazza Barberini, and a hop-on hop-off bus stop is just one block over on via Veneto. It is an easy walk to many historic sites as well. If you tire of all the magnificent sights, try something different at Capuchin Cemetery at Chiesa Santa Maria, on via Veneto. Macabre and unique decor from the bones of departed monks... Restaurants abound, and the ones recommended by the hotel were very good. The hotel is uphill from Barberini, but most of Rome is built in hills. One of our traveling companions struggled a bit because she was recovering from recent surgery. It was not a problem for the rest of us. We did not have much interaction with the staff, but they were pleasant. The only real need we had were for two taxis on Friday morning to get to the train station - and a wildcat strike had shut down about half of the cabs. The front desk made constant calls for 1/2 hour until the cabs were secured. His efforts were greatly appreciated! From all the warnings, we expected to be harassed by pickpockets or gypsies. In our 3 day stay in Rome, we never had an unpleasant encounter. Just stay alert and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hope06
Reviews.Content: My parents who are in their late 60's stayed in this hotel in May. They felt that the hotel lived up to all expectations of which they had many having read the reviews on this website. They found all staff to be helpful and courteous at all times and their room was very comfortable. They would return to the hotel and already have recommended it to many people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome, Loved Hotel Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Master_Canada
Reviews.Content: Hi: Sorry about the delay but we spent a week at the Hotel Modigliani last month and it & Rome were both amazing. This was our first trip to Rome and in researching hotels we came across the Hotel Modigliani and from the Trip Advisor reviews we decided it was where we wanted to stay. The hotel was nicely located in a quiet residential area but still close to restaurants, metro and was walking distance to everything - Spanish Steps - 2 min, Trevi Fountain - 5 min, Galleria Borghese - 15 min, Coliseum - 30 min (metro was onstrike that day), Vatican - 45 min (day after we arrived from Canada, so walked back to stretch our legs). The service was amazing and the out door breakfast courtyard made for a great start to the morning. The only problem we had with the service was - they were to arrange for a car to pick us up at the airport but due to a taxi strike the car couldn't make it but the front desk provided us all of the instructions we needed to get there via train/metro. We had room 603, so top floor with a little rooftop balcony that faced east, so after a full day of walking around Rome it was a nice place to sit & relax with a glass of wine and talk about the day-plans for dinner-plan for tomorrow. The room was a good size for the 3 of us (good double bed & our daughter had the 'sofa/day bed'). And while some people have commented on the size of the showers, I'm well over 200lbs and had no problems - in fact after a day walking around Rome it was nicer to be able to lean against the wall while showering. WHEN we go back to Rome we will definitely be staying at the Hotel Modigliani. Thanks, Lee PS - I'm glad someone posted a picture of the interior of room 603, as of the 700+ pictures we took we neglected to get one

Reviews.Title: “A Very Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: GringainPanama
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor for the Hotel Modigliani, I was expecting a decent hotel (nothing fancy) with great service. However, our experience at the hotel was extremely disappointing, since the service was sub-par. Upon arrival, the front desk staff could best be described as indifferent and cold. The only positive was that they gave us a newsletter which offered some valuable recommendations for stores and restaurants in Rome. The nadir of the visit came at 4:00am, when we all woke up drenched in sweat due to the faulty air conditioning system. I went to speak to the front desk about it, and was assured that it was working properly, and that if it wasn't, it was because I was moron and couldn't figure out how to work the thermostat. (which was not the case!) The front desk clerk claimed that they didn't lower the A/C at night, however, he did flip some switch behind the counter and our room eventually cooled down again. At this point, the Modigliani was the fourth hotel we stayed in during our visit to Italy, and it was by far the worst experience. In particular, the A/C incident - although a hot room was annoying, our annoyance could have been assuaged by some deft customer service, like an apology, which was never forthcoming. For me, this is the prime test of customer service - how a business handles things when things go awry and a customer isn't satisfied. Not only were we unsatisfied, but I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone......the hotel only pays lip service to customer service and fails its guests when they need them most.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Affair”
Reviews.Author: Persephone20
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for an Autumn mid term break with our two teenage children and loved the hotel and its location. Our luggage was mislaid at the airport but the hotel staff were very helpful and deliverd it to our rooms immediately it arrived - very late - from the airport. Reception staff were extremely helpful. Our room was on the top floor with a delightful little balcony which we used all the time - worth paying the extra for this. The children were on the third floor - their room was a little drab. Breakfast was excellent - especially the pastries. The location was ideal - very close to the Via Veneto - great for a bottle of Prosecco at one of the cafes - and the Spanish Steps. The hotel recommends some good restaurants but some a little over priced we thought. Would definitely stay here again when in Rome if we could book a top floor room.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the Modigliani on Trip Advisor and we are so thankful that we trusted the great reviews that we read. Even though we often stay in luxury hotels in the States, we tend to go with less expensive, boutique hotels in Europe. I mean, after all, don't you really spend most of your time playing tourist instead of camped out in a hotel? Well, this one you could camp out in if you really wanted. It is delightful and so is the staff at the front desk. We had a beautiful room, the staff was extremely helpful and the location, just off Piazza Barberini, can't be beat. The breakfast room is charming and efficient, with all you could want and killer cappuccini.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: carol-sc
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome and had no idea where to stay, how lucky were we to choose the Hotel Madigliani, it was just perfect, the rooms were lovely and clean, the breakfast room was fresh looking and airy, one morning we had breakfast in the garden area which is very pretty and peaceful. The hotel is well situated it is a 2 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and 10 minutes to the Trevi Fountain. Rome is just stunning, with fountains around every corner, and so much to see, we took a tour bus around the city, but walking is the best way to see everything. We will definitely return to Rome and stay at the Hotel Madigliani.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: cindybelm
Reviews.Content: Worth the money. Rooms were small but clean. Breakfast was ok. Location good- not far from Spanish Steps. Would probably stay again for a night or two. Any longer than that and I'd feel too closed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hazzles78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Modigliani for 3 nights, we only wish we could have stayed longer! Rooms were not as small as we had feared having read previous reviews (although the showers were tiny!). Elegantly decorated throughout, airy, fresh and spotlessly clean. Great air con system. Breakfast (continental) was good - capuccinos were great. Lovely outside area for eating in, again spotlessly clean and well laid out. The indoor breakfast room was lovely; light airy, clean, white linen, flowers, great pictures on the wall. Perfect location (just 2 mins walk from Spanish Steps!) but quiet enough not to be disturbed during the night or early morning. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. We will definitely return to Hotel Modigliani on our next trip to Rome and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: SueP01
Reviews.Content: My prompt confirmation from The Modigliani contained the usual inclusions - room type, rate, conditions, but with the added promise of "our kindness" - I began to have a warm anticipation about my stay there. Their in-house welcome brochure introduces guests to their family and staff with personal anecdotes, and also offers a range of neaby restaurants and various items of interest. The hotel is located in a small quiet street (our front room posed no noise problems at all), a comfortable short walk to the Spanish Steps. Our twin room with small balcony was compact, clean and functional, with small wardrobe and bathroom with tiny shower. Breakfast could be taken outside in their garden courtyard (we also used this for pre-dinner drinks and a quiet reading area), or in their breakfast room, with crisp white linen tablecloths, continually topped up continental buffet, excellent espresso machine, and cute family photos giving it a cosy feel. Scrupulously clean throughout (possibly just repainted). We felt welcome and special at all times and I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Charmingly Quaint at the Hotel Modigliani, Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: Polomomma3
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6/12/06, After returning from a 12day Cruise of the Mediterranean Sea We only stayed one night at the Hotel Modigliani, but the Staff and accomodations where great! We were a party of 10 and required 4 rooms, the rooms were clean & cozy, not as small as I was to believe. Plenty of room to stay even longer. The Staff where very helpful in getting anything we asked for (ie Taxi, good restuarant recommendations, and beverage service). We arrived early before check-in, but they where able to store our luggage so we could go explore more of Rome. If I ever get to return to Rome I would definitely stay at the Hotel Modigliani! Linda, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kathyweston
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with great customer service. we had one of the better rooms in the hotel with a view looking out over Rome. The hotel is very well located for travelling round Rome and the restaurant that the hotel recommended to us was simply the best and within a five minute walk from the hotel. The breakfast is nothing special but it won't matter because you will feel valued as a guest. We fully intend on returning to this hotel next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Mad about the Modgliani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Italy and stayed 2 extra days in Rome at the Hotel Modgliani. It was so very special. Only 24 rooms, mine was twin share, not overly large but just beautiful. The room was spotlless, overlooking a central courtyard where we had brekkie. The staff were all young people whol spoke English very well and were very helpful. Hotel is owned by an artistic couple and they have given the place some lovely touches. It's located in Via della Purificatzione, a quiet little street, just aroung the corner from the Spanish Steps and very easy walking distance to many other attractions. The owners supply a wonderful little newsletter welcoming quests and recommend some local restaurants. We tried one of these just aroung the corner Le Tarpe Rupea, (or was it Rupea Tarpe?) in Via Veneto,it was just great and the young chaps working there were great fun, food was excellent and reasonably priced. A great experience. The hotel also had air conditioning that actually worked!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with superb service!”
Reviews.Author: shaulke
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel so special is the service. The staff has tons of useful recommendations about where to eat and what to see. Really make you feel welcome (unfortunately not that common in Italy hotels by the way). Our room was tidy and clean. The bathroom was OK, but the shower cabin was REALLY tiny. We were able to walk from the hotel to pretty much any major attraction in Rome. If you don’t feel like walking for more than 20min, the Barberini square with buses and metro is within 5min walk. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: Bluebird60
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from three nights at the Hotel Modigliani in Rome, with my husband and children aged 12 and 14. We spent two nights in a quad room, which had a rooftop balcony and view over the city and plenty of room for the four of us, followed by one night in two rooms - one double one twin, with a balcony off the double room. The location was great, up a narrow road off the Piazza Barberini, not far from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The hotel was small (23 rooms), provided continental breakfast which could be as filling a you like, a small courtyard garden and lounge area; the hotel was spotlessly clean and the marble floors keep it cool. Helpful staff were at hand 24 hours a day. Restaurants were close at hand, as was shopping. We didn't want to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, but........”
Reviews.Author: Sabre4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Hotel Modigliani. Very clean and spotless! Hotel staff is SUPERB - they couldn't have been more helpful, attentive, and accomodating. Breakfast was adequate and good - Rachaele was working the breakfast room, and she was efficient, pleasant, made great caffe latte's, and always had a smile! Quiet street away from the noise from people and traffic. Location was great - Spanish Steps a 3-minute walk away, great restaurants all around. At the end of the street, which is Piazza Barberini, there is Tobacco Shop to buy Metro tickets, Barberini Metro stop, Internet Cafe, Bancomat ATM, Movie Theatre, cafe's, shops, and more. However - The room was a bit cramped. Only place to sit down in the room was the bed - there wasn't even a chair in the room. Bed was soft and squishy and squeaky. One tiny 2-drawer dresser to put some clothes in, and a closet. Walls were thin - i listened to the guy in the next room snore all night long. Shower was probably 2 feet x 2 feet - so if you get claustrophobic - this is not for you. Hotel is situated on a quiet street, but what they don't tell you is that the street is all up hill - almost 2 blocks - so everytime you come back to the hotel - you're going on a hike! This was our 3rd trip to Rome, and despite the SUPERB staff, we probably would not stay here again - based upon the cramped room, and the up-hill climb to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 18April2005
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4-day trip to Rome, our first, and it was the most amazing experience. We were delighted with Hotel Modigliani - it is such a perfect location. Close to a Metro stop (a great way to get around), and within walking distance of so many of the sights of Rome - 10 mins to the Trevi fountain, 5 mins to the Spanish steps, no more than half an hour to the Vatican. But at the same time, on a very quiet little side street, so it was peaceful at night. The staff were so helpful, and we found the hotel newsletter to be a great source of information, particularly for restaurants. We ate at three of the restaurants they suggested and had wonderful meals, not expensive, all within a few hundred yards of the hotel. The hotel breakfast was adequate, plenty to choose from. We usually ate early, but if we had been getting up later, we could have eaten in the lovely little internal courtyard - it was gorgeous. Our room was at the front of the hotel, a double on the fifth floor, plenty of room (we had thought from previous reviews that it might be tiny, but not at all) with an excellent bathroom, all spotless and in cool calm colours, much appreciated after the heat and the hustle and bustle of the streets of Rome. The marble floor in particular was heavenly on bare feet after a day of sight-seeing. We will never forget our trip, and if we come back to Rome, we will book into the Hotel Modigliani again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pemberton2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani is a great little hotel. Situated up the top of a small street off the Barberini Square, it's an oasis of calm and relaxation. The location is excellent too - and the green open top bus goes from two locations very close to the hotel. The service was excellent - there was a mixup with rooms which was noone's fault, just a language misunderstanding - and within 10 minutes they had changed the room. We had a room with a balcony, fairly high up on the 5th floor - it was lovely. The hotel and rooms were very clean and so well thought out. Yes, the rooms are small but that was okay. Expensive - but so is everything in Rome! Breakfast was good - again, in lovely surroundings and Vivaldi in the background. Best of all, the newsletter had recommendations for local eating - the first of these was very good value indeed (can't remember the name but you turn right out of the hotel, left at Barberini Square, left into Via Veneto and it's just on the right across the road, down some steps from a canopy - great food and friendly service). Hotel Modigliani - definitely recommended!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: El Puerto de Santa Maria, Spain
Reviews.Title: “Family friendly place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KlingerJJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Modigliani for 5 nights. Stayed in room 603 with my wife and 3 kids. The room was very clean and had AC. Though the room was small, we didn't spend much time there hanging around, just to sleep and eat a quick breakfast. My parents were in 502 and they had a nice view. The staff was absolutely wonderful - especially to my young children. The hotel is located just off Piazza Barberini and has easy access to the Metro, Taxis, and busses and the Spanish Steps are right up the street. We arranged for a van to pick us up at the airport and the driver who brought us back was terrific - i think Jimmy was his name? - anyway if we knew better we would have hired him for a tour and restaurant recommendations. Plenty to eat and drink within close walking distance, even the Hard Rock - though we didn't eat there. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Tours by Roberto (my daughter and son-in-law's company) booked me, my wife, sister and neice at this hotel. We liked the location (near the Spanish Steps and near a subway stop); the staff was most helpful. The owners publish a little newsletter with recommended local (walking distance) restaurants - the three we tried were excellent. Only downside - our room was on the street which was a bit noisy; my sister originally had the room but has alergies and couldn't stand the exhaust fumes when the window was open. Since it was cool and we're not into open windows, we swapped. Might be best to request a room off the street. Breakfest, by the way, was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani in Rome was the perfect hotel to stay in to see all of Rome's greatness. It is in a perfect location near the Spanish steps and in walking distance of two subway stations. It is surrounded by fine restraunts that suit couples to families. Fantastic shops surround the hotel also. The hotel itself has moderatley sized rooms that can comfortably fit two or three people. The staff were most helpful and would attend to your every need promptly. One of the best aspects if the hotel was the breakfast which was available every morning. It was delicious and there was always a staff member on hand to attend to you. All in all I definatly recconmend Hotel Modigliani to anyone who is traveling to Rome. I would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: gonkula95
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after a long flight from New Zealand. The day we arrived happened to be my wifes birthday, which we mentioned in passing to the hotel staff at reception upon arrival. After a small trip into Rome (just up the raod!) we returned to find a complimentary bottle of champagne and a lovely birthday card in our hotel room. I have stayed in many many hotels all over the world and NOTHING is better than this. My wife and I shall return many times again

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Modigliani. The staff was very helpful and nice to deal with. The room was very nice and clean. The showers were strong, but a large person might have a problem with their size. The bed was comforatable. It was close to everything. I would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but bad location”
Reviews.Author: lovesandy
Reviews.Content: We found the Modigliani to be a welcoming hotel although we had some problems with the location. We were happy with the following things: 1. kind and helpful staff 2. hands down best breakfast on our whole trip 3. close to a metro stop and thus made it easy for arrivals/departures 4. charming courtyard We were unhappy with the following things: 1. our room was grey(literally), tiny, and very sparse 2. the hotel did not have much charm 3. it was far away from the sights and required a 20 minute or so walk through heavy traffic on tiny sidewalks to get anywhere 4. no view from windows 5. felt it was too expensive for the atmosphere which is bare bones. 6. walls were thin and we could hear everything above, beside, and below us

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SSR-RI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March with my husband on our first trip to Rome. It was really something special and we would return to this hotel again and recommend it without hesitation. The staff was warm and helpful, we loved the room (our room in back had a balcony with a view we couldn't get enough of) the location near the Piazza Barberini, and the beautiful breakfast room. The entire hotel just had alot of style and warmth. The rooms are small, true, but we had much larger rooms in other hotels and somehow those places weren't nearly as memorable as Modigliani. We especially loved the newsletter the staff created and left in the rooms; we used all of the restaurant rcommendations and loved all of the choices.

Reviews.Title: “A great birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff were so friendly and helpful; the owners welcoming, and the pretty courtyard garden which we overlooked was very colourful. We even had blue skies and sunshine every day but we are not entirely sure that the Modigliani can take full responsibility for that! We shall recommend the hotel to our friends and hope to return one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Only Found this Hotel Okay but Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: cqt
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on two considerations: (1)we had 5 adults travelling so cost was a consideration and (2) reviews on this site. Overall, this hotel did not meet my expectations. But I cannot begrudge it the good value. Originally, I booked 1 double and 1 triple. A week before the trip, I noticed that they were running last minute specials so I called to get the new rates. They weren't able to give it to me; however, they did give me two rooms in lieu of 1 triple room for the same price. This was above and beyond what I expected so I was really looking forward to getting there. Two things happened which changed my overall view of this place. One is that the hotel is tiny - the rooms are pretty small as well. My room (201 - avoid all 01 rooms) was so small that I felt really claustrophobic in it. The bathroom was minute - there was a small shower that had doors that you pulled shut around you. The toilet is about less than 1.5 feet from the sink and 2 feet from the shower. I couldn't wait to get out of my room each time. The other thing is that the 2 days we were there, the receptionist was not very helpful. His name was Guiliano - avoid him at all costs. We asked him to order a taxi to make our Vatican tour. After 15 minutes, it hadn't arrived so we asked again. Turns out he hadn't ordered the taxi at all and couldn't find a taxi that was available - almost made us late. We ended up heading to the Piazza Barbarini to get our own taxi. Asking him anything felt like we were imposing on his time. Having said that, there were two redeeming qualities about this hotel. It was exceptionally clean - I would have been disgusted if the small space was not clean on top of things so luckily, it was very clean. The location is fairly convenient, near the Spanish Steps and Piazza Barbarini. The breakfast was a small spread but the cappacinos and cafe lattes were really good. Overall, I would not stay here again. I'll go back to the Intercontinental around the corner on Via Sistina - it's really more my style and although not posh, it was comfortable and roomier. I felt that we were slumming it at the Hotel Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great three nights here in Rome. Our room was at the rear of the hotel which was a real suntrap in March, and were able to sit outside in just T-shirts! The room was excellent, with every we needed, save for tea making facilities (how very enlish of me), and the hotel staff were efficient and friendly. The owners seem to have made a real effort, even putting together their own mini guide to the hotel and the city. The breakfast buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: NYCHotelManager
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Modigliani for a week at the beginning of March. Both of us work in the hotel industry in New York City so we notice things others may not and know what to look for where someone may cut corners. Well, we were impressed with this hotel. Beginning with the staff, all of whom went out of their way to be helpful and always greeted you with a smile. After just one day, they remembered us and always had our key ready and a kind word when we returned. The room (404) was spotless and not as small as other rooms we have had in Europe. Breakfast was plentiful and again, better than we have encountered in other hotels of the same size. The only issue preventing this from being 5 stars is that the walls are thin and you can hear your neighbors, everything from conversations to televisions. Its not overpowering but for a light sleeper like myself it was distracting. Overall, you could not find a nicer staff, well located hotel for the price in all of Rome. Definitely feel confident in choosing the Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “Arriverderci Roma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A hotel recommended by Alistair Sawday, we found it extremely clean and functional with an excellent central location in Rome. The staff were very helpful and courteous at all times and the hotel newsletter useful in helping us find good restaurants giving value for money. Our only disappointment was the small bedroom with only a shower (no bathroom) but on the whole the hotel was good value given the location. Many Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - top value, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: rachel612
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this very pleasant hotel on two separate occasions in January and February. The staff are very friendly, the rooms are comfortable and clean, and the location of the hotel is excellent. In between our stays at the Modigliani we stayed at another hotel for a conference (at Euro600/night!), and although the other hotel was pleasant and efficient and the rooms were larger we were very pleased to return to the atmosphere of the Modigliani and the friendliness of the staff there. Our first room was on the fifth floor, at the front of the hotel, overlooking the Via Della Purificazione, with a nice view of the neighbouring rooftops and apartments. On our second stay we were fortunate enough to have a room on the second floor, at the rear, with a lovely small balcony overlooking the courtyard. The hotel has a very pleasant breakfast room, and makes a fine cappucino first thing in the morning. :)

Reviews.Title: “An absolute Gem!”
Reviews.Author: monster_munch
Reviews.Content: What a find! Not only is this spotless hotel right in the heart of Rome, but you will not hear a peep! Everywhere else I have stayed in Rome is so noisy, but this hotel is up a tiny little side street, so all you can hear are the birds! The staff couldn't have been more helpful with anything you might need, their English is fantastic as well! The breakfast is great for Europe with croissants, bread, cheeses, cold meat, yoghurt, fruit and the best coffee in the world!! The location is wonderful, about 5 mins from the Spanish Steps and therefore 5 mins from the main sights. The Vatican is a long walk (about 45mins), but not uphill and a great way to see the city. this hotel is wonderful and I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value near the Spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Evans00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find in Rome. Having read reviews before travelling, our expectations were high. We were not disappointed. The staff were very friendly on arrival, and upgraded us to a room with a balcony and seating area. It was simply decorated, in calm tones. We were given a newsletter which contained biographies on all of the hotel staff and recommendations of good restaurants and amenities in the local area. The breakfast was simple and tasty. The hotel is within walking distance of most of the major sights, the nearest being the Spanish steps. We would recommend this hotel to any friends or family travelling to Rome. It makes a great retreat from the crowds, and is a great price for a city centre hotel. They even left chocolates on the pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani was a great find. The location was perfect. Close walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navornna, the Pathenon etc. The metro stop was even just at the corner. So after walking to the Vatican and around all day it was easy to jump on the metro and be right back at the hotel. The room was spotlessly clean. Everything sparkled. We had room 602 which was very large (for Rome). It had lovely views from the large balcony looking out over Rome. There were 2 large and stylish sofas, a larger TV and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was a good size but the shower was very small. We liked it so much we stayed 3 days at the start of the trip and for 2 days at the end of our trip through Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Gubbini
Reviews.Content: On our fifth trip to Rome we decided to stay near the Via Veneto (for a change) and chose the Hotel Modigliani for our 8 night stay. The hotel was very clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. We would stay here again. We had a "top floor" room (#603) that had a cute little balcony, large sitting area, nice-sized bathroom and a comfortable bed. Furnishings were simple and tasteful - not luxurious or grand, but still quite nice. The bathroom had a towel warmer (nice to have in February), large towels and your typical European wall-installed hair dryer (not too powerful but functional). The view from our room was mostly just rooftops but we didn't get any street noise. If you want a view it seemed to me that the other room on the sixth floor (when I glanced in as it was being cleaned) would be preferable. We had a little problem with "neighbor" noise but weren't sure if it was due to thin walls or just really noisy people. A friend of ours was on a lower floor and also had noisy neighbors. Breakfast was indoors in a cute little breakfast room when we were there although there is a little garden which is used in more temperate months. The breakfast spread was good but not great - yogurt, cold cereal, one type of cheese (good), two types of meat(so-so), some pastries (so-so), bread (good), fresh fruit (apples and oranges when we were there), juice and water. Whether the coffee was good seemed to depend on who had kitchen duty that morning. One of the young women did a great job making cappuccinos and lattes; the other didn't. There was also American coffee in a coffee urn, but it tasted like 'instant' to us. Location was very good - just off the Piazza Barberini up a slight hill on a side street. The entrance is very low-key - - you could easily walk by the hotel if you weren't looking for it. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many of the major sites (Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, Piazza Navonna, Pantheon, Villa Borghese, Palazzo Barberini). We also walked from the hotel to Trastevere, the Vatican, and the Colosseum. The location is also convenient to buses and the metro. The staff is helpful in recommending restaurants and mapping out bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable charming hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Italy on our honeymoon. We stayed in 7 different hotels in 7 cities. Hotel Modigliani is the only place that presented us with a bottle of champagne and a hand-written welcome message. We were sincerely touched by this warm gesture. First, we were happy that the location is very easy to access. A subway station is just a few steps away. When we got inside, we were impressed with the boutique hotel atmosphere and the very personalized services that the owners had well thought of. Ask for the hotel's free paper where you can find excellent recommendation on where to eat. Just trust them! The room, though tiny, was very clean and comfortable. The staff are all very helpful. Each of them has a very unique and lovely character. Even the trainee, who could not speak English fluently, did his best to assist us to book for the opera tickets. Thank you! We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: cheltonian1
Reviews.Content: As most people we were a little nervous about visiting a new city without understanding the best locations for hotels. We were bamboozled by the number of options available on the intermet, so we decided to go with trip adviser rating & cost. We were not dissapointed ! If like me road noise is an issue when trying to sleep, then this is the place for you Silence !! Positives: Brilliant staff Quiet Great location (you can actually walk from Termini on a nice day) Great location near everything ! we walked back from the Vatican taking in lunch on the way. Negatives (actually should read neutrals) Showers are small Breakfast can lack variety and needs more fruit Negatives (real bad points) None In conclusion a quiet bijoux hotel that offers great VFM, close to everything with staff that live customer service. Word to the wise on Rome: Take your best walking shoes, beware of pickpockets and then enjoy "la dolce Vita !!" We will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Rome was great”
Reviews.Author: Ali_garter
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a wonderful trip to Rome with my husband. We chose the Hotel Modigliani after reading other reviews posted on this web site. We were not disappointed at all in what we found. As it was our first trip to Rome we booked a car transfer from the airport through the hotel. Although this was a little expensive it was well worth the money to get met and dropped off right off at the hotel reception. I don’t think we would of found the hotel very easily on our own, as looking up the street it didn’t look like there was anything up there. Our room was very clean and comfortable if a little small, but we are led to believe that is standard for Italy. There was mini bar if you wanted to use it, which also housed a FREE safety deposit box. The staff were very helpful and polite, there was always someone at the reception ready to assist with anything that you needed. Breakfast was plentiful and a good choice of pastries yoghurts, cereals bread meat and cheeses and fruit, with fruit juice, coffee and tea. Make sure you take sturdy walking shoes as after 10 hours walking your feet will thank you.... or a 4 euro metro ticket will give you unlimited travel till midnight the same day.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: Viva_la_Spartans
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani was a very good hotel for a very affordable price. The rooms are small and plain, as is the norm for most hotels of this price in Europe. But more importantly, they are clean and equipped with all the basics you could need. As mentioned in other reviews, the walls are thin and hallway noise was somewhat annoying, but hardly bothersome enough to keep me awake. The hotel is located near the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, as well as the Metro, with access to the rest of Rome. After staying near the Vatican for the first leg of our stay, this was a good central location to see the east side of the city. The staff is professional, extremely helpful, and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “109 posters can't be wrong”
Reviews.Author: bradman
Reviews.Content: I checked this out on tripadvisor before booking their special winter deal. Is there another hotel on this sight with so many positive write ups? They are not wrong. This is a really good place to stay in terms of location and an excellent choice for value and quality. We were given the top room at the front of the hotel which has a small balcony and a great view across the rooftops to the Via Veneto. But it's even better if you get the top room at the back, which looks across the city to St. Peters etc. The rooms are a good size, the beds are excellent, everything is clean and well kept. Only slight quibble is that the bathroom (all of them?) only has a stand up shower and no bath. The breakfast buffet is simple but nicely set out with a good range of choices, and the breakfast room is a pleasant place to start the day. If you don't like the standard Americano coffee you can have cappucino or expresso at no extra charge, and there are plenty of different teas available. The best thing though is the personalised approach to everything, including the art on the walls and a nice little newsletter which you are given on arrival. This gives plenty of recommendations for local restaurants, unusual places to visit etc. and has pen portraits of all the staff - even down to the room cleaners. Nothing is too much trouble for the reception staff who all speak reasonable English. Go now while the special winter offer is still on and you won't regret it. Or even wait til the summer when it's more expensive and you still won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend break”
Reviews.Author: philiusfogg
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel on the basis of other comments on Trip Advisor - all of them indicated that this was a good choice - and we were not disappointed. We stayed here for the weekend - my wife's 40th birthday treat. We chose this hotel because we liked the idea of a small family run hotel rather than a large faceless chain and the owners actually tell you a little about themselves in their website. The location is very good near Barberini Metro and within easy reach of all the main sites. The street is quiet. The rooms are clean and simple with TV/ensuite/minibar. The breakfast room at lower ground is welcoming, with a good choice of food.All the staff we met were very helpful. I did read another comment that talked about noise from other rooms - there was occasionally a little when other guests return late at night, but nothing that would put us off from staying again. We will return! I understand that there is an apartment at the end of the garden terrace that can be rented if families want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on this website's reviews and as I was looking for a central but inexpensive hotel, I chose to stay at the Modigliani. We were offered a winter rate (105 euros per night) which made the cost quite a bargain. The reviews are quite accurate: The Modigliani resides in an out of the way street (keeping noise away) --about a half mile from the Spanish Steps. The room was quite large for the price. Both the room and bathroom were quite clean. The shower could have been a bit larger. Unfortunately, if your neighbor is noisy, you will hear every bit of their conversation -- as was in our case on the last night of our stay. Breakfast was simple but more than adequate. The staff were friendly but I wish they had been a bit more knowledgeable of Rome evening activities. Metro was quite convenient. Though the hotel does not offer internet access, there is an internet cafe nearby (5 Euros per hr). This is a small hotel you should give full consideration.

Reviews.Title: “The Modigliani is a delightful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a clean comfortable and quiet small three star hotel for a few days during our first trip to Rome. We liked the sound of the Modigliani from its own website and a few reviews. We were not disappointed. It was just perfect for us and we had a lovely time. It is owned by a delightful well educated couple who work there and who have obviously hand picked their staff for helpfulness. It is well situated in a small street in a safe area close to a selection of restaurants and very central,it was just perfect for our requirements. We would stay there again if we are ever back in Rome. A small bedroom could be a possible criticism also an entrance which is not very imposing on first arrival.

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What more can we say, the title speaks for itself. We and another couple stayed at this excellent hotel this past November. The staff was very helpful and more than willing to go the extra mile (recommentdations on: tours, taxis, entertainment, metro, etc.,) The breakfasts far exceeded our expectations. The cappuccino was out of this world! Our room faced the street with a lovely view. We had no problems with traffic noise due to the fact that the hotel is located on a quiet side street. Our room was large by European standards. The bed was very comfortable and the decorations made the room even more inviting. The bathroom was a nice size with a stand up shower. The room service was simply the best. After a long day's sightseeing it was nice to come back to a clean room with fresh sheets and chocolates on our pillows. If you are lucky enough to get a room with a balcony the garden view and the city skyline are breathtaking. The hotel is located in a central area within walking distance to a variety of attractions such as, shopping, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Fontana Di Trevi, etc., The Metro and bus stops are nearby off the Piazza Barberini which is down the block from the hotel. All and all the four of us agree that we would definitely recommend this small and charming hotel to all of our family and friends. We look forward to returning to Rome and once again staying with our friends at Hotel Modigliani. Robert and Mayra Fort Lauderdale, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We struggled with our choice of hotel in Rome and switched to the Modigliani at the last moment after a reading reviews on this site, so pleased we did. A lovely hotel close to the Spanish Steps, best continental breakfast in Europe. The rooms are large with basic furnishings, good bathroom & tiled floor. If you are looking for a fancy hotel dont stay here, if you are looking for a good clean room in a fantastic location stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Modigliani came recommended in Alastair Sawday's 'Special Places to Stay' which had served us well in Florence. We were not disappointed. We were looking for a well priced hotel in the ancient city that would be small, quiet and comfortable. Our room was simply furnished but clean and functional with a small balcony. It is in a great location - 3 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps. The staff are extremely friendly and professional and everyone made us feel very welcome. You could be mistaken for thinking you are the only guests they have to attend to.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a Delight”
Reviews.Author: judithlw
Reviews.Content: Although we've both travelled extensively internationally, my husband had never been to Rome, so for his birthday and to meet friends who were also celebrating their birthdays -- in January -- we took off for Rome. We found The Modigilani and were delighted upon arrival to discover that our room on the top floor had a balcony overlooking the rooftops and Via Veneto. At night we kept our "french" doors open and were never disturbed by traffic or neighborhood noise. One thing I love is the hotel's 24-hour reception. Someone is always there to welcome you or help you with taxis. The hotel is central to so many things from the Borgehese Gardens to the Spanish Steps, and good, moderately priced restaurants -- as well as the higher priced of everything! Our friends had booked into other hotels that we felt didn't hold a candle to ours, especially when it came to quiet nights, the residential neighborhood, convenient transportation and most of all the very personal care from the staff and the owners. Breakfast was a highlight, especially with individually prepared espresso drinks. We can't wait to return to The Modigliani and Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have spent 3 nights at hotels. Pros: 1) Very good location -we walked to all major attraction. The Hotel is located on a quiet street, 5 Min walk to the Spanish steps and 7 Min to Fonatana De Trevi. 2) Very pleasant staff. Helpful and worm. Good recommendations for dining 3)Very very clean. The hotel is 4-5 years old and it is always nice to have new bathroom... 4) View from our room: our side had nice view to the city. It was great to open the window in the middle of the city and having good air and some view. 5) Nice little garden- for warmer days 6) Dining room - for breakfast- small but pleasant. Cons: 1) Rooms very small. The decoration minimal- gave a little "cold" feeling 2) Thin walls - so if your floor is full- could get noisy 3) Breakfast was a little too basic. We have enjoyed it very much, but you have to know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, friendly Hotel Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: PeraEra
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Hotel Modigliani in Rome, and it lived up to our first impressions. Nothing is too much trouble for Giulia and Marco and their staff. They booked tours as well as restaurants for us, which were all top quality. Our rooms were comfortable and this time we were on the top (5th) floor with a view out across the city. Breakfast was eaten in their restaurant; surrounded by photographs of the owners' children - cereals, fresh juices and tempting Italian breads, cheese and meats. And delicious capuccini which wake you up gently! All this is great value for money and you don't need to take a taxi anywhere as everything is in walking distance - the Spanish Steps are five minutes away - and Piazza Barberini metro station is at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booking a last minute trip to Italy in November of 2005, we were pleased to find Hotel Modigliani. It is blocks from The Spanish Steps, and very reasonable in price (as compared to its neighboring hotels). The staff (including Paolo and Silvio)was accomodating and quite helpful. The Hotel is small, clean with a decent, included breakfast. It is also blocks from a train stop and down the street from a delighful bakery. Unfortunately, the walls are quite thin so sleeping was never easy for us during our four-night stay. With only four rooms on a floor it is near impossible to not hear the lift, and if your neighbors are loud, you are guaranteed to hear them as well. But for the off-season price and the very friendly staff, we were pleased to have stayed at Hotel Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HertsMums
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break to Rome and have had a wonderful time. We chose this hotel on previous reviews on Trip Adviser and were not disappointed. Our twin room was small but well furnished and impeccably clean! The owners and staff were extemeley friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a small unimposing via close to the elegant via veneto. Very close to Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain.....infact within walking distance of the Colliseum and St Peter's as long as you enjoy walking...and the walks are worth it as around every corner you discover a new sight, sound and delicious smell. Restaurants are many and whilst not recommended by the hotel we splashed out on a meal at Ciao Bella, a small terrace restaurant on Via Veneto....wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: StacyDeK
Reviews.Content: This unassuming hotel is in a quiet residential neighborhood, but within easy walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese, restaurants and Metro station. The extra splurge for a 6th-floor room with balcony and view was worth every penny. Staff was courteous and helpful; breakfast was basic but tasty. Despite being in the center of the city, we slept with the windows open and heard nothing but occasional church bells. What a great way to wake up! A wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: eye_banker
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor, and also did some other research (Karen Brown's book). The hotel's appearance is very deceptive, as you walk up the narrow road from Piazza Barberini. But once inside, the clean decor and the staff make the hotel a easy recommendation. We stayed for a total of 5 days and were given rooms 202 and 602 (***the best***). Rooms face towards the street, or a small courtyard with other houses/apt buildings, which must be typical of hotels in central Rome. The reception staff (particularly Stefano and Paulo) are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is hearty (especially for a Roman breakfast!) and is well served. They even kept our luggage for us as we hopped over to the Amalfi coast for a couple of days. We paid E185/night on average and were very happy. If you can get Room 602 - the views are excellent and the room is like a suite, with sofas and art. Both our rooms had juliette balconies overlooking the small courtyard - there was not much activity there, though it may get busy in summer. The hotel is steps away from the Piazza, and also the Barberini metro stop. We could easily walk to Piazza Spagna, Trevi fountain. If you are budget-minded, but want to stay inside central rome would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Modigliani is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: GailAltadena
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-week trip to Italy. Our last stop was Rome, where we stayed at the Hotel Modigliani for six nights. It is a lovely, small hotel, very conveniently located on a quiet street just up from the Piazza Barberini, and only a 5-minute walk to the top of the Spanish Steps. Even though the Metro stop is just a block and a half away at Piazza Barberini, from this location we walked everywhere -- the Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum, the Forum, the Pantheon, even the Vatican. Our small room was beautifully decorated, immaculate, and with a balcony that faced the inner courtyard of the hotel and looked out over the rooftops of Rome -- lovely. The buffet breakfast was very nice, and was served in a charming breakfast room off the main lobby. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful, particularly Francesco. We stayed in a number of 3- and 4-star hotels on this trip, and they varied widely, but we can say without question that the Hotel Modigliani was nicer than most. We would absolutely stay here again on our next trip to Rome, and are highly recommending this hotel to our friends. It's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable choice Modigliani Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Modigliani Hotel is small but very cozy and perfectly located hotel. It is located on one hand very downtown (approx. 500m from Spanish Stairs, and very close to the Barberini Square (Subway station) but on the other hand at the very quite street. From the hotel it is just walking distance to nearly all important places to be seen in Rome. The hotel is newly renovated and comfortable furnished. The bedrooms and bathrooms are spacey enough and fully air-conditioned. The strong side of this hotel is professional and dedicated stuff team that guests can relay on. They are eager to arrange for their guests (upon request) airport picking up, sight seeing, dinning and shopping. The price level is rather below comparable standards. Overall it is a very good choice and value one can get in Rome these days.

Reviews.Title: “Outdoor garden a real find in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great find!!! The location is perfect for Spanish Steps and many other sites. Staff was very friendly and helpful and recommended a wonderful restaurant that we also can't wait to visit again. We love the ambiance and charm oif Rome and this hotel just completed our experience. Loved the outdoor garden for breakfast and Chianti in the afternoon. Rooms small but clean and service was excellent. Definitely will stay here on our next trip (hopefully soon)

Reviews.Title: “Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well located 23 room hotel near the Trevi fountain/Spanish steps.Superb friendly staff,rooms very clean if a little 'cold' looking.Breakfast average.Worst feature - the below average sound insulation - especially avoid rooms immediatley adjacent to the lift shaft(one per floor) as the closing lift doors make a very loud resonance throughout the room whenever the lift is used.The hotel's restaurant recommendations in their helpful Rome guide were excellent.Overall - 7/10.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel when u measure price for what you get. Great location and friendly staff. I wish they would give you advice for less "touristy" places to eat. Also, bathroom is very small (specially the shower), so if you are a big frame person, it will for sure be uncomfortable to take a shower. Good hotel nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay for the second time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rather small hotel nearby Piazza Barberini in the ancient of Rome situated in a quite back street where you can hear no traffic at all. And what vi loved most of all: a lovely back garden where you can enjoy your breakfast and may be a drink later on when you come back from sigtsseing. The owners and their staff members do strong efforts to make their guests comfortable, the rooms are most satisfactory cleaned and the beds done every afternoon when you return for a quick relaxation before going out to dinner. We will indeed go back for a holyday next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very much enjoyed our stay at Hotel Modigliani!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and three other couples stayed at Hotel Modigliani in June and had a thoroughly enjoyable experience. The hotel is centrally located for touring Rome and is delightfully decorated. Our room, though small by American standards, was clean and delightful, with a charming balcony. Our breakfast was delicious. But what made the hotel a very special place to stay was the staff. We were all first time visitors to Rome,and everyone at the hotel was very kind to us, even helping us out of a jam or two, due to our own misunderstanding of the language. I somewhat expected to be treated with big city indifference while in Rome. Instead, we were treated warmly, as welcome visitors to a most gracious and charming inn. I would highly recommend the Hotel Modigliani and we will stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Modigliani in August for 3 nights. We had a wonderful room, a Superior Triple overlooking the city and St. Peter's Basilica. The view was absolutely breath taking. Our room was rather large and accomadated two adults and two small children with room to spare for the kids to play. Our room and washroom were cleaned everyday and were spotless. The staff at the hotel were always very pleasant and helpful. They arranged a private driver to take us to all the sights for two days. Breakfast was very enjoyable every morning and the cappuccino was fantastic! It is a small hotel with a lot of character and charm. The location couldn't be better. It is close to many of the major sites. Via Veneto is the next street over and has many fabulous restaurants. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Modigliani again. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: RRamanathan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Modigliani for three days earlier in the month. We found the rooms comfortable and more importantly the staff very kind and accomodating.
