They were very responsive to every request we made (there were a few since we were travelling with a small baby) and also had great restaurant suggestions. The only downside was that we could hear a lot of the moises from the other rooms around us. But overall the location, rooms and the staff made it a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charmer in a walk to all location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a small hotel with a good location and helpful staff, this is the place. Like most reasonably priced Rome hotels, the rooms are small, but meticulously clean. the staff is what sets it apart. Everyone was extremely helpful in getting us information and pointing us in the right direction. It is a good value for the price. If you prefer a large hotel with lots of amenities, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Red Flag and Warning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The ratings indicate that the Modigliani is a great little hotel with location in the heart of the city. It seems to us that the real test of a great hotel, apart from its location, is the care and service it renders to its guests, particularly during a time of difficulty. We can tell you that the Modigliani did not stand by us when we discovered on our return flight to Canada recently, that we had left our camera with 160 photos representing our most precious memories of our two week trip to Italy. The camera was left in room #202 the morning of our departure Aug.20/05. We know with absolute certainty that it was placed on the bed as one of us was to have packed it in our carry on bag. Regrettably, this did not happen. The camera was never found and the hotel reaction including that of the owners Mr. & Mrs. Di Tillo was that we must have made a mistake; the camera was likely left in a museum, a taxi, etc. We are over 100 % sure the camera was left on the bed. This is a small family run hotel, 23 rooms. It should have a clear policy of zero tolerance for theft. Unfortunately, the Modigliani's message seems to be "the boss will protect his staff no matter what" or "if in doubt, "the customer is wrong". In this day and age when travellers are very concerned about safety and security, we have to ask ourselves why we would ever consider staying at a hotel whose owners are unwilling to be sympathetic when special needs arise. Why take the risk?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Hotel in the ideal location to see all that Rome has to offer!!! Close to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Second time was fantastic too!”
Reviews.Author: artgirl23
Reviews.Content: WE love the hotel Modigliani... there is such a nice way about the staff and presentation. This time we had a balcony that looked out onto Rome. They had a great little newsletter with things to do, places to eat and trivia. I especially loved that they included a blurb about each staff member (right down to the cleaners). It was FANTASTIC... its like coming home again. Loved the seafood place... so romatic and La Scala was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with Hotel Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Modigliani and were very pleased with the accomodations. The bathroom is modern and sparklingly clean. We had a very spacious room (hard to come by in Europe). What made the hotel so exceptional was the view. Because it is on one of the hills, it is highup. Our room had a large balcony with a spectacular view of Rome, St Peter's Bascilica and Emmanuelle's Palace. It is in the main part of Rome, but about 10-15 minutes uphill past the Spanish Steps. You can walk to all the sites, but it is a little further than some hotels. The benefit is the spectacular view and being in a more upscale residential neighborhood instead of a "tourist trap" area. We thought walking a little further was worth the more quiet feel, the more Italian feel, and the view. The staff were also exceptionally polite and helpful. Breakfast was filling, delicious. The cappachino coffee was great.

Reviews.Title: “The Modigliani - a really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Modigliani for a few days at the beginning of July. We were immediately impressed by the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness and clearness of the room (air conditioning great in the heat). That friendliness extended to genuine helpfulness and a willingness to be of assistance at any time, with bookings, reservations etc. The location of the hotel is great - we were looking across at the convent next door - could it be more peaceful? The hotel was very quick in its response to our initial email. We found it paid to check the special offers on the website before going - we did find it at the last minute but also found a very good early Summer deal being offered through the website. The London bombings occurred while we were there and we were impressed by the fact that there was a note for us from the owners on our return to the hotel that evening, offering assistance in whatever form we might need it, should we need it. As it happened, we were not flying through London but the thought was lovely. The owners' Newsletter, which each guest receives, is a lovely idea and gives good information, an idea of the philosophy behing the running of the hotel and is a personal touch which is quite endearing.

Reviews.Title: “Service at it's best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a delight. The site was excellent, right where we wanted to be but on a street away from the sounds of traffic. The staff was generous with their advice, ideas and their intelligence. Service was outstanding. The rooms were clean and well cared for. The breakfast was lovely. I would return there in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the bustle of rome”
Reviews.Author: chocs1
Reviews.Content: this is a charming hotel just off the piazza barberini.located ina quiet street as well which is a bonus when escaping the bustle of rome it only has 23 rooms and is well maintained. the rooms are spotlessely clean, as is the rest of the hotel. the decor is simple and not fussy. the room i had had a great view and was light and airy. the rooms are small,not bad for europe, and the bathroom only has a shower. the breakfast wsa a typical contintential one-croissants, cereal, yoghurt etc... but was pleasant enough. you could either eat in the breakfast room or on the garden terrace. the staff are friendly and helpful-you even get a newsletter upon arrival with tips on what to do in rome. the location is excellent, within walking distance of allthe major sites, apart from the vatican. there is a subway station roundthe corner as well and there are excellent local restaurants in the vicinty. i would definately return to this hotel and recommend it to others. a gem in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Modigliani staff makes it feel like home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for a week at the end of May, for our daughter's wedding. We picked the Modigliani mostly because of the reviews we found at this site, and because it is listed in a Karen Brown guide, which I had found to be very good in the past. The location is great- we walked everywhere from there. The hotel is charming, intimate, unpretentious, and spotlessly clean. The rides to and from the airport- arranged by the staff- made arrival and departure hassle-free. The book of walking tours written by the owners was really valuable. But best of all are the the people- owners and staff. They deserve much more than 5 stars. even before we arrived, we could sense how nice they were in the way they responded to the many questions I asked. And from the moment we arrived, they were caring, attentive, warm, lovely. Every one of them made us feel welcome and comfortable. I really didn't want to leave, and will definitely return to the Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: ucallmekat
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Hotel Modigliani. Great location, staff, and service...hotel was very clean. The only negative was the breakfast became a little monotonous after the second day. They need to change it up a bit. Also, the breakfast room did not have enough seating and would be overcrowded some days. Great place, though!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location; Great Service; Well-Priced”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoCool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Modigiliani for 5 days in June and would highly recommend this property. The location is unbeatable, the reception staff very helpful (and spoke fluent English) and accomodating, the rooms very clean. The staff was helpful with restaurant recommendations and they arranged for a driver to the Rome airport at a reasonable price given the very early hour on a Sunday morning departure. Although the room we had was small, it was tastefully decorated and had a small balcony. Karen Brown's review and recommendation was accurate and reliable. We would definitely recommend this property to others!

Reviews.Title: “We recommend the Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Modigliani from 6/12-6/20. The room, a triple, was clean and pleasant. The excellent location and staff offset the rather small room size. The Vastour tours which can be booked at the hotel were very convenient, they will pick you up at the hotel. The guides on these tours ranged from good to extraordinary and only one was mediocre. We enjoyed all the neighborhood restaurants recommended by the Modigliani staff. And it was lovely to see the beautiful coffee table books on Modigliani, one of our favorite artists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Modigliani was a great choice for our trip to Rome. As others have mentioned, the location is excellent - very near the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, Via Veneto, a subway stop, etc. etc. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. The rooms are small, but clean. The small side street that the hotel is on is dark at night, but we felt very safe. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful. Ideal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We searched a long time for a hotel for our Roman trip, finally choosing Modigliani and we totally made the right decision. The hotel is in a great location, near Piazza Barberini (w/ a Metro stop) and the Spanish Steps and surrounded by good shops and affordable, quality restaurants. The hotel is clean and modern with a friendly, though small, staff. The hotel doesn't have many rooms, which we found a good thing. We received a free room upgrade since it was our honeymoon and the room was spacious, comfortable and had an outrageous view of the city. The hotel may be hard to find (it's on the left side of a side street off Barberini) but is totally worth tracking down and enjoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: AMEM66
Reviews.Content: This was a very nicely situated hotel, very convenient to all that Rome has to offer. Rooms were a bit small, but we didn't spend much time in the rooms anyway! Breakfast was very good also, and the taxi service they provided to and from the airport was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SunglassKing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Modigliani on May 29th this year and were really disappointed we were only spending one night there. The position is superb, our room was excellent and all the staff extremely helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ciao2005
Reviews.Content: Our recent two night stay at the Hotel Modigliani in Rome was fabulous, The staff is informative and friendly. They make you feel like a part of the family. They gave us two restaurant recommendations, both spectacular and moderately priced, and right around the corner from the Hotel. No wonder this small (23 Room) hotel is listed by Karen Brown. Our next trip to Rome will include the Hotel Modigliani. No doubt. Mary W., Indianapolis, IN USA

Reviews.Title: “Terrific find, excellent service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel based on Frommer's reviews. By chance, our stay coincided with the election of the new pope and all of the influx of people to Rome. What a great find! Staff service is excellent; rooms are in excellent condition with up-to-date decorating; bathroom electricity accomodates US 110 current without adapter; mini fridge, tv, phone. We had one of the larger rooms on the top floor and it was huge! It even had a sofa and two side chairs. Balcony view was mostly of street below, but was charming! Breakfast was nice...pastries, breads, croissant, meats & cheeses, cereals, juice, milk, coffee, and espresso/cappuccino. The owners of this hotel truly care about their guests and the service they provide. Very convenient to easy to use Metro (subway), definately recommend tours that hotel can book for you (Vastours), as well as private car to airport! Many restaurants convenient - recommend Pastarito - great value, good food. Located in Piazza Barberini, walking distance to Spanish steps and excellent shopping. Hotel in same neighborhood as numerous 5*'s as well as embassies and consulates, great place for evening walk. 1 block to internet cafe, and money exchange, tabacceri (stamps & postcards).

Reviews.Title: “A great, small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a week in Rome. We were fortunate enough to stay six nights at the Modigliani Hotel in the heart of Rome. We had read many reviews of this hotel, some of which were posted on this site. So we knew to expect a great experience at the Modigliani. If fact it exceeded our expectations. The room was spotless and quiet; the location could not have been better, just off Piazza Barberini; and the staff was superb, very friendly, helpful, and treated us like family. Whenever we think of Rome we will smile as we remember this wonderful hotel and staff. We highly recommend the Modigliani.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jimbox
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we could have hoped for. The room was tasteful and large. The staff was excellent and very helpful. The breakfast was good. Room 602, top floor, has a view of Vatican city and Emmanuel II memorial. The view from the balcony of the city just made our visit that much better, especially at sunset each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lawyerbob
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel based on reviews from this website, and we were very pleased. It is on a quiet street, which we appreciated. I never realized how loud and busy a city could be. The staff is very helpful, but we found that their suggestions on restaurants were lacking--way too touristy for our tastes. On the plus side, all were close by. We had better luck with the restaurants we found on our own. Also, the hotel is located up a rather steep hill, and there are virtually no sidewalks. As with many other parts in Rome, you must be careful walking since the people drive crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to Rome, Italy and stayed at the Hotel Modigliani, which was recommended by one of our guide books. We had a very enjoyable stay with only a few minor problems. We had a standard room with a king size bed. The room was a little smaller then what we expected, but it was clean and well maintained. We were able to open the windows in our room to see a view of the quiet street on which the hotel is located. The blackout shutters were great especially on the first day we arrived experiencing a little jet lag. We really enjoyed the European breakfast served every morning in either the Breakfast room or the Patio/Garden area. I especially enjoyed the gourmet coffee/espresso/cappuccino prepared fresh every morning by request. The Patio/Garden area was a great area to relax in after a day of sightseeing. Our only complaint was with the wake-up call on the first day that we never received, and the thin walls that allowed all the hallway noise into our room every morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Modigliani”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the Hotel Modigliani on line. We were going to Cairo and needed a hotel in Rome on our layover back to the US. We also wanted to stay near The Spanish Steps. Reluctantly, I told him we had better book this hotel. First of all, they were the only one to respond to my email. So we booked it in hopes that it would be alright. Well, were we ever surprised. What a cute little hideaway. Since I waited too long to book it, they were only able to accomodate us for the 1st night and then our 3rd and 4th nights but they were so KIND as to find us another hotel right down the street for our 2nd night. The employees were all so NICE, so INFORMATIVE and HELPFUL. The hotel was spotlessly clean, so quaint with wonderful views of the city. It is on a very quiet street off of the Piazza Barberini and VERY conveniently located. We walked all the way to the Colosseum one day with no problem. It's a perfect spot. We are planning another trip back to Rome this summer and you can be sure that we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to visit the sights by foot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel Modigliani in March and had a fantastic time. We were recommended the hotel by friends and e-mailed the hotel to find out more information. The response was almost immediate and the whole booking was completed via e-mail. The staff arranged for a taxi to meet us at the airport for our night flight which was great and saved us the trouble of trying to arrange our own (as many people were). The hotel was placed in a quiet street that was within easy walking distance of the majority of sights (Spanish steps, trevi fountain, pantheon 5-15 minutes). The walk to the Coliseum was slightly further and the walk from the Vatican about 30-40 minutes but none the less both pleasant. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful in recommending routes to the sights and restaurants nearby. The hotel was very clean with a fairly spacious bathroom. Breakfast was continental style with plenty of choice. Boyfriend proposed at the Trevi at night! (Definately better to vist at night than day as all lit up) so we will be returning on our anniversary and will definately be staying at the Hotel Modigliani again.

Reviews.Title: “A tiny gem among ancient relics”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel is a true gem among many of the over-priced, tourist hotels spread around the city of Rome. The hotel staff (all English-speaking) is small, like the hotel. But they are "large" on friendliness and attentiveness. Each and every staff person, from front desk reception to housekeeping and dining room attendants, were extremely friendly and warm. The location is perfect---walking distance to Via Venetto and Spanish Steps, but tucked away on a quiet street---away from the noise and congestion of other high traffic/touristy areas. The location is also steps away from the Piazza Barberini (with an amazing water fountain by Bernini), plus a Metro stop and large internet cafe. The standard rooms are quite tiny, but clean and thoughtfully appointed. The spacious superior rooms (1 queen/1 twin bed or 1 queen/2 twins) are the way to go. They have charming balconies with tiny cafe tables/chairs, with amazing views of the city. These are great rooms for families or couples who just want room to spread out. The continental breakfast (included w/ rate) had many offerings, including yummy espresso or cappucino made by the friendly staff (from an industrial machine). In a city where hotel, food, and attractions can cost you an arm and a leg, this is one place that is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent Small Hotel with first-rate helpful staff, Rooms very clean and nicely decorated Recent reviewer mentioned small bathroom, which is correct, but adequate and very nicely decorated. Note: no bath only shower Located on a quiet street 5 minutes walk from Spanish Steps, also generally central as we walked to all the main sites Very good value when compared with the general price of hotel in Roma

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually live in Geneva, Switzerland. We spent four unforgettable days in Rome and greatly appreciated our stay at Hotel Modigliani. The owners, Giulia and Marco were very kind, friendly and professional. Hotel Modigliani is a small and comfortable place to stay. It is very well located and quite close to famous sightseeing areas and places of cultural interest. We strongly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modigliani: nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nicely located, very well kept hotel in Rome, with clean and comfortable rooms and with a helpful staff, we strongly recommend Hotel Modigliani. We live in Geneva, Switzerland and found it on the internet. We spent five wonderful days in Rome in this hotel. The prices are reasonable, as they include also a great breakfast. The two owners of this hotel are genuinely interested in their guests’ comfort. We are a couple of Swiss who live in Geneva and who, for years, have visited a great deal of cities in Europe and this is the first 3 star hotel that we can recommend without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In planning our first trip to Rome (it was to be our first trip to europe as well), we read many reviews of potential hotels in Rome. It's funny how some folks seem to love a particular hotel, while others can find fault in the smallest things. There was some negative feedback about the Modigliani and frankly, I don't understand where these people stayed. It certainly wasn't this hotel! My wife and I had the time of our lives! We stayed in room 602, which is actually a very large room, big bed and room for two sofas as well. The balcony is to die for! The view of Rome looking south from this balcony is breathtaking. If you can't book this room, the hotel is still the place we'd stay if we ever got back there. The shower was small, but I still was able to use it and I am a big guy! The staff was very helpful and friendly. They spoke english as well, but seemed delighted at any attempts, however feeble, we made at using the few italian words we knew. The staff become like family after a while, no kidding. We ate breakfast in the hotel every morning (included) which was fun as we could talk to the other guests. We're not big breakfast eaters, but there certainly was enough to fill us up until lunch. Rachel will make you a great cappicino, or latte, and the selection of food is good. The hotel is centrally located on a small street, near Piazzo Barbarinni, which means you can easily get on the subway or bus to anywhere you need to get to in the city. We were able to walk to everything we wanted to see, except for the vatican - we took the subway. We would spend hours walking around and if we got too tired, we would take a cab back to the hotel, which never cost more than maybe 8 Euros, no matter how far afield we had wandered. One of the most pleasant restaurants is right down the street, on Villa Della Purificazione (the same street the hotel is on). It's called Restaurant Barbabrinni. A very small family operated spot with extremely friendly folks. Don't be put off by the smallness of the restaurant. Once you're seated, you become part of their family. Again, the Hotel Modigliano is a jem. Chiao!

Reviews.Title: “yuch”
Reviews.Author: shellm
Reviews.Content: Had a room here with broken A/C and the sun made the room very hot...in October. Breakfast was mediocre, front desk could not make change for me for 2 days??? Our room also smelled bad and they were not able to move us.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are all right!”
Reviews.Author: Tricky49
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just come back from a 4-night stay at the Modigliani. We booked this hotel on the strength of previous reviews and we were not disappointed. Booking over the internet was easy with quick responses. We also took advantage of the owner booking a taxi to meet us at the airport for 55 euro. Well, worth it. We stayed in room 602 (superior double at 208 euro per night) on the top floor at the rear with a large balcony and rooftop views, including St Peters. Having read about small hotel rooms in Rome we were really surprised at its size, about 25 feet by 15 feet. Large (comfortable) double bed and two large 3 seater sofas were comfortably accommodated in the room to give you an idea of its size. Being on the top floor and at the back of the hotel meant we had none of the noises mentioned in some of the other reviews. Excellent shower. Continental breakfast was more then adequate, but I wish European hotels would put tea/coffee making facilities in their rooms! Location is good, we walked everywhere. About 35 minutes to St Peter's, Spanish steps just around the corner, Trevi fountain 10 minutes away and Colliseum 25 minutes. Of course, there are lots of other places (churches!!) to keep you occupied. The church of Santa Maria Maggiore, near the station, is also worth a visit. There are some good eating places near the hotel recommended by the owners, La Scala, 2 minutes just around the corner and Ristorante Tullio on via San Nicola da Tolentino, about 5/6 minutes. If you can find them we can also recommend the following restaurants where we had lunches: La Taverna degli Amici, Piazza Margana Barge Restaurant Pizzeria, Piazza dell'Oro Tratoria Tritone, Via Dei Maroniti. Most of the restaurants mentioned have websites so you ought to be able to find them on Google and check them out before you go. If we go back to Rome we would certainly stay at the Mogdigliani again and would recommend it to others. Richard Atherton

Reviews.Title: “Just what was required”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modigliani in Rome offers everything one needs assuming you are not after a 5* facility. It is very well located and walkable to nearly all the main sites to be seen in the City. The staff were more than helpful in arranging museum vists, restaurant bookings and taxis. They also took an interest in our visit. My wife and I would definitely go back to the hotel on the basis a return visit to Rome is on our agenda for some time in the future. It is much more fun to stay in an hotel where you feel part of the family. One very small point re the breakfast - plain croissants would have been welcome as would a boiled egg!
